job_description:
About the job
            
 
We are seeking a brilliant, motivated and committed Senior Insights & Strategy Consultant to join our team in Barcelona.  A Piece of Pie is a global strategy consultancy on a mission to rethink how businesses make decisions. We combine the human sciences with business acumen to arrive at ground-breaking solutions to improve people‚Äôs lives.  We are seeking a capable professional willing to grow professionally by supporting our global clients to find new ways to face high risk and challenges with high uncertainty and craft new avenues to help our clients differentiate in today‚Äôs competitive business world.  About the role At A Piece of Pie, we work in small, self-directed teams. As a Senior Strategy Consultant, you will be responsible for leading your teams, start to finish, through the successful execution of client projects. This may include scoping and designing the project, supporting the day-to-day work of your team, advising clients, and partnering with a manager to further develop a client relationship.  Responsibilities  Project Management  Independently run mid-to-large scale projects that combine qualitative and quantitative research, data analysis, insight development, and strategy development Thoughtfully design research to fit client objectives and constraints ‚Äì drawing on ethnography, foresight, and quant methods as appropriate Lead the translation of research into business relevant insight, strategy and value propositions, and further, into brand, product, and service platforms Serve as a trusted advisor to clients Ability navigate the unexpected Attention to detail to ensure quality in everything we do Able to identify and communicate highly actionable insights and strategies Ensure that projects are delivered within scope, on time, at high quality, and within budget 
 Business and Practice   Own the development of pitches and proposals for incoming RFPs Help develop our portfolio of methodologies and best practices. 
 People and Culture   Manage the distribution and pace of project work, balancing output with the wellbeing of your team Create an inspiring and inclusive Team dynamic Coach and develop team members using constructive feedback Foster the values of an intellectually ambitious and humble culture 
 Qualifications  The ideal candidate:   Knowledgeable and passionate about the intersection of business and social sciences Expertise in on cultural insight & foresight, quantitative research 4+ years of experience in a strategy consultancy (e.g. business strategy, innovation strategy, marketing strategy, brand strategy) Including 2+ years independently managing complex, multi-stage projects Including 2+ years in an advisory capacity to senior client stakeholders Including 2+ years of managing small teams multidisciplinary experts and a proven ability to develop, inspire, and collaborate with diverse teams Degree in a social science (e.g. anthropology) or business discipline (e.g. MBA) Deep knowledge of any of the following verticals: healthcare, consumer electronics, tech, finance, luxury, automotive, FMCG Proficiency in qualitative research methods and data management (e.g. ethnography, cultural & semiotic analysis, signal scanning) Expert in quantitative research methods and data management (e.g. surveys, market sizing, social listening), with deep knowledge of advanced statistical techniques (e.g. segmentation analysis, multivariate analysis, predictive modeling, regression analysis, conjoint analysis) English and Spanish fluency and German or French a big plus Able to handle ambiguity and divergent ideas Openness to new methodologies and processes 
 What we offer   Work at the office for the first 3 months, after that you can take advantage of a flexible hybrid work setup Exposure to high-impact projects with leading companies of the world Exciting variety of challenges from exploratory research to business innovation A fast-growing consultancy where your input and expertise plays part in steering the company forward 
 How to Apply  Please submit your resume/CV and cover letter (required) to careers@piecepie.com

About the job
            
 
‚ÄûWir sind ein innovatives und dynamisches Team, das kundenzentrierte Beratung mit einer Can-Do-Mentalit√§t verbindet.‚Äú Wir wollen gemeinsam mit dir zusammen Marketing-Organisationen nachhaltig transformieren.Wie wir das erreichen? Unser Ziel ist es, Unternehmen in den Fokus ihrer Konsument*innen zu r√ºcken und datenbasiertes Wachstum zu generieren. Daf√ºr begleiten wir unsere Kund*innen ganzheitlich: von der Strategiekonzeption bis hin zur erfolgreichen Umsetzung.Was das f√ºr uns bedeutet? Wir entwerfen kundenzentrierte Strategien und schaffen mithilfe einer effektiven Technologie- und Datenarchitektur sowie durch Datenanalysen messbaren Erfolg. Aufgrund unserer Erfahrung und Leidenschaft erkennen wir dabei Marketing-Trends fr√ºhzeitig und leben genau die Agilit√§t vor, die zur Umsetzung unserer Visionen notwendig ist.Bist du dabei? Hey, bei uns bist du genau richtig! Wir sch√§tzen deine individuelle Perspektive und freuen uns √ºber Bewerbungen unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Nationalit√§t, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter oder sexueller Orientierung. Bei uns hast du die gleichen Chancen wie alle anderen, denn wir setzen uns aktiv f√ºr Vielfalt und Chancengleichheit ein.Dein Profil passt nicht 100%ig auf unsere Stellenausschreibung? ‚Äì das macht nichts.Wir sind gespannt auf deine Bewerbung!Deine Aufgabe bei uns: ganzheitlich & zukunftsorientiert Du unterst√ºtzt aktiv ‚Äì bei der Umsetzung von Beratungsprojekten im Bereich der digitalen Marketing-Transformation.Du identifizierst Trends ‚Äì f√ºhrst eigenverantwortlich quantitative und qualitative (Potential-) Analysen durch, leitest daraus Optimierungsma√ünahmen ab und unterst√ºtzt die gewonnen Erkenntnisse in innovative Strategien zu √ºberf√ºhren.Du zeigst hohe Lernbereitschaft und Engagement ‚Äì um deine F√§higkeiten im Bereich der digitalen Marketing-Transformation zu entwickeln und zu vertiefen.Du bringst frische Ideen und innovative Impulse ‚Äì um aktiv zur ganzheitlichen Weiterentwicklung von bynd beizutragen.
Darum bist du die beste Wahl: Berater*in & Vision√§r*in Du verf√ºgst √ºber ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Diplom- oder Masterstudium.Du hast mindestens ein Jahr Berufserfahrung in der Beratung oder im Bereich Marketing.Du bringst die F√§higkeit zur analytischen und konzeptionellen Denkweise mit, sch√§tzt die Zusammenarbeit im Team und bist in der Lage, komplexe Zusammenh√§nge schnell zu erfassen.Dein Sprachgef√ºhl und deine zwischenmenschlichen F√§higkeiten sind ausgepr√§gt, und du besitzt fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von PowerPoint und Excel.Du beherrschst Deutsch und Englisch flie√üend, sowohl m√ºndlich als auch schriftlich.Selbstverst√§ndlich ‚Äì aber zur Sicherheit erw√§hnt ‚Äì erwarten wir von einem Consultant ein hohes Ma√ü an Verantwortungsbewusstsein, Belastbarkeit, Serviceorientierung, Teamplayer-Mentalit√§t und einen professionellen Umgang mit Kunden und Partnern.
Darum sind wir die beste Wahl: Entwicklung & SelbstverwirklichungBei bynd [b…™Ààj…índ] m√∂chten wir, dass du gemeinsam mit uns w√§chst. Deinen M√∂glichkeiten sind bei uns keine Grenzen gesetzt ‚Äì sowohl fachlich als auch pers√∂nlich.Da wir mit Unternehmen aller Gr√∂√üe und aus unterschiedlichsten Branchen zusammenarbeiten, bieten wir dir eine breite Auswahl an abwechslungsreichen und anspruchsvollen Aufgaben. Bei uns kannst du kontinuierlich neue Erfahrungen sammeln und dich in spannenden Projekten entfalten. Deinen pers√∂nlichen Entwicklungspfad gestaltest du dabei in deiner eigenen Geschwindigkeit. Was wir dir daf√ºr bieten: Die M√∂glichkeit, die strategische Entwicklung von bynd proaktiv mitzugestalten.Kurze Entscheidungswege und eine offene Unternehmenskultur, denn wir arbeiten √ºber alle Positionen hinweg stets auf Augenh√∂he.Gelebte Zusammenarbeit durch au√üergew√∂hnliche Events, ein gro√üartiges Team und eine ‚ÄûOffene T√ºr‚Äú Atmosph√§re.Mobile-Office M√∂glichkeit, bei der du bis zu 80% mobil arbeiten kannst.32 Tage Urlaub und flexibler √úberstundenausgleich.

About the job
            
 
MissionAre you passionate about the transformative power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and eager to lead strategic initiatives? If so, Inetum Consulting invites you to join our dynamic team as an AI Lead Strategy Consultant.At Inetum Consulting, we're on the forefront of AI innovation. We're seeking a visionary leader to collaborate with our customer-facing teams and drive AI initiatives to new heights.As an AI Lead Strategy Consultant, you'll be at the helm of innovation. Your responsibilities will include: Generating innovative business ideas and translating them into MVP/POC and projects.Staying ahead of market evolutions to identify emerging opportunities.Articulating the substantial business value our customers achieve with Inetum's AI solutions.Representing Inetum at professional conferences through engaging presentations and discussions.Collaborating with specialists from diverse disciplines to craft impactful strategies.Assuming a leadership role in delivering assignments that push the boundaries of AI capabilities.
ProfileWe're looking for a candidate who embodies: A holistic approach, blending business acumen with technology expertise.A deep passion for AI and its potential to revolutionize industries.The ability to work seamlessly with our customer-facing teams to identify and develop new opportunities.Strong communication skills, enabling you to convey complex ideas to diverse audiences.A knack for producing thought leadership materials, including blog articles, whitepapers, and videos.An in-depth understanding of the Machine Learning ecosystem and its business applications.Over 10 years of experience in consulting or software & technology.An advanced degree in Statistics, Data Science, Economics, or a related field.Exceptional analytical, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills.A keen grasp of the AI ecosystem.Commercial savvy and the ability to build trust with clients through expertise and a customer-centric approach.
OUR OFFER The opportunity to have a meaningful job where you can make a difference.The chance to continuously evolve as a professional, coupled with a variety of training opportunities.Relevant career opportunities to get you where you want to be, with the IT knowledge you need.Inetum-Realdolmen wants you to find a balance between work and private life by offering flexible hours, satellite offices, home working and an informal no-nonsense environment.32 days of annual leave, because life isn‚Äôt all about working.Forget about the miles: we provide you with a company car and a national fuel card.Group insurance and hospitalization insurance, because we care about you.And of course, we also offer a gross salary. One which is optimized from a net perspective for our employees!
Interested? Questions? For more information, contact your recruiter Pino Amico directly via pino.amico@inetum-realdolmen.world OrganizationInetum Realdolmen, a member of the European Inetum Group with approximately 1,950 highly qualified employees, provides strategic, tactical and operational ICT solutions for over 1,000 customers throughout the Benelux. In every cooperation, Realdolmen realizes the potential of people and organizations and strives to keep ICT human. We are driven by technological innovation, but we advance at the speed of your ambition, results-focused and managing fundamental change.Our company motto "New Challenges, New Ideas" reflects this.An employer you really want to work for!Not only is Realdolmen a no-nonsense, solid, stable and experienced company with great in-house knowledge and expertise, but we also put our employees first: every individual receives the attention they need. ‚ÄòHeart for People' is more than just words for us ‚Äì it's one of our very core values.Satellite offices, extensive training opportunities, work-life balance, competence reviews and career opportunities: these are no empty promises for us. Our organization attaches great importance to diversity. We guarantee an objective selection process, whereby candidates are tested and selected solely on the basis of their qualities and skills.With us it's all about you!

About the job
            
 
Heb jij ervaring in het leiden van strategie sessies en kun jij leiders helpen bij het identificeren van de √©chte problemen binnen een team? Bezit jij de inhoudelijke kennis om verbeteringen voor de leiderschapsstijl aan te dragen bij toonaangevende klanten en een duidelijke strategie voor hen neer te zetten? Lees dan verder!Wat ga je doen als Strategy & Leadership Consultant? Leiden van strategische sessies waarbij leiders en hun team worden gefaciliteerd en uitgedaagdCre√´ren van een omgeving waarin een team de √©chte diepgaande problematiek bespreekbaar maakt en kan komen tot een concreet strategisch planZelfstandig uitvoeren van kleine en middelgrote projecten bij toonaangevende, vaak wereldwijd opererende klantenBesproken uitkomsten vertalen naar een lange termijn roadmap en planningProject management; overzicht houden, de voortgang van het project monitoren en continue bijsturenOpbouwen en onderhouden van nieuwe en bestaande klantrelatiesBegeleiden van junior consultantsJe werkt altijd in teamverband en in nauwe samenwerking met een senior consultant of partner
Wat breng je mee als Strategy & Leadership Consultant? Minimaal 7 jaar werkervaring binnen strategie, management of business consultingUitstekende strategische en analytische vaardighedenUitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands, zowel mondeling als schriftelijkVermogen om passende methodieken in te zetten en de juiste vragen te stellen om problemen op strategisch en leiderschapsniveau op te lossenDe drive om een klant √©cht verder te helpen en complexe problemen te doorzienGroot aanpassingsvermogen, je bent in staat om snel te kunnen schakelenVermogen om onafhankelijk te denken, je wacht niet af totdat een ander jou vertelt wat je moet doenIn staat om het √©chte gesprek te voeren en om de verbinding met de klant te makenMoed om jezelf echt te ontwikkelenBereidheid om te reizen in zowel binnen- als buitenland
Wat bieden wij? Eigen verantwoordelijkheid en autonomieEen marktconform salarisSalaris dat wordt aangevuld met een bonus, 13e maand en pensioenopbouwFlexibel mobiliteitsbudget of een auto van de zaakEen aanstelling voor een jaar met uitzicht op een vast contractEen gezonde work-life balanceEen mentor bij wie je altijd terecht kuntTraining en opleiding
De wereld van BolsterBolster is een boutique consultancy voor leiders. Bij Bolster werk je voor wereldwijd toonaangevende beursgenoteerde bedrijven, waarbij een unieke aanpak wordt toegepast. Dit doe je bij de klant, thuis of vanuit ons fijne kantoor met een betrokken en positief team. Daarbij vind je bij ons een open, positieve en no-nonsense sfeer. Het teamgevoel wordt versterkt door gezamenlijke activiteiten die regelmatig worden georganiseerd, zoals externe teamdagen, team trainingen, strand sessies, een jaarlijkse barbecue of nieuwjaarsdiner!Ontwikkeling van jouw leiderschapBij Bolster dragen wij niet alleen bij aan de persoonlijke ontwikkeling van onze klanten. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij in jouw kracht durft te staan en geven jou graag de ruimte bij klanten om te laten zien wat je kan. Heb jij de moed om jezelf echt te ontwikkelen? Stuur je CV en motivatiebrief naar jobs@teambolster.com of solliciteer via de site:https://teambolster.com/vacature/strategy-leadership-consultant/.

About the job
            
 
Hello! üëãWe are ClimateView, a climate tech and advisory company on the mission to help the world‚Äôs cities on their climate transition journey. We offer a unique opportunity to play a key role in tackling climate change at scale. Maybe you are already working with city climate strategy, but have this feeling that you want to make a bigger impact and help more cities reach their goals, faster. With ClimateOS in your hands, this is possible!The positionAs a Climate Strategy Advisor, your primary focus is to help cities succeed in their climate transition. You will meet our customers, the city climate heroes, as a natural part of our sales process when you set them up for success in driving change in their city. You will help them get onboarded on our platform and make sure they use it to its fullest potential, including learning from other cities and to share best practices between cities. As the primary contact for a portfolio of cities you will also be the voice of the customer to our product team, to help us improve and evolve our product. A successful long-term partnership with our customers is your target, and your subject matter expertise combined with your relationship building and result oriented personality is key to success.We believe the best way to meet the challenges we face is with a highly skilled, diverse and passionate team. You will be joining the commercial team and work side by side with inspiring colleagues, such as Orren (Director, Community), Yasmine (Customer Success Manager) to mention a few, and with support from Tomer, our founder. With your base in Sweden, you will join a fully remote and closely-knit team of bright individuals, passionate about their work and our joint mission.Qualifications & Skills  Climate strategy: Minimum 5 years‚Äô of experience from working with climate/sustainability strategy or planning.  Management consultancy: Minimum 3 years of experience from working as a consultant, with responsibility for handling own clients.  Stakeholder Management: Ability to lead, prioritize and work with tight deadlines, as well as coaching clients and adding new perspectives.  Interpersonal skills: Highly skilled relationship builder with strong collaboration skills and coaching skills.  Communication skills: Excellent written and presentation skills in both English and Swedish, and also French or German is a plus. 
About ClimateViewCities are home to the majority of emissions, people and resource use. The climate transition is an enormous challenge. Yet, it‚Äôs a chance not just to build green, but great cities. It‚Äôs ClimateView‚Äôs mission to help cities turn this challenge into an opportunity.The company was founded in Sweden in 2018, and today we are a passionate team of over 40 individuals ‚Äì from science, policy, consulting and tech ‚Äì across Europe. Alongside dozens of cities, regional and national authorities, we‚Äôve developed a framework, process and platform for a systematic approach to the transition. In each person we hire we seek commitment and curiosity to deeply understand the ecosystem we are a part of and the challenges we want to help cities to overcome.Interested?We look forward to receiving your application. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we consider applications on a rolling basis.

About the job

Wir messen und analysieren die Energienutzung, um aussagekr√§ftige Analytics f√ºr das Management von intelligenten Netzen und Infrastrukturen zu erstellen, die es Versorgungsunternehmen und Verbrauchern erm√∂glichen, den Energieverbrauch zu senken. About the job
            
 
Sei innovativ, finde schneller als andere die Antworten auf ungel√∂ste Fragen und leiste analytisch wie konzeptionell Au√üergew√∂hnliches! Das ist genau dein Ding?Dann lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der du den Status quo herausforderst und innovative Strategien entwickelst, die beweisen, dass du verstanden hast, wie sich Technologien auf Branchen- und Gesch√§ftsmodelle auswirken.Das erwartet dichDu nutzt strategischen Weitblick und fundierten Einblicke in vorherrschende Marktgegebenheiten, um bestehende Unternehmensstrategien, -strukturen und -abl√§ufe vor Ort zu analysieren und in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Kunden branchenspezifische und umsetzungsf√§hige Konzepte zu entwickeln. Hierzu nutzt du fr√ºhzeitig neue Markt-, Industrie- und Technologietrends.Dazu unterst√ºtzt du unternehmensweite Transformations- und Reorganisationsprogramme und gestaltest und optimierst Gesch√§ftsprozesse bzw. ganze Gesch√§ftsmodelle. Hierbei setzt du dein funktionales Experten-Know-how entlang der gesamten Wertsch√∂pfungskette ein und st√ºtzt deine Empfehlungen auf datenbasierte Analysen.Du definierst gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden den Weg zu flexiblen Strukturen und √ºberf√ºhrst disruptive Trends (z.B. Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence) in Strategien f√ºr das digitale Zeitalter.Dar√ºber hinaus nutzt du dein Fachwissen und deine innovativen Ideen, um potenzielle Kunden von einer Zusammenarbeit mit uns zu √ºberzeugen.Mit dem entsprechenden Erfahrungshintergrund √ºbernimmst dubei uns schnell Projekt- und F√ºhrungsverantwortung.Darauf freuen wir uns√úberdurchschnittlich guter Master an einer Universit√§t (Zusatzqualifikation in Form von MBA oder Promotion von Vorteil)Erfahrung in der Strategieberatung oder in einer strategischen Funktion eines renommierten Industrieunternehmens inklusive (Teil-)Projekt- und fachlicher TeamleitungSehr gutes Know-how in betriebswirtschaftlichen Prozessen, idealerweise mit Fokus auf eines oder mehrere der folgenden Themen: M&A, Personal- und Organisationsentwicklung, Vertriebs- und Kundenservice-Strategien, Supply Chain Management, Einkauf, Business Model Design und Transformation oder Industrie 4.0Interesse an Technologie- und Digitalisierungsthemen und deren Einbindung in die Gesch√§ftsstrategieKlare Kommunikation in Wort und Schrift in flie√üendem Deutsch und EnglischDie im Beratungsalltag notwendige Flexibilit√§t und Mobilit√§t Du als Mensch bist uns wichtig. Neben vielen anderen Aspekten sind flexible Arbeitsmodelle (Teilzeit, Sabbatical, Anzahl Urlaubstage), das Arbeiten im Homeoffice, sowie die Realisierung eines l√§ngeren Zeitraums im Ausland (Transfer oder MBA) bei uns m√∂glich. Zus√§tzlich wirst Du von erfahrenen Mentor:innen und Projektleiter:innen begleitet und dabei unterst√ºtzt, Deine pers√∂nlichen und beruflichen Ziele zu erreichen.Dein KontaktDu hast Fragen? Dann wende dich an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an recruiting_germany@accenture.com oder telefonisch unter 00800 45045045.Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.

About the job
            
 
Business Transformation Consultant Salary range ‚Äì 85,000-100,000 euros + bonus Location ‚Äì Germany, (Berlin, Hamburg, Duesseldorf/Koeln, Munich, Ehningen)Flexible working available Candidates must have a consulting background with experience of Healthcare Insurance sector. The RoleYou will work with visionaries from different industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the world's most innovative and important companies. Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge are the foundation of our clients organisation. In and beyond your role, you will develop ideas and find creative solutions that make a difference for a broad network of clients. Our clients organisation encourages your career growth and development opportunities in an environment that recognizes your individual skills and experience. Role and Responsibilities : Business Consultants from our organisation support our clients in identifying and implementing future oriented solutions. Become part of our highly qualified team of consultants who shape the solutions of tomorrow for the insurance industry in a dynamic environment. You will support our clients from strategic consideration through to successful implementation. This is based on your specialist knowledge, industry expertise and strong soft skills as well as a strong focus on business development and transformation projects in the field of digitalization. We offer exciting, challenging projects with insurance customers in Germany, Austria, Switzerland and beyond, and the opportunity to develop your own career in a successful team. Are you analytical, a communicator, passionate about finding solutions, an innovator? Then we are looking for you! What we are looking for:‚Ä¢ University degree, preferably in business administration, business informatics, industrial engineering, mathematics or comparable courses of study ‚Ä¢ Expertise in insurance processes and insurance software products ‚Ä¢ Proven project experience in the introduction of standard software and transformation of business processes in the insurance industry ‚Ä¢ Team and/or project management experience ‚Ä¢ Knowledge of IT trends and their impact on business success ‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills ‚Ä¢ Language skills: German and English fluent ‚Ä¢ Willingness to travel in a dynamic project environment What we offer: ‚Ä¢ Responsible for creating solutions to our clients' business challenges ‚Ä¢ Teamwork in a global network of experts ‚Ä¢ Modern solutions, technologies and tools are used in our projects ‚Ä¢ Personal career development in a global company that adapts to your life plan ‚Ä¢ Training framework including generally recognized certification options for individual further training ‚Ä¢ Flexible working models with home office options ‚Ä¢ Attractive additional benefits, employee leasing, pension scheme and company health management

About the job
            
 
Als senior management consultant adviseer je onze opdrachtgevers bij complexe verandertrajecten. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan een verbetertraject in ziekenhuis, of een project binnen de ouderenzorg. Maar na het opleveren van het advies is het werk nog niet gedaan. We zijn niet voor niets een veranderbureau! Eigenlijk begint het dan pas: jij zorgt dat het advies wordt omzet in concreet resultaat. Je hebt vanuit je adviesrol een belangrijk rol bij de implementatie. Van het inrichten van processen, het ontwerpen van een nieuwe organisatiestructuur tot het begeleiden van de organisatie bij de verandering. Als management consultant doe je wat nodig is om de opdrachtgever verder te helpen. We ontzorgen en gaan pas weg als het werkt.Als management consultant bij Bisnez adviseer je directies en management op strategisch niveau. Soms doe je dat zelfstandig of in teamverband met collega‚Äôs vanuit Bisnez, maar het kan ook zijn dat je als senior adviseur onderdeel bent van een projectteam van de opdrachtgever.Naast het uitvoeren van opdrachten bij onze opdrachtgevers, ben je gedreven om mee te bouwen aan Bisnez. Als senior management consultant bij Bisnez ben je d√© gesprekspartner van klant en prospect; je gaat aan de slag als sparringpartner op directieniveau voor onze opdrachtgevers. Naast het uitvoeren van opdrachten, breng je ook nieuwe relaties tot stand. Daarvoor schrijf je mee aan goed onderbouwde offertes en rapporten. Vanuit jouw specialisatie in procesmanagement, datamanagement, informatiemanagement, governance of control krijg je bij ons de vrijheid om te ondernemen.Is dit jouw profiel? Ideally, candidates should be able to demonstrate the following: Advanced graduate degree (any discipline) and excellent academic record, additional qualifications or certifications are idealInternships or first professional experience, ideally in a consulting business, is a benefitAny international academic or work-related experience is a plusAptitude for analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking as well as creative and strategic thinking skillsStructured working style and time management skillsExcellent listening, verbal communication, interpersonal and presentation skillsSelf-motivation and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environmentMobile and open to take on selected assignments that require travel (Mondays to Thursdays)English language skills ‚Äì business/professional fluency

About the job
            
 
Wat ga je doen?Als Business Consultant bij Enexis help je √©en van de grote Nederlandse netbeheerders bedrijfsprocessen optimaal in te richten. Dat begint met uitzoeken van wat nou precies optimaal is. Daarvoor heb je contact met mensen uit alle geledingen van onze organisatie. Je verdiept je in de belangen van klanten, medewerkers en de organisatie, maar ook in de kaders door wet- en regelgeving en de ruimte die innovatieve automatiseringsmogelijkheden kunnen bieden. Zo kom je tot heldere procesontwerpen en -adviezen die naadloos aansluiten bij onze bedrijfsstrategie.Vervolgens begeleid je projectteams bij het SAFe agile realiseren van procesverbeteringen, op basis van de veranderagenda die je opstelt. Bijvoorbeeld door het ontwikkelen van apps. Als een visionaire bruggenbouwer zorg je zo voor verandering en vooruitgang, zodat we als organisatie de uitdagingen van de energietransitie aankunnen.Belangrijk in deze functie is vooral dat je niet alleen scherp krijgt waaraan n√π behoefte is, maar ook over een paar jaar. Je grootste uitdaging wordt ongetwijfeld prioriteren. Door de energietransitie groeit ons werkpakket namelijk gestaag en ondertussen verandert ook nog onze rol als netbeheerder. Over uitdagingen gesproken. Durf jij ‚Äòm aan? Functie-eisenEen rasechte verbinder met een resultaatgerichte aanpak en een verfrissende blik. Op inspirerende wijze zorg je voor draagvlak. Ze help je hele teams stap na stap te maken. Je voelt je thuis in een technische organisatie als de onze en verstaat de kunst op tijd afstand te nemen om in ons bedrijfsbelang te kunnen blijven handelen. Daarbij altijd rekening houdend met wat een verandering betekent voor onze organisatie, processen en systemen.Verder heb jij Minimaal een hbo-diploma (bijvoorbeeld bedrijfskunde);Ervaring met het begeleiden en co√∂rdineren van verandertrajecten;Affiniteit met softwareontwikkeling;Kennis van en ervaring met procesmanagement, projectmatig werken en procesontwerpmethodieken (zoals lean, SAFe en agile werken).
Let op: vanwege onze veiligheidsvoorschriften is het bij al onze functies verplicht om Nederlands taalniveau C1 te lezen, te spreken en te schrijven. Team & cultuurEnexis Netbeheer, onderdeel van Enexis Groep, voorziet ruim 3 miljoen huishoudens en bedrijven in Nederland van elektriciteit en gas. Je komt bij ons binnen op een interessant moment. De energietransitie is namelijk in volle gang en dat merk je in elke vezel van onze organisatie. Slim onderhoud, energie terugleveren, aardgasvrij wonen, windenergie opwekken en ga zo nog maar even door, we werken er hard aan om het mogelijk te maken. Dat leidt tot allerlei processen waar jij een waardevolle bijdrage aan kunt leveren.Je gaat als Business Consultant werken in het ketenteam van een onze vier procesketens: Onderhoud en Storingen, Grootverbruik & Netten en Kleinverbruik. Binnen je ketenteam opereer je landelijk en werk je samen met productmanagers, senior consultants en andere business consultants. Reken maar vast op een betrokken club collega‚Äôs en veel vrijheid. Zo bieden we voor thuiswerken bijvoorbeeld alle ruimte. Wat krijg je van ons?In ruil voor jouw energie zorgt Enexis goed voor je. Dit mag je verwachten: Een bruto maandsalaris tussen de ‚Ç¨ 3.854,- en ‚Ç¨ 7.308,- op basis van 40 uur per week. Dit is inclusief 10% persoonlijk budget en 10,7% dertiende maand. Je kunt deze budgetten flexibel inzetten, bijvoorbeeld voor extra verlofdagen. 8% vakantiegeld over je brutojaarsalaris. We dragen 70% bij aan je ABP Keuzepensioen. De mogelijkheid om je werkweek flexibel in te delen. We vinden een goede balans tussen werk en priv√© namelijk belangrijk. Dus als je ‚Äôs ochtends eerst de kinderen naar school wilt brengen of nog een rondje sportschool wilt doen, helemaal prima.Een jaarlijks vitaliteitsbudget van ‚Ç¨ 500,-. Bijvoorbeeld voor een sportabonnement of advies van een voedingscoach.Een kilometervergoeding en een mobiliteitskaart met een ov-abonnement 1e klas. Alle ruimte om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen. Dat is voor ons namelijk een topprioriteit. Dus wil je een opleiding of cursus volgen, dan is de kans groot dat we de kosten voor onze rekening nemen.
Zijn wij een match? We investeren graag in duurzame relaties. Om zeker te zijn van een goede match, voeren we daarom een screening uit. Deze verschilt per functie en kan bestaan uit: een assessment en het opvragen van referenties en een verklaring omtrent het gedrag (VOG). Tijdens je sollicitatiegesprek vertellen we je precies waar de screening in jouw geval uit bestaat.SollicitatieprocedureInteresse? Solliciteer direct via de solliciteerbutton en je ontvangt meer informatie over de verdere procedure. Heb je vragen over de functie? Neem dan contact op met Evelien Bartels, corporate recruiter, via evelien.bartels@enexis.nl of 06 ‚Äì 11 87 05 59.

About the job
            
 
The Strategy and Transactions (SaT) team of EY Cyprus is looking to recruit Senior consultants to work with a high-performing, integrated team which focuses on transactions, providing advice in challenging and interesting projects. We are offering the opportunity to gain a diverse range of experiences and develop a great sense of achievement.About Strategy And TransactionsThe Strategy and Transactions team guides clients to make better, more informed decisions as they buy, sell, separate, integrate, reshape, restructure or rethink their business strategy. We help our clients by providing advice on all aspects of transactions, from inception to execution and completion.Being one of the fastest growing and reputable teams in Cyprus, we remain at the forefront of all major transactions in the island, covering numerous market sectors.Strategy and Transactions offers a wide variety of services. The key competencies include, among others, the below: Lead advisory (M&A)Transaction DiligenceValuations, Modelling & EconomicsRestructuringStrategyBanking transaction advisory servicesReal Estate transaction advisory services
Key responsibilities of the role: Understand, analyse and present a client‚Äôs existing/proposed business, identify key strengths and weaknesses and document key findings;Understand key business drivers in a transaction and provide value to the client through insights, factual conclusions and advice;Document main findings that underpin the advice that we provide our clients with;Gather, verify and assess information and formulate views;Plan, prepare and review deliverables in various forms including written reports, presentations and discussions with the client;Assist with proposal preparations for prospective clients;Build on and develop internal and external networks through personal contacts;Build strong internal relationships with members of the SaT team and other EY services;Take responsibility for your own learning and development;Provide coaching / support to other team members.
To qualify for the role you must have: Qualified or in an advanced process of becoming qualified ACA, ACCA, CFA or equivalent professional qualification (e.g. MBA) will be considered an advantageStrong academic record, preferably relating to Accounting, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Physics or MathematicsAdvanced business writing and verbal communication skills both in Greek and EnglishSound financial modelling skillsStrong presentation skillsAbility to work under strict deadlinesStrong analytical, organizational, problem solving and critical thinking skillsEffective written and verbal communication
Ideally, you will also have: Experience in a similar transaction advisory environment / teamData analytics skills (through use of analytics tools and/or a programming language)Skills and attributes for success:Energetic, positive and team player;Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills;Flexible with a can-do attitude and a strong eye for detail;Thirsty for learning and development.
What Working At EY OffersEY offers an attractive remuneration package for rewarding both personal and team performance. We are committed to be an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. In addition, but not limited to our benefits include: Flexible working arrangements (work from anywhere when possible and flexible work schedule)Friday afternoon offEY Tech MBA and EY Master‚Äôs in business AnalyticsEY Badges - digital credentialsMobility programs (if interested to work abroad)Private Medical and Life InsurancePaid Sick LeavePaid Paternity LeaveMaternity, Wedding and New Baby GiftsDress for the OccasionEY Employee Assistance Program (EAP) (counselling, legal and financial consultation services).
About EYEY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform, and operate.Working across Assurance, Consulting, Tax, Strategy, and Transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.#betterworkingworldIf you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.The Exceptional EY Experience. It‚Äôs Yours To Build.Apply Now.

About the job
            
 
Location: Hengelo, NetherlandsAbout The TeamFor the Improvement Team we are looking for a Business Consultant. The improvement team has several fields of expertise; Strategic Improvements, Change Management, Lean and Business Process Management. The Business Consultant will focus on end-to-end transformation of our primary business from a product lifecycle and configuration management perspective, and will work together with the business architects within the Business Process Management practice. Currently there are 2 Business Architects active, but because of our long term improvements we are looking for strengthening of this capability for our organization with a specific specialization in PLMAbout Your Future JobAs a Business Consultant you will be responsible for improving our business processes, processes thinking & overall coherence based on an end-to-end focus. The BC will be working on the edge between business and IT, helps & challenges process owners to build an aligned process landscape and is the linking pin between the Business and the IT department to line-up applications supporting our primary processes. The BC will challenge our current way of working, is in the lead for improvements on transversal topics and develops, together with other process actors, a long term roadmap on organization improvements. As a business consultant you will lead our business process management activities, help to improve our business model and you will be in close contact with our Enterprise Architect on IT side. The BC is the spider in the web regarding end-to-end topics and will be the sparring partner for subject matter experts, process owners and product owners. You will lead change and play an important role for us in becoming more excellent in our operations.The main tasks are: Improve our business processes and process chains, PLM & CM capabilities, and build a coherent framework to serve as a basis for executing transformation programs. Make sure that the process chains, work instructions, application and data is aligned well to enable our running projects and facilitate quality, cost & delivery aspects.Build and animate communities, ensure a better collaboration between our disciplines within both business and IT area‚Äôs, Key-users, SME‚Äôs, Business teams, and improve the interfacing / connection between processes within the end-to-end chain, Learn from each other and from external parties (benchmarking, visits, etc)Engage in stakeholder management on role clarity, budget, priority, and actions plans ‚Äì Make sure responsibilities are clear, create connection and alignment between process owners, and budget owners and other business & IT stakeholdersBe sparring partner for Process owners (CPO), our Enterprise Information Management department and the architectsBe the go-to resources who helps CPO‚Äôs, Subject Matter Experts (SME‚Äôs) and projects to resolve cross-functional and/or complex issues, from business and IT perspective, on a TNL level Be a key stakeholder in listing & prioritizing business improvement initiatives, based on objectives, scope & overall business goals, support in creating a long term business change roadmap, owned by the architect, align with application roadmap (owned by IS/IT) and prepare change proposals for the BPA steerco, responsible for the overall RoadmapDirect project change activities focusing on sustainable deployment & structural changeMaintain overall consistency of country and site main business improvements and IT related initiatives and align with all relevant improvement initiatives to mitigate overlapping activities.Collaborate with the quality & improvement department on bringing structural change, based on bottom up / top down initiatives and/or quality findings, in order to improve overall company performance, where process is leading and initiatives intended to solve bottlenecksFacilitate process training and training planning from competence & knowledge development point of view ‚Äì determine together with the line & HR who needs which knowledge and make sure that this training is actually organized in terms of training plans and training instancesSucceed in building a solid base, house in order, continuous improvement of processes, alignment between data, application and disciplines & solve the main challenges within our organization. Eventually this will be measured in terms of improvements on quality, cost & delivery KPI‚Äôs across the chain.
Why you'd be a good match A relevant MSc degree in Technology or Business AdministrationProfessional experience in the field of Business Process Management, Business Consultancy or Enterprise architectureUnderstanding of our business and the field of Business Applications, especially PLM, CM & WindchillYou have a clear vision on Business Models, IT and Business Process ManagementProfound interest in improvement, quality and processesStrong personality capable of influencing without powerAn analytical thinker with an open and curious mind and excellent communication and writing skillsAbility to work in a dynamic, complex and multi-national environment wherein you manage/influence various stakeholders, challenge the status quo and solve problem. Strong leadership skills. Matching with the Thales Leadership modelEngage & develop teamsPerform through cooperationInfluence key stakeholdersShape solutions out of complexityManage SelfBe ambition and accountableFluent in English & DutchAt least 5 years experience in a comparable role
What's In It For You A challenging job in a great team within our high-tech, innovative work environment. Includes the freedom for initiative and good ideas.Room for personal and professional growth within our organisation, for example in regards to technical, commercial or international skills. Valuable international collaboration with coworkers from 68 different countries around the globe. A comfortable work space in a modern environment, with a focus on flexibility and the right work life balance.You can usually work where and when you want to be able to do your work as well and efficiently as possible. Within Thales we implement hybrid working, where you can, for example, work from home two days a week if your role allows it.A good salary, fitting travel allowance, and the ability to personalize your employment conditions: for instance, you can trade days off for internet costs, our bicycle plan, company fitness and relocation costs.40 days off per year (PTO). Yes, really.
Questions?Reach out for more information to our Talent Acquisition Partner Gerlof Jan Heck, via gerlofjan.heck@nl.thalesgroup.com or +31 (0) 638697390.Or apply now! Click on the button below to upload your profile and show your interest.

About the job
            
 
Roles & ResponsibilitiesYou will be working on client projects which can involve different areas of Business Transformation (BT) competences depending on the client‚Äôs main business challenges. These can range from business transformations, streamlining of operating processes, cost optimizations, digitalization, new technologies, improving customer experience, organizational changes, etc.Business Transformation (BT) competences include mainly (but are not limited to): Business strategyOrganization design and target operating modelOperational Excellence, specifically process design & optimizationPeople & Change, ensuring cultural and behavioral change and embedding change within organizations as well as optimizing the HR function and the human capital via future-proof talent management strategies and processes;Customer, Sales, Marketing and Services advisory, including value proposition definition, customer journey mapping and analysis, customer process improvements and transformationProject and portfolio management
You will thus be an active participant of the long-term goal of Business Tranformation (BT) by assisting clients in their business challenges and by bringing sustainable added value to the company as a whole. In addition to your role within project teams, you will also be involved in supporting business development activities such as proposal writing for new client demands.Your role will be highly varied and involves working in a supportive, young and dynamic team. The range of clients, and the projects you could work on, offers continuous challenge and a constantly shifting workload.You'll be in regular contact with clients, requiring travel many client sites on a national and international basis.Skills & QualificationsWe are looking for people who will soon hold a master degree in Economics (applied economics, business administration...), Commercial/Civil Engineering, Psychology, Social Sciences, Law... or an equivalent.Besides a strong technical basis, we are looking for people who: Have a working knowledge of French or Dutch (mother tongue/bilingual) and English;Like to work in a project based working environment;Take responsibility to deliver high-quality service;Foster innovation;Build collaborative relationships;Seek feedback and motivate others;Create an environment in which all team members feel like they belong;Communicate transparently and with impact;Are proactive and can demonstrate a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude;Are constructive and solution oriented;Have an analytical mindset;Can demonstrate integrity by being reliable and dependable;Can work independently and in a team;Are flexible and can adapt their organization (remote work, one-site‚Ä¶) according to circumstances and needs (client needs‚Ä¶).
We offerAt KPMG, we commit ourselves to encouraging true team spirit and creating an international and dynamic working environment in which each can pursue the knowledge needed to boost their career. Additionally, we highly invest in our people‚Äôs development of soft skills and technical knowhow.We also offer: An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect and tolerance for each other‚Äôs beliefs and background.A competitive and attractive compensation package with extra legal advantages (mobility budget or lease car, laptop, IPhone/IPad device, insurance package‚Ä¶)A flexible, hybrid working schedule where employees can work on different locations: at home, at the office, on the go or at a client‚Äôs site.A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events (e.g. afterwork drinks, network evenings, annual national receptions, etc.) that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.A comprehensive well-being programme that includes hospitalization insurance and several initiatives that focus on mental health.

We are looking for passionate, curious and driven team players who are ready to ignite ideas, push boundaries and drive innovation. Als senior management consultant adviseer je onze opdrachtgevers bij complexe verandertrajecten. About the job
            
 
You must have valid Irish, UK, or EU work rights to be considered for this roleLocation: Cherrywood, Dublin 22 with hybrid workingAbout the TeamWe are seeking a Strategy and Innovation Consultant to join the Aviva Life & Pensions Ireland (ALPI) Strategy teamThis is an excellent opportunity for a highly motivated, curious and innovative individual who has a strong understanding of the Life & Pensions industry or financial services strategy formulation, accomplished in-house or strategy consulting. Reporting to the Head of Strategy and Product Governance, you will support ALPI‚Äôs expansive growth strategy, developing innovative initiatives which meet true customer needs. If not coming from a specifically strategic background this position may suit you if you're coming from a commercial background in the industry, or a customer needs analysis or propositions background. This position will have exposure to our UK organisation as we build out our competitive intelligence hub.You will build ALPI‚Äôs competitive intelligence hub, developing a detailed understanding of both local and select international market landscapes, industry mega-trends, product and distribution developments, as well as other key areas such as regulatory change, consumer behavioural trends, and the M&A landscape in Ireland.As part of your role, you‚Äôll forge positive relationships with the wider team across the ALPI and the Aviva Group. We‚Äôre looking for someone with excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, whose personal impact enables them to challenge and positively influence at all levels. You‚Äôll support with defining our strategy and strategic objectives and being a trusted adviser to key functions across the Life business including CEO Office, Commercial, Operational and Finance Executives and support them to develop their respective functional strategies.You‚Äôll also work closely with ALPI‚Äôs Transformation function, supporting the development of compelling investment initiatives, project planning and ongoing support for of a range of high impact strategic programmes.Duties and Responsibilities: Focus on bringing data driven insights into ALPI's strategy development process, and lead on strategic analysis & reporting.Collaborate with the Product, Pricing & Marketing function to build innovative customer led initiatives which deliver compelling benefits for our customers and shareholders.Lead presentations and collaborative workshops with a range audiences across the company to build and test strategic hypothesis.Support the delivery of a variety of high-impact projects, demonstrating strong analytical / project management skills.Manage strategic reporting for Ireland Life Executive Committee, ALPIDAC Board and Aviva Group where required.Develop relationships with Aviva Group counterparts, and build an in depth understanding of strategic priorities of other Aviva business units to create opportunities to partner with a "One Aviva" approach.Support the development and growth of our business, and actively engage with delivery of pitches and presentations to internal and external stakeholders where required.Analyse and develop deep insights on business performance, core performance metrics, and support in preparation of business performance reviews.
Skills and experience we‚Äôre looking for: A problem-solver with strong commercial skills, coupled with excellent project management / facilitation ability.Excellent written communication and presentation skills, including advanced skills in MS Office packages (particularly PowerPoint).Ability to navigate and summarise complicated topics into clear, concise, and compelling messages across various audiences (e.g., colleagues, Executive Committee, Boards).A resilient individual, with strong ability to influence and communicate across the business.Self-motivated, with an ability to use independent judgment, prioritise, handle multiple issues and challenges and adapt to changing demands.Life & Pensions market experience preferable, but wider Financial Services experience also considered.Degree or equivalent professional experience.
What will you get for this role?  A competitive market leading salary depending on skills, experience, and qualificationsGenerous pension (employee contribution matching of up to 14% if you contribute 8%)Annual performance related bonus and pay reviewHoliday allowance of 29 days plus bank holidays, and the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional daysFree car parkingGenerous Health & dental insurance contributions after six monthsAviva Matching Share Plan and Save As You Earn scheme and Approved Profit Share SchemeCycle to Work benefit schemeTaxSaver Travel SchemeFamily friendly parent‚Äôs (matching paternity and maternity leave) and carer‚Äôs leave.Up to 40% discount for some Aviva products plus discounts for Friends and FamilyEmployee Assistance ProgrammeVolunteering daysProfessional qualification support and transparent career progression plans
Aviva is for Everyone Our diversity and inclusion policies and initiatives are shaping an environment where everyone feels welcome regardless of age, disability, race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, religion, culture, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, pregnancy, maternity or those with other caring responsibilities. Our approach helps to ensure that Aviva is a place which values difference and provides equal opportunities for all.We flex locations, hours and working patterns to suit our customers, business, and you.Our smart working combines the benefits of flexibility with time together with colleagues.We prefer all applications to be submitted online, however if you require an alternative method of applying, please contact sophie.keely@aviva.com or at 086 1584943.

About the job
            
 
We are currently seeking a Strategy Consultant ESG at all levels to join our team. Candidates ideally have previous experience of working as a Strategy Consultant ESG in some capacity for, or at large organisations, on digital transformation initiatives.Your roleThis position is within the Benelux team, which focusses on providing advice and guidance to customers on IT Strategy, Enterprise Architecture, and Solution Architecture.As an Strategy Consultant ESG, you will deliver value and excellence to our customers through key project engagements, and you will also support the growth of the Technology Modernization Consulting practice. Our services focus on the agendas of the Chief Information Officer (CIO), the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and/or product/platform owners, on mainly Digital & Emerging Technologies and Technology Transformation.Responsibilities:  Shape, contribute, and deliver value through advisory consultancy, and transformational delivery engagements Connect and collaborate with teams across our business in the development and presentation of proposals to clients Work with account teams to support opportunity identification, qualification, and sales Develop a cross practice understanding of service offerings to ensure effective consultative selling Use your personal contacts and networking skills to help grow our consulting pipeline You are able to develop client ready ESG strategy support Contribute to the development of a knowledge management led approach ensuring the development of reusable collateral from assignments Team building: promote empowerment of the team, ensure that each team member is fully engaged in their projects and our team, making meaningful contributions, and encourage a sustainable pace with high levels of quality for the team
Your Team:The Technology Modernization Consulting practice at Cognizant helps clients to reimagine, redefine, and transform their businesses through technology. We bring unparalleled levels of insight, innovation, and delivery velocity to help our clients become digital leaders and enable them to create disruption within their industry. We do this by employing the best people in the industry, working with a single-minded focus and a pragmatic, hands-on approach to delivering technology strategy and solutions.What We Offer:  A fair salary based on your qualities and experience Access to Udemy, Cognizant Academy digital libraries for your continuous learning NS business card to cover your commute expenses. 25 days of paid holiday per year A laptop and a smartphone A pension scheme Health insurance Organization driven by technology ‚Äì we have a tremendous technology backbone Open, ‚Äòcan do‚Äô team spirit and international environment that encourages making your ideas reality! 32-40 hour working week Possibility to work 2-3 days a week remotely
What You Will Bring To The Team:  Experience or expertise in any of the following areas: IT Strategy Development, Sustainability Development, ESG Consultant, CSRD Specialist, IT Operating Model design, IT Portfolio Management, or Merger & Acquisition Services Previous experience in an IT Strategy Advisory or Technology Consulting role is preferred Experience of working across multiple industry sectors (preferred) Strong stakeholder management and relationship building skills at senior levels that will enable consensus building and shaping technology direction Very strong inquisitive and critical thinking skills, communication and presentation skills, and a relationship builder with the ability to convince Energetic and free thinking; open to lead and coach, and be coached
About CognizantCognizant is one of the world‚Äôs leading professional services companies, transforming clients‚Äô business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, ranked in the Fortune 500 and consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world.Diversity And Inclusion At Cognizant:At Cognizant, we believe diversity and inclusion are at the heart of our ability to execute successfully and consistently over the long term. We recognize that our people are our most important asset. We strive to create an environment where all associates feel comfortable to be themselves, feel accepted and can therefore thrive both personally and professionally. We continue to drive D&I throughout our organization to unlock the insights, imagination and innovation of our associates, as well as reflect the diversity of our clients and communities. We are a Dutch and European Top Employer and continually drive employment recognition and engagement through employee friendly policies and affinity groups such as ‚ÄúWomen Empowered‚Äù, ‚ÄúEmbrace LGBTQ+‚Äù and ‚ÄúRace Equality Network‚Äù. For more information, see https://careers.cognizant.com/global/en/diversity-and-inclusionDescription Of The Recruitment Process:Step 1: Written application/CV will be reviewed by the recruitment teamStep 2: Conversation with the recruiterStep 3: Technical interview with the teamStep 4: Business interview with the teamStep 5: OfferRecruiter contact detailsName: Quessia RajohanesaEmail address: quessia.rajohanesa@cognizant.comPhone: +31 6 11 38 45 44Employee Status : Full Time EmployeeShift : Day JobJob Posting : Oct 18 2023About CognizantCognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

About the job
            
 
EMERTONEmerton is a global high-end strategy consulting firm based in Paris, London, Munich and New York. We support global corporations and fast-growth companies on their high-stake issues with a focus on Technology and Industry. We bring speed and advanced capabilities to our clients in designing and executing innovative strategies.Emerton is the partner of choice of international groups, technology companies and private equity funds. The firm supports the development acceleration, acquisition policy, international expansion, digital transformation and technological implementation of their clients.Emerton is ranked by Vault (2022) among the top 20 consulting firms in Europe and among top 10 for its Diversity and Inclusion policy.JOB DESCRIPTIONIn close contact with clients and partners, and under the guidance of a senior consultant or manager, you conduct interviews, market analysis and corporate performance assessments. You analyze facts and data, and translate them into meaningful insights and recommendations. After an onboarding period with tailor-made trainings, you will immediately put your talent, analytical capabilities and creativity in action within a project team.WHAT WE OFFER- Fast-learning strategy consulting mindset and methods- International, diverse and inclusive environment- Culture of excellence- Strong team bonding- High-impact projects including sustainable development- Strong client exposure- Competitive compensation and benefits- Fast-growth entrepreneurial company offering many opportunitiesWHO WE LOOK FORHigh-potential individuals willing to work in a challenging international environment- Top-tier academic background (top-ranked engineering or business school)- Proven analytical and creative thinking- Sharp problem-solving capabilities- Strong business sense- Excellent oral and written communication skills

Bringing together expert and complementary brands, Mantu stands out for the breadth of its spectrum, responding to all business transformation challenges. Its activities are divided into four practices: Leadership & Advocacy, Technology, Digital Marketing & Experience, Total Talent Management.A wide range of skills, all serving a single mission: connecting and powering companies with leading teams and technology to succeed faster and sustainably.From its headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland, Mantu relies on a community of 10,000 talented people in more than 60 countries on 5 continents and has a turnover of 810 million euros.Job description Valuement is an international consulting company, part of Mantu Group, operating in 60 countries, with a primary focus on the retail market and now also expanding new industries. This position is based in Milan and requires 3 years of relevant experience in consulting, preferably within the Retail sector.Key Responsibilities: Project Management: Manage end-to-end consulting project activities, including project scoping, planning, execution, and delivery.Ensure projects are delivered within agreed timelines, budgets, and quality standards.Business Development: Support business development efforts by identifying new opportunities within the retail fashion industry.Participate in client pitches, proposal development, and lead generation activities.Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, acting as a trusted advisor and understanding their unique business needs.Collaborate closely with clients to develop and implement strategic initiatives that align with their goals.Strategic Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis of the retail fashion market, including market trends, consumer behavior, competitive landscape, and industry best practices.Translate findings into actionable insights and strategic recommendations for clients.Digital innovation: participate in the functional development of IT solutions (workflow, RPA) that can help customers in the digital innovation process.Qualifications and Skills: -Master's degree in Business Administration, Management or a related field.-3 years of experience in strategic consulting, preferably with a focus on the retail fashion industry.-Proven track record of delivering strategic consulting projects, driving tangible results for clients.-Positive approach and ability to work as a team, with experience in manage other people.-Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex ideas to stakeholders at all levels.-Fluency in English and Italian is required. Additional languages are a plus.What we offer: Permanent contract + commissions and benefits; Real possibility to grow fast into a management role; International environment, Overseas projects to develop and mobility opportunities.

job_description:
About the job
