About the job
            
 
Job Description & SummaryLeading with heart, living by valuesPwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you‚Äôre reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you‚Äôll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you‚Äôll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that‚Äôs making a difference.Looking for an exciting opportunity that brings together the development of your technical skills, analysis of business plans, design of financial models and valuation of companies and assets? Then why not join our Deals team?You‚Äôll join our team of experts who are part of the wider Deals team of 100 consultants. We add value to our clients‚Äô businesses by delivering a wide range of financial services focused on valuation, financial modelling and business planning. We work with clients in different sectors facing a variety of challenges such as mergers and acquisitions, project finance, strategic planning, accounting and tax structuring.What you‚Äôll learn and do We work increasingly on integrated service offerings, so you‚Äôll be involved in projects with other Deals teams like Due Diligence, Corporate Finance, Business Restructuring and Debt Advisory Collaborate with our Audit and Tax & Legal Services departmentsWork on a team with (Senior) Managers and Directors Tackle a variety of assignments that can range in length from two to six weeks
Who you are, what you‚Äôre like You have between 1- 3 years of relevant work experience (in valuation, business planning, financial modelling, strategic and financial consultancy, banking and/or the finance department in a corporate environment, etc.)Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build effective relationships with individuals, teams and lines of businessExcellent listening and communication skills, and the ability to persuade and influenceA proactive approach and flexible attitude with the ability to demonstrate initiative and reliabilityAbility to work well under pressure and meet tight deadlinesGood results from your university studiesStrong Excel and PowerPoint skillsGood understanding of financial statement analysisBasic knowledge of discounted cash flow (DCF), risk analysis, valuation techniques and/or credit analysisFamiliar with tools like Bloomberg and/or Thomson is a plusEnrolled in the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) programme would be an assetSolid writing and presentation skillsFluent in English and French and/or Dutch
What we offer An environment where you‚Äôll be encouraged to take your expertise to the next level A workspace where everyone feels respected, valued and free to be themselves Inspiring and awesome colleaguesTeam events such as Last Friday Drinks, team-building days, celebrations and specialist knowledge eventsForward-looking and very accessible leadership hosting inspirational lunches and driving your further development An extensive health programme including an online platform and various challenges, yoga and Pilates in our offices, yearly flu vaccinations, sports communities, mental resilience workshops and so onA flexible work schedule including homeworking and the possibility to conveniently make use of various holiday schemes An interesting salary and benefits package, including health and group insurance and Teddy care (nursing service when your child is ill) And much more!
  Looking for a career where you‚Äôll really make a difference? Then we look forward to meeting you!   Required Skills

About the job
            
 
In order to support the strong growth of Capgemini Invent Italy, we are currently recruiting FS Strategy Senior Consultant based in Milan.About the jobAt Capgemini Invent, we bring to life what‚Äôs next for our clients. By combining strategy, technology, data science, and creative design expertise with an inventive mindset, we partner with our clients to innovate and transform their business, helping them navigate today, while plotting a course for the future.About Capgemini InventAs the digital innovation, design and transformation brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in more than 36 offices and 37 creative studios around the world, it comprises a 10,000+ strong team of strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.Capgemini Invent is an integral part of Capgemini, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 300,000 team members in nearly 50 countries. With its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fuelled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2021 global revenues of ‚Ç¨18 billion.An overview of the role¬∑ You will be working with the world‚Äôs largest and most innovative Financial Services institutions to deliver market leading digital propositions.¬∑ You‚Äôll work with leading financial services companies to assist them in developing, prioritising and delivering the FS institutions of the future.¬∑ You‚Äôll design and lead streams of work whilst playing a role in Capgemini‚Äôs growth through successful delivery, contributing to our offers and knowledge, as well as developing new business.¬∑ You‚Äôll identify and analyse problems and issues that may affect the successful delivery and adoption of our proposed solutions into the business.¬∑ You‚Äôll apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to ensure that the team‚Äôs plans and objectives are achieved.¬∑ You‚Äôll bring the right combination of style and substance, ensuring that the basics are right, whilst always focusing on we add value to our clients.¬∑ You‚Äôll work collaboratively in cross-functional teams to drive continuous business performance improvement.Why this role?With our inventive approach to digital transformation, we help to identify and implement disruptive value propositions, operating models and architectural changes that are key to deliver real and sustainable business value.Why you?¬∑ At least 4 years of Consulting/Banking experience in top tier companies.¬∑ Strong knowledge and interest in FSI industry.¬∑ Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, STEM matters and Law. Post graduate master is a plus.¬∑ Fluency in English, other languages will be evaluate as a plus.¬∑ Self-starter with highly developed interpersonal skills, decisive and result oriented.¬∑ Excellent communication, and presentation skills.¬∑ Strong work ethic and organizational skills to work in a fast paced environment.Why us?At Capgemini Invent, we believe transformation begins with invention and ends with results. This inventive thinking helps clients unlock new opportunities and create what‚Äôs next for their organizations. Ideation and prototyping are key, but so too is helping our clients to scale and industrialize new solutions. The fourth industrial revolution is forcing businesses to rethink their strategy, business model and offerings to their culture ‚Äì and everything in between. While emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence and blockchain continue to evolve, many organizations are still in the dark as to how and where they might be integrated. Capgemini Invent help our clients address these challenges by designing and creating advanced, real-world digital solutions and the business models of the future, resulting in new value creation and driving their growth.DiversityCapgemini positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity. We are committed to hiring, developing and retaining the best people to deliver innovative, world-class solutions for our clients. We foster an inclusive culture that enables everyone to achieve their full potential and enjoy a fulfilling career with us. Our comprehensive flexible benefits package and lifestyle policies enable our employees to balance their individual, family and work-life needs.Learning and developmentThere‚Äôs an endless amount to learn at Capgemini, and an endless number of ways to do so. So, you‚Äôll also have unique training opportunities to take advantage of. Some of our consultants even have the chance to go to Les Fontaine (near Paris, France), where we host a conference. Outside of dedicated training, everyone makes time to help and support one another - collaboration is encouraged across all of our teams.Work/Life HarmonyWe understand that everyone has varied lives and we want you to have a great work-life balance. So, where possible, our Work Life Harmony policy will help you to work flexibly and juggle your work and home life.CSR We‚Äôre also focused on using tech to have a positive social impact. So, we‚Äôre working to reduce our own carbon footprint and improve everyone‚Äôs access to a digital world. It‚Äôs something we‚Äôre really serious about. In fact, we were even named as one of the world‚Äôs most ethical companies by the Ethisphere Institute for an 8th year. When you join Capgemini, you‚Äôll join a team that does the right thing.We offer a remuneration package which includes flexible benefits options for you to choose to suit your own personal circumstances and a variable element dependent grade and on company and personal performance.

About the job
            
 
Wat doe je?Processen optimaliseren en meetbare resultaten behalen? Daar ligt jouw focus als Lean Consultant. Je bent een specialist binnen change management en brengt graag bestaande processen in kaart, om deze vervolgens te kunnen analyseren. Op basis van je bevindingen, schrijf je een gedetailleerd verbeterplan. Daarnaast weet jij in jouw rol als Lean Consultant het team te begeleiden en motiveren tijdens het implementeren van de verbeteringen. Dit doe je door bijvoorbeeld workshops of trainingssessies te geven aan medewerkers. Je reikt ook tools en technieken aan, zodat zij hun werkprocessen kunnen optimaliseren.Wij nemen je aan op de werkervaring die je hebt opgebouwd als Lean Consultant. Vervolgens faciliteren wij jou in het realiseren van jouw ambities! Ambities die veel breder kunnen liggen. Voor ons ben je dan ook veel meer dan een Lean Consultant. Dat is voor ons alleen een rol waar jij op kan worden ingezet bij onze opdrachtgevers.Wij zien jou als Business Improver! En als Business Improver heb je de intrinsieke drive om alsmaar te willen verbeteren en net dat stapje extra te zetten om toegevoegde waarde te leveren. Dat kost je geen moeite, dat is gewoon wie je bent. Ondernemend, daadkrachtig en leergierig. Zo kun jij onze opdrachtgevers √©cht helpen om doelstellingen te behalen.Wat bieden we jouBij FTE ben je echt onderdeel van het team. We betrekken je bij klantoplossingen √©n het verbeteren van jouw eigen werkomgeving. Je krijgt bij ons de ruimte om mee te denken, ondernemerschap te tonen en te experimenteren. Daar leren we allemaal van en jij in het bijzonder. Kortom: je wordt volop gefaciliteerd om jouw eigen ambitie vorm te geven!Voor de werkzaamheden in jouw rol als Lean Consultant bij de leukste werkgever van Nederland bieden we je het volgende: Een salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨5.000,- en ‚Ç¨7.500,-, gebaseerd o.b.v. 40 uur en inclusief WON;Een WerkOnderNemers (WON) model waarbij jouw inzet en ondernemerschap wordt beloond;25 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld op jaarbasis;Mobiliteitsbudget of een leaseauto;Een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget en een pensioenregeling bij StiPP;Mogelijkheid om hybride te werken (2-3 dagen op locatie bij de opdrachtgever, overige dagen thuis of in het clubhuis bij FTE);Maandelijkse events met gezellige collega‚Äôs.
Wat neem je mee? Minimaal een afgeronde hbo-opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting van bedrijfskunde, projectmanagement of een vergelijkbare studie;Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rol;Kennis van Scrum | Agile | Lean;Prince2, IPMA-D, IPMA-PMO of Lean Green Belt is een pr√©;Een scherp analytisch vermogen, kunt goed het overzicht bewaren en beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden;Probleemoplossend vermogen en creatief in het bedenken van oplossingen;
Over ons?Wij realiseren de ambities van onze FTE‚Äôers en onze opdrachtgevers. Omdat dit echt is wat ons drijft en waar wij energie van krijgen. Dat doen wij op onze eigen manier. Onze waarden: plezier, betrokkenheid, ontwikkeling, open en wendbaar, hanteren wij als ons kompas in alles wat we doen. Wie we graag bij onze club willen hebben en met welke opdrachtgevers we graag zakendoen.Je hebt de mogelijkheid om voor verschillende klanten te werken, maar wel vanuit onze eigen FTE cultuur. Dit resulteert in een omgeving die bij jou past. Waarin jij en jouw collega‚Äôs zich thuis voelen. Waarin de betrokkenheid bij de club en elkaar groot is en waarin je echt impact hebt op onze klant en je eigen werkomgeving bij FTE. Dus geen politiek en omslachtig gedoe, maar direct, informeel, transparant en eerlijk. En als je thuis wilt werken, dan werk je toch lekker thuis!Sommige collega‚Äôs noemen het een werkfamilie. Anderen work hard, play hard! We houden in ieder geval van feestjes, reisjes, leuke en nuttige bijeenkomsten, relaxed met elkaar omgaan en alles wat plezier geeft. Enthousiast? Leuk! Solliciteren kan via onderstaand formulier.Heb je een vraag over deze vacature? Bel of Whatsapp dan met Jack via tel: 06-22850985 of Koray via tel: 06-26301391.

About the job
            
 
Vacature Traineeship Business Consultant Ben je net afgestudeerd, of studeer je binnenkort af en kan je niet wachten om een vliegende start te maken met jouw carri√®re als consultant? Ben jij de topper die nog lang niet is uitgeleerd? Meld je dan aan voor het Traineeship bij MLC! Nieuwe technologie√´n volgen elkaar steeds sneller op. De hoeveelheid data neemt toe, toepassingen worden slimmer en computers sneller. De interactie met klanten verandert en dat geldt ook voor de eisen die klanten aan organisaties stellen en dat heeft weer impact op de inrichting van de bedrijfsprocessen. Dit klinkt voor jou als het begin van iets moois, want door middel van onder andere data leg jij het fundament voor betere processen. Tijdens het traineeship word je klaargestoomd als Business Consultant om samen met de klant te zoeken naar mogelijkheden om klanttevredenheid te verhogen, kosten te reduceren en doorlooptijden te verkorten. Je zorgt voor een kwalitatief sterk en gedegen proces en leert hoe je om moet gaan met verschillende stakeholders en het implementeren van veranderingen.Wat ga je doen?Je start het traineeship met diverse trainingen waarin we je een grondige en brede basis geven van onze dienstverlening. Denk hierbij aan trainingen op het gebied van Business Process Management, Data Science, Lean, Agile, Verandermanagement en Adviesvaardigheden. Naast het volgen van trainingen, start je zo snel mogelijk ‚Äì en onder begeleiding van een ervaren collega ‚Äì met een opdracht bij √©√©n van onze klanten om direct een bijdrage te leveren aan het realiseren van organisatieveranderingen. Het traineeship bij MLC duurt 7 maanden, waarna je doorstroomt in de rol van Junior Consultant.Wat krijg je van ons? Veel aandacht voor jouw ontwikkeling en een persoonlijke begeleider die je helpt bij het vaststellen en realiseren van jouw leerdoelen;Volop doorgroeimogelijkheden om het beste te halen uit jezelf en je carri√®re als consultant;Een uitdagende rol in een team waarbij hard werken de norm is en inspirerende en betrokken collega‚Äôs altijd voor je klaar staan;Veel gezelligheid en sociale activiteiten met collega‚Äôs, zoals tijdens het jaarlijkse skiweekend, kerstdiner, BBQ en kennisconferenties;Een marktconform salaris, laptop, telefoonabonnement, flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid om gedeeltelijk vanuit huis te werken;28 vakantiedagen, extra vrije ‚Äòloyaliteitsdagen‚Äô wanneer je langer dan 3 jaar bij ons werkt en een winstdeling aan het einde van het jaar.Na doorstroming in de functie van Junior Consultant ontvang je een mobiliteitsvergoeding die je kunt inzetten voor een leaseauto of OV-kaart. Tot die tijd ontvang je uiteraard een vergoeding van alle gemaakte reiskosten.
Wie ben jij?Je bent analytisch en communicatief sterk, kan een situatie snel inschatten en toont initiatief en doorzettingsvermogen. Je hebt een bedrijfskundige, technische of cijfermatige studie afgerond (denk aan Wis- of Natuurkunde, Econometrie, Informatica, Bedrijfskunde, Economie of Bestuurskunde). Je wil graag ontdekken waar jouw talenten liggen en een kickstart geven aan jouw carri√®re. Je brengt ook persoonlijkheid mee: je kan je vinden in onze kernwaarde ‚ÄòSociaal Ondernemend‚Äô waarin we samen, authentiek, innovatief en resultaat gedreven aan het werk zijn.Over MLCMLC in Leusden heeft al 30 jaar een sterke eigen cultuur, die we omschrijven als sociaal ondernemend. Wij transformeren organisaties naar een optimale digitale procesomgeving waarbij de mens in zijn kracht staat. Bij MLC werken zo‚Äôn 30 ‚Äôprocesdenkers‚Äô. Jij werkt als Consultant in teams met wisselende samenstellingen voor toonaangevende klanten in verschillende branches. Denk hierbij aan woningcorporaties, overheidsinstellingen en zakelijke dienstverleners, zoals banken, verzekeraars en energiemaatschappijen.Stap binnen bij MLCBen jij de uitblinker die we zoeken? Vertel jouw verhaal en mail je cv en motivatie naar werkenbij@m-lc.nl. Wij kijken uit naar je sollicitatie!Neem contact op met onze Junior Office Manager Marieke Sindelka als je nog vragen hebt over de vacature. Zij is te bereiken via 035 - 548 65 65.Na jouw sollicitatieOm er zeker van te zijn dat we bij elkaar passen, leren we je graag in 2 of 3 gesprekken beter kennen. Het eerste gesprek heb je met onze directeur(en), de volgende gesprekken met directe collega‚Äôs. Zijn wij en ben jij overtuigd? Dan volgt een arbeidsvoorwaardengesprek, waarin we jou een aanbod doen.

About the job
            
 
At a glanceAs a Strategy Consultant you support the management team with the development of the Wealth Management Client Unit vision and strategy, the identification of (new) business opportunities and by participating in strategic assignments like M&A-projects. A challenging job where you can have impact and make the difference.Your jobSupporting the development and implementation of the WM vision & strategy Liaises with international network on strategic topics for continuous development of the WM Strategy. Addresses trends and translates this into consequences for WM, provides insights in future challenges and what scenarios could play out. Gives pro-active advice on possibilities to adjust the strategy on an ongoing basis. Identifies new business opportunities coming both from internal (P&L) analysis, and from external/peer assessments. Participates in benchmarking initiatives and identifies possible (growth) opportunities. 
Supporting or leading strategy projects and participates in the execution of strategy programs Participates in or independently leads high-impact projects related to organic and inorganic growth (e.g. M&A projects). Working in close cooperation with the WM Management Team members and the country MT'sMaintains a variety of formal and informal relationship networks with stakeholders in- and outside the organization, such as Strategy & Innovation, Corporate Development, Country Executives and industry analysts
Working environmentThe Client Unit Wealth Management is responsible for the client segment Wealth Management Clients, the Wealth Products unit, the countries: Netherlands, Belgium, France, Germany, UK, Greece and Norway and the three enabling functions: Processes & Control, Business Implementation and Business Strategy Office. This Client Unit serves private customers with assets from ‚Ç¨500,000 (High Net Worth and Ultra High Net Worth customers). The focus of the Client Unit is creating the right combination between offering (digital) convenient solutions and distinctive expertise, also embedding sustainability in customer value propositions. With sustainability at the heart; engaging colleagues and clients to experience us as an aspirational bank with a heart. Serving our existing client wallet through convenience and differentiation, while creating new business opportunities, driving (international) top-line growth with a sustainable long term profitability and developing new business models.The Wealth Management Strategy Office supports the Wealth Management Management Team in formulating a vision and strategy with respect to the market, players and clients. The team ensures the creation of a strategic business plan for the Wealth Management Client Unit and advises on opportunities for improvement. The team carries out ad-hoc analyses on specific (new) business opportunities and threats. Furthermore, it supports the Client and Product Unit by performing analyses on market development, long-term performance objectives and strategic positioning. The team works closely with the Segment Development Team, Strategy & Innovation, Business Strategy Offices of other Units, Corporate Development, Finance, Risk and Communications.The Head of Business Strategy Office Wealth Management has a direct reporting line to the Chief Commercial Officer of the Client Unit Wealth Management.Your profileYou‚Äôre a self-starter who enjoys to take responsibility and improve the team as a whole. You want to improve yourself and the organization continuously and you‚Äôre open to changes.On your CV: Academic level potentially in marketing, economics or business administration At least 5 years of relevant strategy consultancy experienceGreat communication skills - you feel comfortable liaising with Senior Management Strong organizational sensitivity Dynamics and solid working experience preferably in an international environmentAbility to drive change and translate strategic themes into improvement projects Fluent in English 
We are offering  The opportunity to be part of a great small international team that supports each other We use our team difference in strengths and focus areas, to create a thriving and lively work environment There is a lot of room to grow both personally and professionally An environment where you can have impact and make a difference Hybrid working: 2-3 days per week we work from the office
We also offer  The opportunity to be the best you can be and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally Possibilities for flexible working hours and work from home are negotiable. We offer good facilities for remote working. The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year An annual public transportation pass A solid pension plan
Interested?Are you interested? Then be sure to respond to this vacancy. For more information, contact: Thom Meulman, Head of Wealth Management Strategy Office (+31 630434215, thom.meulman@nl.abnamro.com)We look forward to getting to know you.Equal opportunities for allThe success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.Disclaimer external recruitment agenciesExternal recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.Wij vragen  Passie voor je vakgebied 
Wij bieden  Analytische skills

About the job

About the job
            
 
Let‚Äôs be unstoppable together!Circana (formerly IRI and NPD) is the leading advisor on the complexity of consumer behavior. Through unparalleled technology, advanced analytics, cross-industry data and deep expertise, we provide clarity that helps almost 7,000 of the world‚Äôs leading brands and retailers take action and unlock business growth. At Circana, we are fueled by our passion for continuous learning and growth, we seek and share feedback freely, and we celebrate victories both big and small in an environment that is flexible and accommodating to our work and personal lives. Join our inclusive, committed team to be a challenger, own outcomes, and stay curious together.Learn more at www.circana.com.Business ConsultantIn our client-facing team this is a critical role in which you are responsible for managing our (top) accounts. Your main responsibility is to secure the client satisfaction level and help them further grow based on your knowledge and our solutions to help them meet and exceed their targets. For instance: following trends from multiple segments in order to create potential opportunities for your clients, advice on the best set of deliverables to only offer what matters most to them and make sure all information and insights are consolidated, presented and are ready to be embedded successfully on all levels within the clients organization based on your consultancy skills.Your main responsibilities are:  Translating customer needs (actively or passively founded) into a growth roadmap that will provide our clients with a competitive advantage. This can be achieved by working closely together with our Strategic Insights Analyst, our Client Service Executives, our dedicated Solutions & Insights team, and (when needed) consulting one of our Operational teams.  Operating as the lead point of contact for any and all matters specific to your accounts. Building and maintaining strong, long-lasting customer relationships & Overseeing customer account management, including negotiating contracts and agreements. 
Main Duties & ResponsibilitiesThe most crucial aspect of the role is to gain the highest level of client satisfaction. Meaning we need to do what matters most to help our clients to meet and exceed their targets. Most important tasks to be performed in this role: Serve as the lead point of contact for your account portfolio (both at Circana as well as the client premises)Develop trusted advisor relationships with your accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsorsGenerating answer and insights to clients (commercial) challengesDevelop new business with existing clients to meet sales quotas, if needed in cooperation with ‚ÄòS&I‚Äô-colleagues(Internal) Revenue & Pipeline managementCoaching of (junior) colleaguesManage client expectations & satisfaction (by using IRI‚Äôs client scorecard process)Deal with challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed

About the job

job_title: Senior Consultant / ManagerTurnaround and Restructuring Strategy - Strategy and Transactions
job_description:
About the job
            
 
Our TRS team is fully integrated both within our wider Strategy and Transactions practice and our firm as a whole, and our clients reap the benefits of this broad range of knowledge, skills and experience. We work on the basis of creating long-term relationships with our clients and our teams work closely with them to understand their short and long-term goals - being there at every stage to identify problems and recommend and implement solutions that deliver measurable results. The EY Turnaround and Restructuring Strategy (TRS) team is a cohesive team and advises both medium-sized and large companies and their stakeholders (e.g. shareholders, financiers or suppliers) on special situations. Our issues are at the interface of strategy, operations and finance. We guarantee a diverse job in a dynamic transaction-driven practice with many young ambitious colleagues. A "typical day" for a Senior Consultant/Manager within the EY Turnaround and Restructuring Strategy does not exist. What we can say is that your experience will be dynamic, engaging and fun.The opportunity - What future are you building towards?In this role you will advise both medium-sized and large companies and their stakeholders (e.g. shareholders, financiers or suppliers) in special situations, such as liquidity and profitability problems, restructuring, strategy and complex financing issues. You mostly do this by working with your team on location at the company, which means you also get to experience the dynamics of the company and the sector up close. In addition, you will frequently collaborate with other SaT disciplines in the areas of valuations, business modelling, sales guidance, real estate, strategy and operations.We are looking for colleagues to join us in Amsterdam as their home office.Our team - Do great minds always think alike?Within the Turnaround and Restructuring Strategy (TRS) department, we advise organizations when they face underperformance or financial problems. We provide financial and business strategies with a focus on restructuring the company to transform, create, preserve, and restore value. We work with organizations in industries such as private equity, energy, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, retail, FMCG, technology, media, and telecom.Responsibilities ‚Äì How can you make a lasting impact in a rapidly changing world? Helping clients develop financial and operational strategies to improve liquidity, credit availability and shareholder return.Dealing with competing prioritiesUnderstanding how to manage resourcesCommunicating effectively
Job requirements ‚Äì Where do you start if you want to change the world? At least 3 years of relevant working experience and a completed University degree (e.g. Business Economics, Business Administration, Econometrics or Accountancy)Strong and verifiable experience and/or affinity with changes, transactions and restructuringStrong analytical skills and experience working with large data files and data visualisation toolsGood communication skills and (preferably) fluent in Dutch and English languages, both verbally and in writingAbove average skills in PowerPoint and Excel
Already interested? Apply now!What we offer ‚Äì Is everything that counts being counted?  Flexible working: you decide where and when you work in consultation with your team. At home, at the office, at the client's location, or from another European country (up to 20 working days per year)Salary: in addition to your fixed salary, depending on EY's financial performance, you may be eligible for a bonus. You are also entitled to an expense allowance (depending on the position) and an internet allowance of ‚Ç¨40 net per monthTime off: you are entitled to 29 (on senior consultant level) or 34 (on manager level) vacation days per year when full-time employed and you have the option to purchase additional days.Sabbatical: the option to take unpaid leave after consultationBirth leave: EY will pay 100% of the birth leave; in the case of additional birth leave, EY will pay 70% of the salaryPension scheme: you will start building a pension capital immediately upon joining EY. Each month, a premium is allocated to your pension account with our pension provider. You also have the option to voluntarily contribute additional funds to your pension

To learn more about working at EY, please visit the following link: What it's like to work here | EY - NetherlandsThe officeOur office in Amsterdam is located in the Zuidas, a bustling area where many businesses are situated. In our Cross Towers, Anouchka and Lucia welcome up to 1.000 people every day upon arrival. Haven't had breakfast yet? Taib will make his special smoothie for you or simply a delicious cappuccino. During the lunch break, the team of Hans and Mehdi will be ready with a fresh lunch for you. For a breathtaking view of Amsterdam, head to the 22nd floor. Collaborating takes on a new meaning with the Wavespace. This high-tech environment brings clients and colleagues together virtually from all over the world!Recruitment procedure ‚Äì How can you prepare for a long life together?Our hiring process consists of several key steps. After reviewing your CV, we will schedule an introductory call to get to know each other better and address practical matters. Next, you'll have the option to have an informal coffee chat with a team member, providing an opportunity to learn more about our organization. An online assessment will be administered to evaluate relevant skills and knowledge. Subsequently, a first interview will assess team fit and personality. If successful, a second interview will involve a case study. Finally, a Partner interview will take place, where you'll have the chance to engage with our leadership. Upon successful completion of the process, we will extend a formal offer to join our team.Due to laws and regulations, and because EY (and in some cases its clients) has high demands on the reliability and integrity of its employees, every new employee will be screened. Depending on your rank the pre-employment screening could contain the following: Certificate of Conduct (in Dutch: VOG) or - if requesting a Dutch VOG is not possible - Criminal Background Check of the country you are currently living or have lived during the last five years, integrity questionnaire, verification of ID, diploma‚Äôs and/or work experience and consultation of the Dutch insolvency registry.

About the job
            
 
Realise our transformation ambitionsAre you looking for the opportunity to make a significant impact in the world of strategy and transformation? And would you like to join a team of enthusiastic colleagues to welcome you onboard?Then grab this career-building opportunity to leverage your strategy experience as the linchpin between our transformation strategy and the business. Here, you get to work at the heart of our ongoing transformation as you endeavour to bring our key strategic priorities to life in close collaboration with the business executives.‚ÄúYou‚Äôre close to our business and you get to work hands-on with the execution of our strategies. Your work has a real impact, and you can really leave your mark and actually see the difference you‚Äôre making,‚Äù explains Head of Technology Strategy & Execution Anders Juhl Larsen.About the jobWelcome to Strategy & ExecutionTDC NET is on a mission to connect Denmark and drive the green and digital transition through the best and fastest networks. Networks that connect us to each other and the world. Our goal is to remain the best at what we do ‚Äì and in an industry where new technologies are constantly emerging, transformation is never-ending.TDC NET has 2 main business units: Technology and Delivery & Field Service, and we are on the lookout for skilled people to join Strategy and Execution in both areas of TDC NET. Technology is focused on driving key technological agendas, while D&FS represents the largest part of TDC NET with the responsibility of rolling out fiber to reach TDC NETs target of 1 m households and servicing the many customers on TDC NET‚Äôs infrastructure.The Strategy & Execution team works right at the heart of this transformation. Joining the team at our office in either √Örhus (Tranbjerg) or Copenhagen (Teglholmen), you will be met by tight-knit colleagues who welcome you to a project organisation that works to implement our strategy and transformation plans. The teams are responsible for driving and delivering our transformation plans in close collaboration with the Executive Management team.Work hands-on with the implementation of our strategiesAs Senior Strategy Manager, you will be hands-on in driving the transformation within TDC NET, translating the strategy into concrete actions. Your key tasks will be to break down problems into simple manageable solutions, collaborate with business line executives, as well as participate in and lead strategic projects.More specifically, you can look forward to: Collaborating with executives and colleagues across our business linesManaging projects to implement key strategic ambitions ‚Äì this includes setting the project teamPreparing presentations, reporting on progress in strategic initiatives, facilitating workshops, etc.
"As a team, we‚Äôre fuelled by innovation and creativity, and we share a culture of collaboration where new ideas are discussed and valued and with a clear focus on structured problem-solving,‚Äù Anders explains.About youA strategic mind and comprehensive stakeholder management skillsYou have a well-equipped toolbox stocked with the essentials for handling strategic challenges ‚Äì but the most important thing is your enthusiasm and eagerness to learn.Moreover, you can simplify complexity and translate it into easily understood solutions. Also vital are your stakeholder management skills, as you will need to get your business on board to succeed with your transformation efforts. As such, you also need to be able to navigate at all levels of an organisation from executive management to deep technical and operational experts.We also imagine that you: Bring a master‚Äôs degree in economics, finance, or business administrationHave a couple of years of experience from a similar role ‚Äì experience with telco would be nice, but it is not requiredHave experience with corporate strategy projects spanning the business value chainKnow how to manage complex portfoliosAre fluent in English and Danish
"Our team is the ideal choice if you're passionate about strategic projects that bridge business issues and AI & IT solutions. We prioritize having a fun and inclusive culture that ensures you're never alone in your journey to tackle complex problem-solving; support is always at your side," says Victoria Elming, Head of Strategy and Execution, Delivery and Field Service.Ready to take the next step in your career? Contact: If you have questions about the position or want to know more about what it means to work at TDC NET, feel free to reach out to:Head of Strategy & Execution in Technology Anders Juhl Larsen at +45 21 37 77 36 orHead of Strategy & Execution in Delivery and Field Service Victoria Elming at +45 28 86 70 06Location:Teglholmsgade 1, K√∏benhavn or Sletvej 30, AarhusProcess:We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than December 15th, 2023.You can expect to hear from us within 3 weeks from the application date.Click in on www.tdcnet.dk to read more about TDC NET and how it is to work at us.You apply via ‚ÄùApply now‚Äù in the top left corner. Applying with your CV is sufficient.We encourage you not to include a photo in your resume or motivational letter. In TDC NET we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture that values diversity, and we pride ourselves on providing equal opportunities for everyone. All qualified candidates will be assessed regardless of ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability and all the other characteristics that make us different.We are looking forward hearing from you!TDC NET - lots of benefits Engage in meaningful workThe green transition needs a strong digital infrastructure. With us you will take part in delivering the technological solutions.For all of us.We provide the working life of the futureWe set targets for a healthy and safe working environment.Our work culture is digital and flexible when compatible with tasks and colleagues.Welcome to your new hybrid workplace.Development through challenges - get lots of responsibility from day oneGet responsibility quickly and be a part of the biggest transformation in our field - ever.Be challenged.Become part of a strong networkTake part in connecting Denmark together with both new and experienced colleagues and many various professional competencies.In TDC NET we are both motivated and united by a strong network.

Met expertise op het gebied van datamanagement, (grootschalige) implementaties en programma- en projectmanagement in operationele procesverbeteringen. En bovenal met focus op een open en constructieve samenwerking met de klant.Wat ga jij doen? Vertalen van complexe operationele uitdagingen naar pragmatische en doelgerichte aanpak;Begeleiden van organisaties in veranderingen;Meten, analyseren en verbeteren van operationele processen;Inrichten van operationele sturing en rapportages om prestatieverbeteringen te realiseren;Uitvoeren en begeleiden van projecten op het gebied van data-schoning, datamigratie en data-integratie;Meebouwen aan de verdere ontwikkeling en groei van de organisatie.
Wie ben jij? Afgeronde master;Relevante werkervaring binnen utilities of infra is een pre;Nuchter, proactief en met een can-do mentaliteit;Affiniteit met of bovenmatige interesse in processen, data en ondersteunende applicaties;Communicatief sterk en een teamspeler;Je denkt in kansen in plaats van problemen. Jij neemt het voortouw, maakt keuzes en krijgt mensen mee. Samen met anderen maak jij het verschil.
Bij de organisatie Vanaf de eerste werkdag eigen verantwoordelijkheid binnen een sector die volop in beweging is met thema‚Äôs zoals: energietransitie, energiebesparing en data en digitalisering;De ruimte om je eigen ontwikkeling vorm te geven met daarnaast meer dan voldoende interne doorgroeimogelijkheden en persoonlijke begeleiding;Een informele werkomgeving waarbij plezier maken en kwaliteit leveren voorop staat;Uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden met een bonusregeling, 25 vakantiedagen en een leaseauto;Een kantoor in Utrecht, waar je regelmatig samenkomt en de week gezellig afsluit.
ContactHeb je interesse in deze functie? Neem direct contact met ons op! Tel. +31 (6)15 51 57 24 en e-mail: hakima@sense-recruitment.nl

About the job

It‚Äôs great if you have (but not a must!): A good understanding of business processes within the Asset Finance, Digital Banking or Credit Management industryExperience related to implementation of software supporting financial products or other similar business critical systemExperience within TestingSQL and/or webservices skills
If you think we might be a great match, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

About the job
            
 
Are you the driving force behind growth and operational excellence? At Nova Reperta, we're not your average consultancy firm. We're a dynamic team of experts committed to delivering impactful guidance - combining conceptual thinking with hands-on support to our clients. Join us for a consultancy journey that's anything but ordinary and be part of a company culture that values innovation and impact.As an Management Consultant who specialises in Operational Excellence, your role involves:  Developing and implementing OpEx programs and strategies for clients to enhance performance and drive efficiency. We leverage both traditional and digital analysis methods to uncover inefficiencies and streamline operations, making meaningful impact.Building and maintain strong relationships with clients and act as a trusted advisor on all OpEx matters. This includes providing training and coaching to clients on OpEx methodologies, tools, and techniques, as well as culture development.Driving and overseeing the execution of projects, taking full ownership of workstreams including project planning, timeline management, and budgeting for client engagements.
 Perks of being a Novist: Freedom & autonomy: you‚Äôll have the freedom to lead impactful projects and contribute to your own and NR's growth, all while showcasing your talents. Your pace isn't restricted by levels but determined by your competencies, offering you boundless opportunities to reach for the stars and fulfil your ambitions.Entrepreneurial & inclusive: An entrepreneurial and inclusive company culture applicable in client & internal context. We prioritize a profound understanding of the industry, client-centricity by creating long-term trust relationships.Growth & Trust-building: A continuous feedback culture that fosters personal growth and builds trust, encouraging you to develop yourself and others. A one-of-a-kind team of ambitious colleagues, a strong sense of camaraderie and a supportive partner/coach dedicated to assisting and pushing boundaries.Always exploring: Year-round, we spice things up with exciting events, including our epic annual ski trip to keep the good vibes flowing!
 Qualifications we value: A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, Engineering, or any related field.3-8 years of experience in operational excellence, lean management, or related field, preferably in a consulting capacity.Strong communication and interpersonal skills; you can engage with all levels of the organisation by blending IQ and EQ effortlessly.The ability to work independently and collaboratively, juggling multiple projects and priorities with ease.You speak English fluently, in addition to Dutch and/or French.Willingness to travel to client sites as required.
  Who We Are Established in 2011, Nova Reperta is a management consultancy firm with a European presence in Brussels and Amsterdam. From crafting tailored strategies to unleashing agile transformations, we we are renowned by: Partnering with a diverse range of clients, from mid-sized enterprises to industry giants;Fuelling our success with our unique blend of expertise, client-centricity, and camaraderie between our 50+ Novists;Applying our pragmatic spirit and unwavering commitment to teamwork.
When you join us, you'll not only collaborate and grow but also experience the difference that propels you to excel as a management consultant.Ready to lead, grow, and thrive? Join us at Nova Reperta ‚Äì where your career takes centre stage. Apply now and embark on a consultancy adventure unlike any other.

About the job
            
 
Maximize your impactAbout the ChallengeHow about using your Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS) skills to help a global company reduce harmful vehicle emissions and give new life to used metals? And see some of the world in the process? That‚Äôs what our client has in store for you!As a Business Consultant in the Information Systems (IS) department , you will use your managerial and technical skills as a solution expert for LIMS applications. You will focus on the implementation of LIMS applications and be the point of contact for customers. You will interact with business teams on a global and local level.Your Responsibilities Will Include  Maintain the LIMS Labvantage application modules from a functional and configuration point of view Understand the LIMS landscape and applications Coordinate the business unit's LIMS request pipeline Enable the growth of the platform capabilities Lead and execute small and medium projects, from functional requirements analysis to solution delivery
Your Skills  Bachelor's Degree in Applied IT or Master's Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science, or equivalent through experience Project management experience or interest Good communication and problem solving skills Good knowledge of English (oral, written and presentation), other languages a plus Willingness to travel internationally (EU, Asia and Canada) 30-40% of the time Team player with proven ability to take initiative and innovate
Our offerExellys Isn‚Äôt Your Typical Recruiting Or Consulting Agency, We‚Äôre a Different Breed. We Are a Tech Talent Incubator, Which Is Every Bit As Cool As It Sounds. Here‚Äôs What You Can Expect From Us  You‚Äôll join an awesome community and enter one of our Smart Programs, based on where you are in your career and where you want to go. Did we mention you‚Äôll get a personal coach as well? Next to a generous monthly salary, you'll receive a company car or a flexible mobility budget and tons of other benefits (pension, daily compensations, etc.) You‚Äôll spend most of the time at (y)our client‚Äôs, except for regular Exellys trainings, fun events, tribe meet-ups, after works, knowledge sharing sessions, etc. After two years of coaching and upskilling from Exellys, you‚Äôll get the opportunity to join (y)our client‚Äôs organization as an internal employee. Or if you prefer to stay with us, you could explore our follow-up Smart Programs as well.

About the job
            
 
Mirakl is the global leader in platform business innovation. Mirakl's suite of solutions provides enterprises with a transformative way to drive significant growth and efficiency in their online business.Since 2012, Mirakl has been pioneering the platform economy, empowering retail and b2b enterprises with the most advanced, secure and scalable technology to digitize and expand product assortment through marketplace and dropship, improve efficiency in supplier catalog management and payments, personalize shopping experiences, and boost profits through retail media.Mirakl is trusted by 400+ industry-leading businesses worldwide including Macy‚Äôs, Decathlon, Kroger, Airbus, Toyota Material Handling and Sonepar.Headquartered in Paris and Boston and with offices in 7 countries, Mirakl is recognized as a Great Place to Work company.To support this rapid adoption of the marketplace model, and take an active part in our growth, Mirakl is looking for a new member of our EMEA Business Value Consulting Team.The Business Value Consulting Team‚Äôs role is to support Sales teams on value selling and to accelerate sales cycles for large & strategic deals. Team‚Äôs goal is to show the value of platforming a specific business, build relevant use cases by industry and deliver strong Mirakl value propositions to C-levels.The role includes the following: Deliver Business Cases (workshops & analytics) and impactful Mirakl presentations to B2B and B2C C-level prospects: deep dive on the right marketplace strategy for them, share key operational impacts and assess marketplace potential in customer's business contextContribute to Sales Territory & Account plansBuild knowledge ‚Äúnuggets‚Äù and relevant benchmarks to be used by Sales teams in their pitches, working with Customer Success and Solution Engineering teamsLead an industry community at Mirakl and contribute to content creation and community managementLead or contribute to transversal projects on new strategic topicsShare the Platform message at external events & meetings
This job is a unique opportunity to: Be at the heart of the Platform economy by working on new business models and platform use casesWork with C-levels in large companies and help them build a new revenue streamWork with all teams at Mirakl (Customer Success, Solution Engineers, Labs, Marketing, Finance‚Ä¶) to build compelling value propositions
Business Value Consulting team‚Äôs goal is to impact a limited number of high-value deals and bring a more consultative approach to these prospects.Requirements: The ideal candidate: Graduated with a Master degree in Business or EngineeringHas 3+ years minimum of experience, ideally in Consulting or in a Strategy departmentShows strong analytical (incl. Excel modelling) and creative problem solving skillsHas strong business acumenHas good presentation skills, especially in front of high-level customersIs organised, structured and has a lot of drive with a can-do / will-do attitudeIs able to jump into different environments and industriesMust thrive in a dynamic, challenging, fast-paced work environment.Proficiency in both German and English is essential ‚Äì Polish would be strong plus Remote work policy: mandatory in-office for 3 days each week, with the flexibility to work remotely for the remaining 2 days. We are not open to candidates seeking a fully remote position.***
We welcome collaborators with their diverse perspectives and experiences to power us forward. These often far exceed conventional job requirements and help us create a culture of continuous learning. If you‚Äôre ready to join a hyper-growth company at the heart of digital transformation for the world‚Äôs most forward-thinking organizations, we strongly encourage you to apply to any of our roles, even if you think you‚Äôre not an exact match.

About the job
            
 
Werk aan het vernieuwen of verbeteren van processen bij een van onze klanten en zorg voor maximale impact.Jouw rol in ons teamAls Business Consultant ben je onderdeel van een unit die de klant centraal zet en er alles aan doet om ervoor te zorgen dat de klant tevreden is over de verleende diensten. Je werkt aan het vernieuwen of verbeteren van processen bij een van onze klanten. Het totale proces, van offerte tot evaluatie, wordt door het team verzorgd. Je draagt bij aan de digitale transformatie van onze klanten en helpt hen om aan te haken bij de digitale transformatie.Hoe jij ons team versterktWe zoeken een veelzijdige, proactieve en analytische professional met een sterke toewijding aan teamwork en resultaten. De ideale kandidaat heeft de volgende kwalificaties: Een (bijna) afgeronde wo-opleiding op het gebied van bedrijfskunde, bestuurskunde, of business & ITAffiniteit met informatievoorziening, consultancy, of beideDe ambitie om je eigen carri√®re vorm te gevenZin om aan de slag te gaan met opdrachten voor klanten die ervoor zorgen dat Nederland blijft draaien
Waarom CGI?CGI is √©√©n van 's werelds grootste IT-consultancy bedrijven. Onze mensen houden Nederland draaiende. Overheidsinstellingen, banken, lucht- en ruimtevaart, infrastructurele organisaties en energie- en productiebedrijven zijn klanten van CGI.We werken aan interessante projecten die het alledaagse leven van miljoenen mensen raken. We zijn regionaal aanwezig, versterkt met wereldwijde domeinkennis, ons ecosysteem en collega's verspreid over de hele wereld.We zijn trots op de impactvolle projecten die we samen met onze collega‚Äôs tot een succes maken.Bij CGI hechten we veel waarde aan diversiteit en inclusie, omdat dit niet alleen de samenwerking bevordert, maar ook vaak leidt tot betere resultaten. We kijken uit naar jouw bijdrage aan ons team!Werken in kleine zelfsturende teams bestaande uit experts in je vakgebied.‚Ä¢ De regie over je eigen carri√®re met daarbij de ruimte om jezelf te blijven ontwikkelen.‚Ä¢ Je werkt met de nieuwste technologie√´n.‚Ä¢ Een uitstekend salaris en aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden‚Ä¢ Direct een vast contract‚Ä¢ Parttime mogelijkheden‚Ä¢ En de mogelijkheid om CGI aandeelhouder te wordenWaar kom je terecht?Je werkt binnen de Defensie-unit, onderdeel van de sector Defense, Transport & Logistics. Je maakt deel uit van een toegewijd team en hebt de kans om te werken in een uitdagende omgeving. We zijn een partner voor defensieorganisaties in verschillende NATO-landen, waarbij onze activiteiten vari√´ren van cybersecurity, informatiegestuurd optreden, cloud computing, biometrie en secure hosting tot elektronische oorlogsvoering en command & control, evenals ICT-beheer, systeemintegratie en strategische advisering.Sluit je aan bij ons team van experts en solliciteer direct!Solliciteer direct! We nemen dan zo snel mogelijk contact met je op. Vragen over de functie?Stel ze aan Robert van den Berg, Director Consulting Services, via +31 6 2293 2306 of via robert.van.den.berg@cgi.com.Vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Neem contact op met Lilija Alesjkevitsj (Recruitment Business Partner) via 06 2558 7597 of via lilija.alesjkevitsj@cgi.com.We werken niet samen met externe recruitment partijen. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

About the job
            
 
For this job, it is essential to have a good command of the Dutch language!BUSINESS CONSULTANTWil jij de schakel zijn tussen de afdeling Data & IT en de andere afdelingen binnen onze organisatie? Krijg jij energie van het oplossen van complexe puzzels om mooie innovaties bij FM Group te realiseren? Als business consultant bieden wij jou die kans. Met jouw heldere blik op de end-to-end processen in de organisatie help je constant processen te optimaliseren en meer data gedreven te maken. Met jouw goed ontwikkelde soft skills verplaats je je moeiteloos in je gesprekspartners en zo achterhaal jij steeds weer de vraag achter de vraag. Hiermee help je de organisatie om innovatieve projecten te implementeren in Nederland en daarbuiten. Of het nu gaat om het aanpassen van het orderpickproces, het inzichtelijker maken van transportkosten, het ontwikkelen van een nieuwe applicatie, het optimaliseren van ons ERP systeem of het integreren van een bedrijf dat we hebben overgenomen.Denk je aan Nederland, dan denk je aan bloemen! FM Group, marktleider in de sierteeltbranche, opereert wereldwijd en heeft zijn hoofdvestiging in Nederland. Via de uitgebreide webshop kunnen de klanten (bloemisten, groothandel en retail) altijd en overal bestellen uit het ruime assortiment van bloemen, planten en accessoires. Achter deze commerci√´le propositie gaat een complexe logistieke operatie schuil.WAT GA JE DOEN? Je vertaalt functionele wensen naar processen en IT requirements, bijv. het herinrichten van het logistieke proces.Je begeleidt ontwikkel- en implementatietrajecten, bijv. optimalieren van het ERP systeem.Je vormt de belangrijke schakel tussen IT, de overige afdelingen, IT leveranciers en de organisatie.Je helpt bij het prioriteren van diverse projecten en verbeterkansen.Je ondersteunt bij het integreren van bedrijven die zich aansluiten bij de FM Group.
WIE BEN JIJ? Je bent goed in het doorzien van processen en structuren.Je communiceert makkelijk op alle niveaus en weet jouw gesprekspartners mee te krijgen.Je hebt de overtuigingskracht en organisatiesensitiviteit die nodig is om veranderprojecten succesvol te maken.Je bent iemand die zelfstandig is, zelf actie onderneemt en makkelijk contact maakt.Je bent analytisch sterk, neemt niet klakkeloos alles aan en je bent een doorzetter wanneer het moeilijk wordt.Je hebt HBO of WO werk- en denkniveau (bijvoorbeeld een bedrijfskundige of IT gerelateerde studie).Je hebt een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.Ervaring of interesse in processen die aan IT ontwikkeling gerelateerd zijn.Je bent bovenal een enthousiast en ambitieus persoon, die uitdagingen graag met beide handen aangrijpt.Je bent proactief, resultaatgericht, analytisch en pragmatisch.Je bent 28-40 uur per week beschikbaar.
WIL JIJ: Werken in een klein, creatief en gedreven team binnen een grote organisatie?Ruimte om initiatieven te nemen, jezelf te ontwikkelen en opleidingen te volgen?Veel verantwoordelijk en vrijheid in je rol?Werken in een informele en klantgerichte organisatie waar geen dag hetzelfde is?Werken vanuit huis √©n 2 of 3 dagen per week vanuit onze vestigingen in Aalsmeer (evt. deels in Naaldwijk).Flexibele werktijden.Goede arbeidsvoorwaarden (waaronder een eindejaarsuitkering, pensioenregeling, 25 vakantiedagen bij fulltime dienstverband).Regelmatig een bloemetje van de zaak.
Je kan direct solliciteren via de link. Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan s.v.p. contact op met Vincent Zaal, Manager IT Business Applications: 06-53680126.

job_title: Senior Consultant Digital Transformation and Strategy
job_description:
About the job
            
 
Allianz Consulting was established in 2004 as the internal consulting division of the Allianz Group with currently over 500 consultants globally. We are the consulting partner of choice for Allianz Group core segments. Our experienced consulting teams support all Allianz operating entities worldwide in planning and implementing their local key strategic projects.Our consulting services focus on our clients' needs ranging from strategy, market management, sales and distribution, IT, organization, operations to central functions and agile. We bring deep industry and functional expertise to fulfill our clients‚Äô requirements and support the overall vision of Allianz Group.Joining Allianz Consulting means working in an international environment alongside talented people who enjoy sharing their knowledge and experiences, having increased responsibilities. Allianz Consulting has a reputation for growing its talent both formal and on-the-job training from the very first day to ensure strong career development and preparation for future opportunities within the Allianz Group.We are currently looking for a Senior Consultant (m/f/d) to join our Life Insurance Practice Area and support us on a Digital Transformation and Strategy projects. These projects create global impact and help us to support the strategy of the Allianz group worldwide.If you are interested in making a difference, then Allianz Consulting is the place to be!What you will be working on:  You will shape the Digital Transformation of our headquarters and international operating entities You bring our customer buying and agent experience to a digital future. You design and optimize digitally supported customer journeys and digital agent support and tools You lead project workstreams and support the development of junior colleagues by coaching and mentoring them You contribute to the Allianz Consulting community with ideas, thought leadership and training You support the Engagement Manager during pitches and the development of future offerings
Who we are looking for:   You have completed a University degree or equivalent experience You have at least 3 years relevant experience, preferably in Strategy Consulting You bring passion for projects along the customer journey in the field of Digital Sales, Lead Generation, Customer Interaction and Digital Campaigns, Process Analytics, Digital Transformation, Digital Business Model Development or adjacent fields You enjoy solving complex digital challenges, working analytically and in a multi-stakeholder environment You are a team player, eager to collaborate and share learnings You feel comfortable working in interdisciplinary teams and international contexts You communicate fluently in English; German skills are a plus International working experience (min. 6 months) are a plus
What we offer:  Compelling compensation and benefits package Learn from experienced Strategy and Management Consultants Vast number of learning and developmental opportunities Experience working with talented and experienced Consultants while enjoying the benefits of working for a large corporation, e.g. work life balance, extended insurance coverage, limited travel Grow within Allianz Consulting or build the foundation for a successful career withing Allianz group centers or German, and/ or global Operating Entities Take advantage of a large selection of inhouse and external trainings Be part of a community of driven but fun individuals and collaborate on monthly Consulting Fridays reserved for topic, personal and community development
Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

About the job
            
 
Would you like to identify and unlock the business value for your clients while using leading edge technology? Accenture Strategy & Consulting practice are looking for new Strategy Consultants for our Data & AI team. Do you have a passion for transforming businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you can combine your business consulting skills with Data, AI and technology strategy know-how? Then our role as Data Strategy Consultant in our Data & AI practice is a perfect match for you!Description Of The Role And PracticeAccenture Strategy & Consulting enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they look to the future. Through deep industry understanding, analyzes and insights, we give our customers the opportunity to grow in a new world powered by Data and AI. We are known for our ability to execute quickly, and we help our clients identify the right path to competitiveness by innovating in business and technology. The service unit consists of a wide range of business functions and industry groups, and in Data & AI we work from Strategy to Implementation where Data and AI are the focal points.In your role as Data Strategist, you will work on projects like creating Data and AI strategy, assessing Data and AI business opportunities, and developing and optimizing Data and AI operating models. It can also include supporting complex system implementations powered by Accenture that orchestrate and accelerate results by scaling Data and AI platforms for our customers. Specifically, you can expect to:Define business value based on Data and AIAdvise and help our customers through the changes that Generative AI entailsCommunicate technology, Data and AI solutions and the value they create for the business to C-levelBuild Data and AI strategy that is logical, understandable and executable - anchored with CXOsSupport sales activities with e.g. producing sharp content and message for CXO pitchesAnalyze As-Is and design To-Be AI and Data architecture, tools and processesCommunicate new data-driven insights to inspire and transform the way we do businessMake data discovery, form hypotheses and test these together with the customerMeet some of our dedicated people from the Data & AI team:Camilla Kerlauge, Managing director- LinkedIn profileWilliam Juel, Data Science Consultant- LinkedIn profileElizabeth Poulsen, Data Strategy Manager- LinkedIn profileJais J√∏rgensen, Strategy Consultant- LinkedIn profileJob RequirementsWe expect you to have a proven track record of successful Data and AI strategy implementations, a history of thought leadership in the field, and the ability to mentor and guide consultants in the team. Furthermore, we expect the following from you:+1 year of relevant experience within Data and/or AIAnalytical Skills: Able to analyze complex data for insightsBusiness Acumen: Understands business strategy and can align data insights with goals Understands the role of Data & AI in business and can identify Data & AI use casesAdaptability and Learning: Open to new tech and industry trends, eager to learn and adaptCommunication Skills: Can convey technical info clearly to diverse audiencesTechnical Proficiency: Proficient in data tools, programming, statistics, mathematics, data modelling and AI techExecution & leadership: Attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and the ability to work collaboratively as part of a teamRelevant Science/Engineering/Business Master's degree with strong GPAGood written and oral presentation skills in English and Danish or another Nordic languageWhat We Can OfferGreat development opportunities to build your professional career based on your own aspirations, having support from your own mentor.The opportunity to work for the biggest companies in Denmark and the Nordics.Collaboration with a global network of talented, passionate colleagues and experts within your industry. Active Nordic and international communities.Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization ‚Äì including methodology, knowledge databases and benchmarks.Extensive education programs and development opportunities to develop your business acumen, technical and professional skills.Volunteering opportunities locally and around the world.A diverse, inclusive, and socially active workforce.Benefits package with competitive salary, bonus, pension, health insurance, employee share purchase program and other benefits.Good arrangements for combining family life with work and active support for mental health.Apply nowApply online below. Remember to attach CV, university grades and cover letter. We look forward to receiving your application. If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact recruiting lead Therese Bals, therese.bals@accenture.com. Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!About AccentureAccenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy & Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services‚Äîall powered by the world‚Äôs largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 740,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners, and communities. Visit us at our homepage: Accenture | Let there be change, LinkedIn: Accenture Nordics | LinkedIn , Facebook: Accenture Danmark | Facebook, Twitter: Accenture Denmark (@Accenture_DK) / Twitter and or Youtube: Accenture Nordics - YouTube.

About the job
            
 
Job DescriptionAre you interested in a role as the anchor between the business and the development organisation? Do you enjoy working with both the holistic view as well as the details? Then this might be a role for you!Business Implementation SE is a unit within the Strategy, Transformation & Implementation Asset Finance. Asset Finance SE are focusing on the products leasing and hire purchase for Business Customers. Working in Business Implementation SE has a solid Nordic flavor as all the other countries have similar units and we work cross-Nordics on common projects. We also offer development opportunities in an innovative and international environment.We are a team of three with significant focus on quality work in an atmosphere characterized by teamwork and knowledge sharing. The team contributes in various ways to running Asset Finance SE in a profitable way. We are working as the anchor between the business and the Tribe organisation (development organisation) by providing local and sector solution knowledge to Tribes and having the best customer experience as top of mind. We have a general focus to continue the transformation towards more digital, scalable and sustainable solutions.Teamwork in an ever-changing environmentYour role is to drive and contribute to development, and implementation, of new products, services, processes, and systems within the Asset Finance area.You will be part of creating innovative process and system solutions with a focus on customer experience and our internal efficiency. You will work with varied tasks simultaneously - both driving progress in process optimization within large projects, do detailed testing of new solutions and develop simple IT-tools that will increase efficiency.If you have experience from working in the finance area as well as a Business Analyst and wish to broaden your expertise this could be the opportunity you been waiting for.. We offer you a high level of responsibility, an inspiring team and committed managers who encourage you to grow and develop both personally and professionally.Keeping a holistic approach when handling complex issuesTo do well in this role you need able to handle complex initiatives and have great communication skills in an international environment. As this role entails many parallel assignments and responsibilities, it is important that you excel in structuring complex issues and can set your own priorities. You are analytical, take initiatives and have a holistic perspective when working.We believe that you are creative and curious and that you enjoy learning new things when facing difficult issues without obvious answers. You are excited about sharing your ideas and can influence stakeholders at all levels. You are used to work independently and to reach out to different specialists to solve issues and to build networks.We are looking for someone with: - A relevant University degree- Experience from similar positions for example Business Analyst- Experience working with development and process optimization - Knowledge in Tableau, Power BI or coding experience is a merit as well as strong Excel skills- Strong communication skills in English and Swedish- A background within finance is a plus
We also appreciate your ability to work as part of the global team and encourage the sharing of best practice and harmonization aspirations in the Asset Finance area across the Nordic countries.Curious and want to know more?If you have questions about the position, please contact Head of Business Implementation SE, Erika Berggren on +46 703 91 43 21. We look forward to your application!Send your application no later than December 8th . We will be reviewing candidates on a continuous basis.About UsDanske Bank √§r en nordisk bank med broar till omv√§rlden. I 150 √•r har vi hj√§lpt m√§nniskor och f√∂retag att frig√∂ra sin potential. En karri√§r hos oss √§r en m√∂jlighet att bli en del av en gemenskap med 22 000 kollegor i en kultur som pr√§glas av Team Up, Own It och Be Open. M√•let f√∂r v√•r gemensamma resa √§r att transformera Danske Bank till en b√§ttre bank. F√∂r v√•ra kunder, v√•ra medarbetare och samh√§llena runt omkring oss.

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise Certification one or more hyperscalers

About the job
            
 
‚ÄòImpact-maker‚Äô is your middle name? Great, because we have something for you.  We‚Äôre Innovecs, a global tech company specializing in digital transformation. Now, we‚Äôre looking for born innovators who will join our internal team ‚Äì the beating heart of our organization. Every day, we take care of things that simply make us special. The culture, operations, benefits, systems, policies, and most importantly ‚Äì the company‚Äôs future. And we need YOU to help us grow. Are you ready for this challenge? About the projectWe are looking for a Functional Business Consultant to support us with WMS Integration and Implementation projects, Audits, and Consulting projects.About Innovecs Innovecs is a global digital transformation tech company with a presence across Europe, the US, and Asia. For over 12 years, we have been helping businesses develop, transform, and implement innovative products and solutions in Supply Chain & Logistics, Gaming, FinTech, and SaaS markets. Our recent honors include being on the Global Outsourcing 100 list produced by IAOP¬Æ, The Inc. 5000 ranking, and The Top 50 Inspiring Workplaces List.Requirements 4+ years of experience in functional and business analysis;Ability to translate business requirements to functional requirements;Experience in working with WMS;Industry awareness: Supply Chain overall and execution in particular (WMS, TMS);Experience of working in an Agile environment;Strong analytical skills, problem-solving mindset, attention to detail, and ability to communicate effectively with different levels of stakeholders;Ability and willingness to travel sometimes to work onsite with clients.
Responsibilities In summary, a Functional Business Consultant acts as a bridge between the client's business needs and the implementation of software solutions. They ensure that the software is configured, customized, and used effectively to meet the client's functional requirements and objectives.‚Äã Is subject matter expert on WMS and its configuration.System Configuration: Based on the gathered requirements, the functional consultant configures the software system to meet the client's specific needs. This may involve customization of the software, setting up user roles, defining workflows, and configuring data fields.‚ÄãFunctional Documentation: Functional Consultants create comprehensive documentation that outlines how the software will be configured to meet the client's requirements. This documentation serves as a reference for both the client and the technical team responsible for implementing the changes.‚ÄãUser Training: They provide training to end-users and stakeholders to ensure they can effectively use the software to perform their tasks. This training may include workshops, user guides, and support during the transition to the new system.‚ÄãTesting: Functional Consultants are involved in the testing phase to ensure that the configured software meets the specified requirements. They collaborate with the testing team to identify and resolve any functional issues or deviations.‚ÄãUser Support: After the software is implemented, Functional Consultants often provide ongoing user support. They address user questions, troubleshoot issues, and ensure that the software continues to meet the evolving needs of the client.‚ÄãChange Management: Implementing new software often brings changes to established workflows and processes. Functional Consultants help manage these changes by working with stakeholders to ensure a smooth transition and user adoption.‚ÄãOptimization: Over time, Functional Consultants assess how the software is performing in the client's environment. They may identify opportunities for further optimization, process improvements, or additional functionality to enhance the value of the software.‚ÄãFeedback Collection: Functional Consultants gather feedback from users and stakeholders to understand their experiences with the software. This feedback can inform future enhancements and improvements to the system.‚ÄãDocumentation Updates: As the software evolves or changes are made, Functional Consultants update the documentation to reflect the current state of the system and its alignment with the client's requirements.‚Äã
What you will get:   Competitive compensation with a generous bonus program; Flexible hours and remote-first mode: we value flexible working hours over set hours, results over number of hours, and transparent communication over need-to-know access.
