About the job
            
 
OrganisatieBij mijn klant begrijpen zij dat opdrachtgevers voor aanzienlijke uitdagingen staan. Ze zijn ervan overtuigd dat digitalisering een krachtig instrument is om deze uitdagingen aan te gaan. Echter, dit proces is verre van eenvoudig. Zo zien zij vaak dat projecten vastlopen en verstrikt raken, terwijl ze juist bedoeld zijn om oplossingen te bieden. Met uiteenlopende belanghebbenden, verschillende zienswijzen over de oplossing, beperkte budgetten, verouderde ICT-systemen die aangepakt moeten worden, en een wirwar van technologische mogelijkheden (of beperkingen) die al dan niet een oplossing kunnen bieden‚Ä¶ Het behouden van overzicht is al een uitdaging op zich, laat staan het succesvol afronden van het project.Ze hebben een heldere aanpak en brengen complexe vraagstukken terug tot de kern. Zij richten ons op het uiteindelijke doel, onderbouwen elke mogelijke optie en belichten de gevolgen. Zij vertalen technische aspecten naar begrijpelijke taal, zodat duidelijk wordt hoe ICT bijdraagt aan de oplossing. Hierdoor wordt het nemen van de juiste beslissingen in moeilijke situaties mogelijk en meer toegankelijk. Dit betekent niet dat zij de beslissingen voor de opdrachtgevers maken, maar dat zij de verschillende keuzemogelijkheden en de bijbehorende gevolgen helder uiteenzetten.Functie-informatieBen jij een deskundige op het gebied van digitale bedrijfsstrategie? Heb je een scherp oog voor de rol van ICT bij het verwezenlijken van strategische doelen? Bij mijn klant geloven zij dat digitale transformatie, digitalisering en het optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen cruciale terreinen zijn waar ICT een groot verschil kan maken. De klanten zijn volop bezig met deze uitdagingen en verkennen de nieuwste generatie toepassingen zoals geconnecteerde apparaten, AI-oplossingen en robotisering. Dit alles wordt ondersteund door moderne technologie√´n zoals IoT, 5G, data-analyse, geavanceerde cloud technologie en ontwikkelplatformen.In de rol van Business Digitalization Consultant ben jij d√© expert die de klanten adviseert over hoe ICT een cruciale rol kan spelen bij het aanpakken van hun uitdagingen en het verwezenlijken van hun zakelijke doelen. Als ervaren consultant ben je een gesprekspartner voor directieleden, CIO's en andere bestuurders van vooraanstaande bedrijven, waaronder organisaties zoals Sanquin, Alliander en Schiphol. Met jouw inspirerende visie op huidige technologie√´n en toekomstige ontwikkelingen op het gebied van digitalisering, help je hen inzicht te krijgen in de potentie van technologie. Dit vereist een brede kennis en een sterke visie op uiteenlopende ICT-thema's, waaronder cloud computing, data-analyse, AI, IT-beheer en architectuur.Je weet naadloos aan te sluiten bij de uitdagingen en bedrijfsdoelen van de klanten en helpt hen een digitale strategie te ontwikkelen waarin de mogelijkheden en kansen van ICT worden benut om hun zakelijke doelstellingen te bereiken. Dit omvat het opstellen van business cases, het cre√´ren van roadmaps en het vertalen van deze strategie naar de benodigde ICT-architectuur voor de organisatie van de klanten. Deze vraagstukken hebben meestal betrekking op informatiemanagement en administratieve processen. Kennis en ervaring op dit gebied, evenals begrip van de organisatiestructuur en -context van (semi-)publieke organisaties, zijn dan ook essentieel.Functie-eisen‚Ä¢ Je hebt een succesvol afgeronde WO-opleiding in Bedrijfskunde, Bedrijfskundige Informatica of een vergelijkbaar vakgebied.‚Ä¢ Ervaring in het opstellen van business strategie√´n en bijbehorende IV- en IT-strategie√´n is vereist, bij voorkeur binnen de (semi-)publieke sector.‚Ä¢ Je hebt senior adviseur ervaring en bent gewend om strategisch advies te geven en acquisitie te doen.‚Ä¢ Een solide commercieel netwerk op bestuursniveau binnen de publieke sector, gezondheidszorg of onderwijs is een pr√©.‚Ä¢ Aantoonbare ervaring in het adviseren van bestuurders en directieleden over diverse vraagstukken waarin IV/ICT een cruciale rol speelt.‚Ä¢ Je bent goed op de hoogte van moderne technologie√´n en de nieuwste ontwikkelingen, en je kunt deze kennis omzetten in concrete strategie√´n en business cases.‚Ä¢ Je hebt oog voor belanghebbenden en weet hen effectief te betrekken in je adviestrajecten, zodat je aanbevelingen uitvoerbaar en breed gedragen zijn.Aanbod‚Ä¢ ‚Ç¨ 85k (senior), afhankelijk van ervaring en opleiding‚Ä¢ Variabele individuele en collectieve beloning tot 25% (senior) van jaarsalaris‚Ä¢ Keuze tussen mobiliteitsbudget of leaseauto‚Ä¢ 28 vakantiedagen op fulltime basis, plus extra dagen voor 'jonge ouders' of mogelijkheid tot aan-/verkoop van vakantiedagen‚Ä¢ Ruim aanbod aan training, opleiding en coaching voor voortdurende ontwikkeling‚Ä¢ Flexibel werken op locatie en in tijd, passend bij jouw situatie

About the job

LET‚ÄôS GET DOWN TO BUSINESSAs a Business Process Consultant, you are responsible for leading change initiatives that improve processes and develop new projects to drive operational efficiency, data analysis & customer satisfaction improvement. You will facilitate and lead assigned projects within the financial services industry working with cross-functional teams utilising operational excellence best practices and will be responsible for the implementation of change, from initiation to execution. More specifically you will: Work closely with clients and the business to identify and analyse core business processes and workflows: mapping of existing processes (AS IS), evaluate AS IS, design TO BE situation, perform a GAP analysis, ‚Ä¶Identify process inefficiencies and areas for improvement through (data) analysis, stakeholder interviews and observation.Facilitate workshops in order to document processes, collect data, analyse information.Develop and maintain documentation of processes and workflows, including standard operating procedures and process manuals.Facilitate process workflow modelling in order to identify possible process improvements, automation capabilities and clearly defined end-to-end use cases.Generate reports and share necessary information with appropriate stakeholders.

Skills & Knowledge  You can summarize complex processes and steps in an understandable way.Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills.Strong skills in Process Mapping & Knowledge of BPM.High level of competence with MS Office and Visio/ARIS.Fluency in English, French and/or Dutch.
Soft skills  Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders.You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach.Ability to adapt to different audiences and levels of stakeholders.
Good to show us: Knowledge or experience with working in an Agile environment.Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma methodology.Experience in Change Management.Knowledge of Robotic Process Automation and Artificial Intelligence is an asset.Concrete experience, qualifications, certifications as a project manager, process manager or business analyst.
NOW TAKE THE NEXT STEPWorking at Capco will offer you the platform and the opportunity to solve significant business issues and to contribute to transforming the world‚Äôs most innovative financial services and ultimately forming the future of finance in delivering innovative solutions to our clients. About the job
            
 
THIS IS YOUR JOBAt Effectory we help organizations to perform better through employee feedback and enable organizations to reach their goals in a people centric way. As a People Strategy Consultant you will make sure your clients‚Äô employee listening activities are linked to their HR and business strategy. You will make sure employee listening is an integral driver of change in the clients organization. As we are expending in the German market we are looking for a People Strategy Consultant to be a driver of change in the DACH region.Our People Strategy Consultants have a dedicated client portfolio but will also be available for other clients if your expertise is required. Together with the Customer Success Manager you will determine what role the consultant can play in driving customer value. You are actively adding value to your clients by developing & showcasing thought leadership. Together with the client you set up listening strategy goals that are linked to their business strategy and translate these into relevant listening strategies. Analyzing employee feedback data and putting this into recommendations linked to the clients‚Äô HR and business strategy. You advise on how to use these insights to tackle human capital challenges. This is where your expert knowledge and best practices come to use.Being a trusted strategic advisor based on expertise means you are committed to identify/conceptualize/expand thought leadership content to be used in modular advisory of clients via e.g. leadership or change management. You actively develop your own knowledge with relation to human capital. You share this knowledge with colleagues, clients and external network to amplify our expertise role in the market. You facilitate impact by challenging clients to continuously adapt and improve as a strategic business consultant (at C-level) based on trust and expertise.THIS IS YOUYou have at least 5 years of experience in a consulting role and you have overall knowledge of HR themes (such as organizational development, leadership, change management, health & well-being). Next to that: You have a master‚Äôs degree, preferably in a related field such as HR or Work and Organizational Psychology).You‚Äôre a strategic thinker and have business acumen.You‚Äôre excellent at stakeholder management skills on different levels.You have extensive experience working in the DACH region.As an excellent communicator you know your way through all levels of a client's organization.You're great at problem solving.You are fluent in English and German and preferably you live in or around Munich.
THIS IS USEffectory is Europe‚Äôs leading employee feedback solution. With our platform, HR and management we collect employee feedback throughout the employee journey. This feedback is transformed into people analytics that informs strategies to boost productivity, engagement and retention. Built on 25 years‚Äô experience, our 200 specialists in Amsterdam and Munich support more than 1,200 organizations in 110 countries. Now more than ever, HR is an integral part of business strategy, which is why our feedback solution is tailor-made for strategic HR.Effectory‚Äôs missionWe are dedicated to improving the working world by giving employees a voice and making sure their feedback has an impact. Our experts work with HR teams and managers around the world, using employee feedback to overcome some of their biggest people-oriented challenges. From software engineers to HR specialists, every day Effectory‚Äôs people work to improve the working world, and we are looking for talented individuals who also want to be part of this mission.THIS IS WHAT WE OFFER A monthly salary and an annual bonus scheme.30 holidays for FTEs, and flexible public holiday options.A fun and interactive onboarding program to get to know our company and some of your new colleagues.A learning budget to spend on your own personal development. We also provide extensive professional and personal development opportunities, and also organize yearly summer and winter schools.Flexible working: you will be able to work max 60% of your contract hours from home (or any other location in the Netherlands and/or Germany).Budget to set up your home office.Yearly Body & Mind budget to spend on anything that energizes (or relaxes) you.Trips to Amsterdam for annual events, such as our Winter party, summer party & the legendary Big Day.Additional monthly compensation for working from home.The option to work abroad for up to 4 months, or to take an unpaid sabbatical.You get your birthday off work, and can also take a day to volunteer for a cause of your choice.

We all think it went well: we now meet live (or in a video call) to get to know each other a bit better4. We like each other even more: you meet potential team members and get a bit of a pleasant grilling5. We want to see you in action: you complete a case/assessment6. The final hurdle: we agree on terms & conditions, we sign and you start!

About the job
            
 
ENGIE Consulting  is ENGIE‚Äôs in-house management consulting service provider. Leveraging 10+ years of experience and credentials, ENGIE Consulting acts as a key lever of the ENGIE‚Äôs growth, transformation and performance by delivering a broad spectrum of projects to both Operational Entities and Corporate Functions across the GroupA workforce of 80+ professionals offering multidisciplinary skills and performing more than 170 assignments per year in 4 areas :  sustainable development (new offers/market surveys/external growth,...) operational performance (lean/operational expenditures reduction,...) transformation projects (innovation/digital/organisation,...) mobilisation of teams (change management/collective momentum,...)
 Your role as Business Management Consultant Attached to the Director of Consulting and integrated into a team of internal consultants, you will carry out and contribute in consulting assignments in the 4 areas cited and in varied environments (operational entities, Corporate management of the Group, the Business Activities). The main duties of the Business Management Consultant   you will carry out projects for our internal customers  you will contribute to describe customer needs and to develop suitable proposals  you will contribute to supervising work on project work-sites  you will take charge of one or more deliverables or several work-sites of the assignment under the supervision of a project manager  you will contribute to the development of conclusions, recommendations and will have the ability to make proposals during the assignment  you will manage stakeholders as well as operational relations with customer representatives  you will relay information and alerts to the management of the assignments  you will participate in the development of Internal Consulting within ENGIE  you will participate in the formulating of points of view and new offers of service  you will develop relevant knowledge/methodologies and shall capitalize on know-how  you will contribute to the internal life activities within ENGIE Consulting 
 Your profile as Business Management Consultant   higher education (engineering school, business school or equivalent in university,...)  minimum 2 - 5 years of experience in consultancy  you have a sense of commitment, a sense of customer service, the ability to analyze and to summarize your findings,  you have the ability to adapt to different professional contexts  you are a team-player, good with relationships, comfortable with both oral and written communication with a good sense of the formality required  your customer orientation and your ability to learn and to advance with the team, your supervisors and our internal customers are some of the conditions for success in the job  you are bilingual FR/NL or NL/FR with a good mastery of English (both spoken and written) and of office tools 
 Work Location Position mainly based in Brussels - Belgium).Short-term and medium-term travel is expected We offer you   an interesting opportunity for anyone who likes to develop her/his career at one of the key energy players driving for zero carbon transition.  space for development and lifelong learning  a balanced pool of young and experienced professionals with a Mix of ENGIE‚Äôs business knowledge and consulting expertise, ENGIE Consulting is an active Member of the French In-House Consulting Association  the opportunity to connect with inspirational colleagues all over the world  a culture of adaptability, ownership and cooperation.  an attractive remuneration package with many options to choose from (an attractive base pay, a bonus scheme, a range of extralegal benefits (including lease car or mobility budget), lunch vouchers, discounts at a range of stores.  a menu of flexible work options  a wide set of vacation days 
become part of a dynamic and caring organization committed to wellbeing, inclusion and diversity

About the job
            
 
Description   Given the growth that Efficio is going through, we are looking for procurement and supply chain Management Consultants to join the team with the delivery of client work. We operate on hybrid working pattern that combines both remote work and on-site presence. As part of our dedication to meeting client and business needs, flexibility to travel is essential.Efficio Consultants lead specific workstreams on consulting projects. They manage the collection and analysis of client data and contribute to the development of recommendations and solutions. Once the strategies are agreed with the client, Consultants are responsible for planning and implementing them, and ensuring that targeted outcomes are achieved.Consultants provide support, guidance and direction to Efficio Business Analysts (Junior Consultants) on projects, and ensure Efficio methodologies and processes are followed. They are typically accountable to a more senior consultant on specific projects, but are given significant responsibility for their workstream - for example, they may lead and be responsible for successful negotiations with suppliers. They must be confident in their ability to challenge existing ways of working, recognise opportunities and identify innovative solutions that add real value to clients.Consultants are also responsible for managing key relationships with client stakeholders, leveraging their institutional knowledge and expertise, and ensuring buy-in to the agreed strategies. While a strong grasp of the detail and a ‚Äòhands-on‚Äô approach are essential, excellent interpersonal and leadership skills are key to success in this role. For those with the talent, drive and ambition to excel, it provides a unique opportunity to take their consulting career to the next level. Essential Requirements   An exemplary academic background; preferably with a top degree in Engineering, Science, Business, or Economics Must have some relevant management consulting experience within a leading consultancy German language (in addition to English) is highly essential Must have the right to work in the country in which you are applying
 Desirable Requirements   Demonstrated ability to work in complex environments both independently and as part of a team Strong analytical skills and problem solving ability Ability to isolate key issues and draw sound conclusions Proficiency in the use of Excel and PowerPoint Proactive, enquiring approach Strong communicator with the ability to influence stakeholders of all levels Willingness and desire to travel is required

About the job
            
 
Senior Strategy Consultant - EY-Parthenon - Strategy&TransactionsEY-Parthenon is a part of EY and is one of the largest global strategy consulting organizations, with more than 6,500 professionals. We help CEOs and business leaders design and deliver transformative strategies across the entire enterprise, to help build long-term value to all stakeholders. Due to rapid expansion, we are now looking for candidates to join our Warsaw team and we want you to explore our Analyst/Senior Consultant role.Hear more about job offer from our Strategy Manager watch our video ad and read more below:You‚Äôll be a part of a very dynamic team focused on the following types of projects: Corporate and growth strategy ‚Äì providing in-depth market, competitor and customer insights and leveraging financial and operational perspectives to implement strategic plans,Transaction strategy and execution ‚Äì projects across the whole deal lifecycle (e.g. Commercial Due Diligence, Value Creation Plan, Post Merger Integration),Turnaround and restructuring strategy ‚Äì projects focused on solving business issues in critical and complex situations to reshape for a better future.
Locally, our focus is in the below sectors: Private Equity,Consumer Products & Retail,Financial Services,Technology & Media & Telecommunication,B2B Services,Industry.
Your key responsibilities: leading project workstreams and small teams within the projects from a diverse range of industries,supporting business development through developing intellectual property, proposal documents and attending sales meetings,developing and mentoring junior team members.
Skills and attributes for success: graduate of a top tier Polish or foreign university,strong track record in strategy consulting ‚Äì at least 3-4 years within a Strategy or Big 4 consultancy or blue chip industry organization,fluency in Polish and English (other languages are considered an advantage).
What working at EY-Parthenon offers: Professional and financial support in acquiring recognized qualifications and certificationsUdemy for Business - access to more than 3,000 online training coursesGo Fluent - language courses, EY Badges - global certification of your competencies and the opportunity to earn an MBA title from a prestigious university Career Counselor - a dedicated advisor to support your career development at EY Innovate EY - a unique intrapreneurship program EY Care & Wellness program: massages, tickets, sports cards, life insurance and other benefits
Our workplace is disability friendly.

About the job
            
 
Voor Chainresult Business Implementation zijn wij op zoek naar een Businesse Consultant (Nederlands verplicht)Business ConsultantAls Business Consultant ben jij medeverantwoordelijk voor de begeleiding van klanten tijdens business projecten. Je werkt intensief samen met jouw ervaren collega‚Äôs aan diverse projecten bij verschillende klanten. Je draagt bij aan creatieve oplossingen en stemt deze af met jouw collega‚Äôs en klanten om te komen tot innovatieve veranderprocessen. Het succes van jouw werk wordt bepaald door een procesmatige manier van denken, een planmatige wijze van werken en het op de juiste manier afstemmen van informatie en plannen. Dit kan bij het voorbereiden van een presentatie voor een project zijn, het geven van trainingen aan de klant om deze oplossingen succesvol te implementeren, of het uitwerken van een brainstormsessie tot een helder en klantgericht rapport. Een unieke rol om je verder te ontwikkelen en inzicht te krijgen in (internationale) organisaties in de agri-foodsector.Jouw profiel Je bent klantgericht en een gedreven procesdenker die graag het verschil maakt. Je bent energiek en anticipeert makkelijk op veranderingen. Je hebt de flexibiliteit en bereidheid om te reizen naar klanten in verschillende delen van Nederland.Wij zoeken  Een zelfsturende professional met 0 tot 5 jaar ervaring in een (internationale) supply chain omgeving;Een afgeronde hbo/wo-opleiding bijvoorbeeld richting Technische Bedrijfskunde of Operations& Supply Chain Management;Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse-en Engelse taal.
Over Chainresult Chainresult is sinds 2001 specialist in het versnellen en optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen bij toonaangevende internationaal opererende bedrijven in de agri-foodsector. Een team van energieke en ondernemende professionals zijn bepalend voor het succes en de groei van Chainresult. Samen met de klant, zorgt Chainresult voor een grondige analyse van de bedrijfsprocessen en structuren. Met vernieuwende concepten, het optimaliseren van processen en realiseren van betere systemen biedt Chainresult de klant de mogelijkheid om volgende stappen te maken. De consultants van Chainresult begeleiden deze stappen van plan tot realisatie en zijn pas tevreden als de kwaliteit boven verwachting is. De groei van activiteiten en projecten vraagt om uitbreiding.Cultuur Binnen Chainresult werken professionals met veel passie voor het vakgebied. Binnen het team is er een hoge mate van collegialiteit en er wordt intensief samengewerkt binnen projecten. De collega‚Äôs van Chainresult staan open om van elkaar te leren en zijn bereid feedback te geven en te ontvangen. Dit alles met een mooie dosis humor.Chainresult biedt Een uitdagende functie waarin je het beste uit jezelf en uit je omgeving kunt halen. Je krijgt veel vrijheid en verantwoording om je werk naar eigen inzicht uit te voeren. Chainresult biedt een inwerktraject met zowel inhoudelijke als persoonlijke begeleiding. Daarnaast ontvang je een uitstekend pakket primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een auto van de zaak, laptop en mobiel. Daarnaast krijg je de mogelijkheid tot het volgen van opleidingen en trainingen.Informatie Voor aanvullende informatie kun je contact opnemen met Annegreet van Wier van H√ÜD (06) 1075 1991, die de sollicitatieprocedure namens Chainresult cooÃàrdineert. Wil je reageren op deze vacature dan kan dit online via de website van H√ÜD, www.haed.nl of via vanwier@haed.nl.

About the job
            
 
Zorgorganisaties data gedreven laten werken? Daar zorg jij voor!Bij Tenzinger zijn we op zoek naar gedreven zorginnovators met lef en overtuigingskracht, die met hun diepgaande kennis het verschil willen maken voor onze klanten!In de rol van Business Consultant leg jij de focus op het verbinden van mens, proces, systeem en data. Hiermee lever je een cruciale bijdrage aan het bevorderen van een gezonde bedrijfsvoering binnen zorginstellingen. Het optimaliseren van processen en stuurinformatie, en het bevorderen van data-gedreven werken, zijn sleutelfactoren om met meer inzicht betere beslissingen te nemen en organisatiedoelen te realiseren.Als Business Consultant werk je zowel bij onze opdrachtgevers op locatie als minimaal √©√©n keer per week op ons kantoor in Utrecht.Je maakt deel uit van het team 'Business Consultancy', dat bestaat uit ongeveer 8 collega's, vari√´rend van Young Professionals tot Experts.Wat ga je doen als Business Consultant?Tenzinger Business Consultancy is d√© partner voor de zorg, waarbij we geloven in nauwe samenwerking met onze opdrachtgevers. Bij Tenzinger bundelen we technologie en expertise tot krachtige oplossingen, waarmee we zorgorganisaties helpen om op data gebaseerde beslissingen te nemen en een digitale transformatie te ondergaan.Als Business Consultant ben jij de drijvende kracht achter projecten die zorgorganisaties ondersteunen in hun overgang naar data-gedreven werken. Met jouw achtergrond en begrip van de zorgsector leid je projecten en vertaal je uitdagingen en kansen naar praktische en effectieve strategie√´n.Jouw taken omvatten onder andere: Meewerken aan of leiden en beheren van projecten die zorgorganisaties transformeren naar een data-gedreven werkwijze.Klanten adviseren over de integratie van data-analyse en data-gestuurde besluitvormingsprocessen.Analyseren van de huidige bedrijfsvoering en het identificeren van mogelijkheden om datagebruik te optimaliseren.Begeleiden van veranderingsprocessen en het in beweging krijgen van organisaties om data-gedreven te denken en te handelen.Samenwerken met technische teams om oplossingen te implementeren.
Samen met de zorgorganisatie bekijk jij wat er nodig is om tijd terug te geven aan de zorg door data-gedreven te werken, processen te optimaliseren of stuurinformatie te verbeteren.Projecten om zorgorganisaties te ondersteunen bij data-gedreven werken zijn heel divers, vari√´rend van het uitvoeren van een scan tot advisering om stuurinformatie te verbeteren, en van workshops om processen te optimaliseren tot het gebruik van de door ons ontwikkelde 'volwassenheidsscan' om inzicht te geven in de mate van data-volwassenheid. Op basis van deze scan stel je een plan van aanpak op om de zorgorganisatie de eerste stappen te laten zetten naar data-gedreven werken.Je hebt zelf een belangrijk aandeel in het binnenhalen van nieuwe opdrachten voor het team. Met jouw netwerkkwaliteiten en marktkennis weet jij wat de klant nodig heeft en kun je de juiste oplossing bieden.Naast deze boeiende opdrachten draag jij samen met het team bij aan het delen van kennis, zowel intern als extern. Dit gebeurt onder andere via intervisie, webinars, whitepapers en coaching van junior consultants.Wat vragen wij van jou als Business Consultant?Wij hechten waarde aan het feit dat je je thuis voelt in onze bedrijfscultuur, die zich kenmerkt door flexibiliteit, energie, pragmatisme en kwaliteitsgerichtheid. Ondernemerschap is een sleutelbegrip bij Tenzinger: we geloven in eigenaarschap en vrijheid!Daarnaast verwachten wij: Een hbo-diploma in Bedrijfskunde, Zorgmanagement of Data Science.Minimaal 3-5 jaar ervaring in projectmanagement en organisatieadvies.Ervaring met datagedreven projecten en het behalen van meetbare resultaten.Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden om complexe concepten aan verschillende belanghebbenden uit te leggen.ervaring in de zorg in een preProactieve, analytische en zelfstandige werkhouding.Kennis van datatechnologie√´n, -tools en -processen binnen de context van de zorgsector.
Wat bieden wij jou als Business ConsultantEen rol met betekenis en impact, dat is wat je kunt verwachten als Business Consultant bij Tenzinger.Verder bieden wij: Een salaris tussen ‚Ç¨3.500,- en ‚Ç¨5.000,- obv een 40-urige werkweek Een laptop en mobiele telefoon die je ook priv√© mag gebruiken.Een leaseauto.25 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid om extra dagen bij te kopen.Collectiviteitskorting op je zorgverzekering en een pensioenregeling.Een informele werkomgeving met regelmatige borrels en activiteiten.Een budget van ‚Ç¨500 om jouw thuiswerkplek in te richten.
Interesse of vragen?Bij Tenzinger werken 250 zorginnovators, stuk voor stuk experts die dagelijks hard werken aan het verbeteren van de zorg. Als werkgever zorgen wij ervoor dat onze medewerkers zich blijven ontwikkelen en nog beter worden. Hoe doen we dat? Door te investeren in ontwikkeling, het faciliteren van trainingen en opleidingen, en het bieden van een goede werk-priv√©balans.Heb je interesse?Solliciteer dan nu of neem contact op met onze recruiter!

About the job
            
 
We are looking for passionate, curious and driven team players who are ready to ignite ideas, push boundaries and drive innovation. At Accenture you‚Äôll work on innovative projects and develop your career, collaborating with the best teams in the world. You'll learn, grow and advance in an innovative culture that thrives on shared success, diverse ways of thinking and enables boundaryless opportunities that can drive your career in new and exciting ways.About AccentureAccenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services and Accenture Song‚Äîall powered by the world‚Äôs largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at accenture.comWorking closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world‚Äôs leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.We are looking for Consultants (3 years of experience) to be part of the leading Strategy & Consulting practice in Supply Chain & Operations (SCO). We are looking professional with experience in: Strategic cost optimization programs applying Zero Based mindset disrupting costs structure by maximizing digital technologies, analytics and new ways of working Customer centric supply chain as a key engine for business growth, e.g. last mile delivery models Digital Procurement Transformations, org. design, new operating models, strategic sourcing and tech-driven procurement transformation Supply Chain transformation: logistics, fulfillment, transportation‚Ä¶ Application of Analytics and Big data in SCO Other functional experiences valuated would be manufacturing, engineering, order to cash, program managementPreferred Skills Experienced in Strategic Consulting and Supply Chain & Operations firms Ability to execute projects and bring innovation to our clients Excellent written and oral communication skills with ability to clearly communicate ideas and results on all organization levels Drive, ambition and initiative to help grow Accenture¬¥s business at functional and Industry level People development and team building skills Fluent in Spanish and English is mandatoryAccenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, or gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

About the job
            
 
Werk waar je trots op kan zijnDit ga je doenOnze afdeling Markt is in ontwikkeling door de energietransitie. De afdeling Markt is verantwoordelijk voor een juiste, klantgerichte verrekening van energiestromen tussen klanten, marktpartijen en Stedin. Dit noemen wij marktfacilitering. De afgelopen jaren richtte de afdeling Markt zich op het verbeteren van onze dienstverlening richting de marktpartijen, zoals energieleveranciers en congestie service providers. Nu wordt er gewerkt aan een energiemarkt die betaalbaar is en optimaal werkt voor klanten en marktpartijen.De ‚ÄòSector‚Äô is de plek waar wij als gezamenlijke netbeheerders samenwerken met alle stakeholders die werken in de energiesector. Wij werken onder andere aan het innovatief oplossen van netschaarste en de transitie naar een flexibel, hybride en meer digitaal energiesysteem. De komende jaren wordt de focus vooral gelegd op de energietransitie mogelijk maken, de samenwerking in de sector en het beschikbaar maken van energiedata.Daarom hebben we een team Sectorstrategie. Zo‚Äôn 10 experts en adviseurs in dit team richten zich op be√Ønvloeding van de besluitvorming (intern en extern) van projecten die de werking van de energiemarkt verbeteren. Zo wordt er bijvoorbeeld gewerkt aan nieuwe marktmodellen voor waterstof als energiedrager en congestiemanagement (denk aan de inzet van flexibele contractvormen). Jij behartigt onze belangen met betrekking tot marktfacilitering, zowel binnen als buiten Stedin, door onder andere het uitwerken en presenteren van adviezen. Om dit goed te kunnen doen hanteer je een verbindende aanpak en ben je zeer goed in stakeholdermanagement, omdat je goed communiceert en klantvriendelijk bent. Je onderhoudt een breed netwerk van verschillende netbeheerders en andere stakeholders in de energiemarkt. Doordat jij jouw visie goed kan presenteren, draag jij bij aan innovatie van de marktfacilitering en een stevige positie van Stedin op landelijk niveau.Je onderzoekt en analyseert ontwikkelingen en trends in de energie Sector. Deze vertaal je naar adviezen en beleidsvoorstellen waardoor het beleid van Stedin (en de andere netbeheerders) actueel en passend is. Jij adviseert niet alleen maar levert ook een bijdrage aan de integrale planvorming en implementatie binnen en buiten Stedin. Hierbij vertegenwoordig jij Stedin in werkgroepen op sectorniveau. Zo geef je handen en voeten aan jouw advies. Ben jij creatief en vernieuwend in jouw manier van denken en handelen, √©n ook nog eens sympathiek? Dan pas je ook zeker in ons team!Een quote van collega uit het team over zijn werkdag:Op maandag werk ik met mijn andere teamcollega‚Äôs op ons hoofdkantoor op de Blaak in Rotterdam. Zo hou ik meer feeling met het team en met de thema‚Äôs waar zij mee bezig zijn. Wij werken samen met andere netbeheerders en/of marktpartijen aan veel boeiende onderwerpen die in de energiesector spelen. Zo werken wij mee aan de nieuwe Energiewet. About the job
            
 
Who We Are   BICG is the union of talent from various disciplines applied to think, design, and implement the Company Experience¬Æ in organizations. We are economists, journalists, psychologists, sociologists, mathematicians, computer scientists, engineers, and architects, among other specializations. Ultimately, we form a multidisciplinary creative team with a common denominator: the pursuit of excellence in each project, regardless of the challenge involved. With over 20 years of experience, we have found that the most successful organizations are those that pay great attention to the experience of the employees, as well as to the customer experience and those that address these two factors in an integrated manner. Ultimately, we change people¬¥s lives by changing the organizations they work for. Thanks to the implementation of a new Company Experience, we align the company‚Äôs goals with the reality that its different audiences live, using most appropriately all the levers available and, especially, seamlessly linking them together. We transform the environment, the processes, and above all, the culture of the company.  We are hiring!  We are looking for a CHANGE MANAGEMENT CONSULTANT based in Madrid.   What you will do You will develop your work supporting the implementation of projects in clients during the complete cycle of our projects. Some of your key activities will be:  Participation in BICG projects in the analysis and diagnosis phase, development of working models, and change management. Follow-up of prospects, business development strategy, and management of customer relations for the coordination, in support of regional management, of projects for new forms of work and evolution of the current and future employee experience. Facilitation of work meetings, production of content and targeted offers, participation in sectoral events, and occasional travel, when necessary, in Spain or Europe. 
If you are fluent in English, you have experience in change management consulting or cultural transformation and you are looking for an opportunity to have an impact in the ways companies work, this role is for you!  What we offer   Permanent contract (we are also open to other types of collaboration, such as freelance work) Diverse and exciting projects in a fun and international company with over 20 years of experience in the design and implementation of modern ways of working strategies and company experience High development potential in an agile and multidisciplinary team with an international mindset and start-up spirit An open culture marked by flat hierarchies and direct communication paths among professionals. Self-responsible work and the possibility to contribute and carry out your own ideas and creativity. An amazing community of humans where everyone finds his/her place and where we take care of each other. Flexible working hours, allowing you to organize your working day according to the needs of your team and client, and to your personal priorities. Laptop, and the possibility to work remotely. Beautiful office near Cuzco. Other benefits such as: Extra days off during Christmas and Easter,  Company Events,  Tax advantages through our Flexible Compensation platform Private health insurance (company level plan): Access to Sanitas plan at a reduced employee cost 
  Your profile:   A university degree in sociology, business sciences, psychology, communication, business administration, anthropology, philosophy, etc. Fluency (C2) in English is a mandatory requirement for this role ‚Äì please note candidates who do not meet this requirement will not be considered for this role. We are looking for a consultant with around 2-5 years of experience in Change Management. Please note that having previous experience in this field is a mandatory requirement for this job. Experience in internal communication projects is highly valued. Fluency in French or German is highly valued. Excellent use of Windows tools and Office packages, especially PowerPoint and Excel. Willingness to travel is required. 
  What you should bring   Strong sense of ownership and accountability Attention to detail Generosity, autonomy, and can-do attitude ‚Äì we are a medium-sized company where we need to make things happen, regardless of our position within the team. Strong customer orientation and ability to communicate and bond with the client Ability to be a thinker but also a doer Creativity and eagerness to learn and share knowledge

About the job
            
 
As a Technology Strategy Consultant at Accenture, you will be contributing to shaping and executing of our clients business transformation agendas through technology. You will be part Technology Strategy teams helping our clients in their largest strategic initiatives and most critical problems at the intersection of business and technology, including digital disruption, industry convergence, growth and innovation, global operating models, sustainable cost management, enterprise transformation, and more.Your job will involve creating strategies and plans to define how technology should be utilized to support an organization's overall business strategy and maximize value creation. You will use your understanding of business strategy and your affinity with technology to define the strategy, operating model, enterprise-architecture and transformation roadmaps of technology organizations. As a continuous learner, you will maintain knowledge of best practices, industry landscapes and emerging technologies and apply these to develop innovative business solutions.As a Technology Strategy and Enterprise Architecture Consultant, you will be expected to:Understand a client‚Äôs business strategy and contribute in defining the link with technology and the architecture landscape, including organization, information, and infrastructure & applications;Quickly understand a client‚Äôs (IT) operating model, including the organizational structure, processes, and governance.Assess our client‚Äôs key IT strengths and weaknesses, based on rigorous analysis and technology & industry knowledge.Create blueprints & recommendations and contribute in translating them in actionable roadmaps for complex and large technology environments ‚Äì building future-proof architectures using modern technologies like cloud, edge computing, next-gen connectivity, event streaming, platform architectures and more.Throughout the strategy definition, function as a guardian of the architecture to make sure that e.g. initiatives & roadmap build-up comply with the set guidelines without jeopardizing business objectives.Participate to C-level communications by developing consistent and compelling storylines.Guide our clients through the transformation program to successfully implement their strategies.Your TeamOur consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology.Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.Your background:A Master's degreeAt least 3-4 years of experience in relevant Technology Strategy and Enterprise Architecture domains.Experience in consulting or customer-facing project-based workKnowledge of IT Strategy, IT Governance and Enterprise Architecture frameworks (relevant certifications are a plus).Flexible and able to travel when required, within your work-life balance limits.Professional proficiency in French, Dutch and English.Previous experience in the Health & Public Services or Products industry is a plus.Proven experience in at least two of the following domains: Digital Strategy, IT Cost Reduction, IT Infrastructure, IT Security Strategy, ERP ecosystems, cloud strategy, application portfolio optimization, legacy modernization.Proven experience in at least one of the following (emerging) technologies: iPaaS, service meshes, event-driven architectures, robotics, artificial intelligence, serverless computing.Excellent C-Level communication skills, written and oralStrong networking skills, building and growing relationships with senior client stakeholders and addressing their needs pro-activelyAbility to build, manage and foster a project team.Our offer:Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you‚Äôll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we‚Äôre really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:13th month + holiday allowance20 + 12 holidaysLaptop and smartphoneHospitalization insurance and extensive group insurance packageBonus programTraining & learning opportunitiesGreen mobility program: e-bikes, public transport, bike 2 work allowance,‚Ä¶Flexrewards: decide on your rewards package with our flexible benefits toolDiscount program: get discounts at your favorite (online) shopsEmployee shares purchase planEco-chequesAnd many more!

About the job
            
 
672419BRIntroductionIn this role you will join IBM Consulting via our world class Associate Program for university hires. As an Associate at IBM Consulting you will have the opportunity to work with a diverse range of clients worldwide. Our clients' technical and business needs are constantly evolving. We're hiring inspired, talented individuals, who believe no problem is too big to solve.We focus on your professional development through ongoing learning, mentorship, development of technical skills, and continuous personal growth, all grounded in a culture of coaching and career advancement. If you see yourself as someone who never stops learning and who wants to unleash your potential, the IBM Consulting Associates Program is for you.A career in IBM Consulting embraces long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe.You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio; including IBM Software and Red Hat.Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be supported by mentors and coaches who will encourage you to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and learning opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience.Your Role and ResponsibilitiesResponsibilitiesAs an entry level Strategy Consultant at IBM, you'll be working closely with clients and their customers to understand their pain points, bringing together IBM's unique capabilities across strategy, innovation, design, data analytics, cognitive computing, and technology platforms to develop and deliver high-impact transformation programs. In your role, you may be responsible for: Analyzing and defining a clients cloud strategy based on the business strategyDrawing from primary and existing IBM research on evolving market trendsIdentifying issues, creating hypotheses, and executing analysis, to develop decision-ready recommendations for our clientsAnalyze an existing application portfolio for a cloud journey, identify candidates for a cloud move and build a business caseUnderstand a clients operating model and provide recommendations for adjustments during the cloud journey
Required Technical and Professional Expertise Exceptional quantitative analysis skills and ability to derive recommendations informed by data and insightsPowerful communication and storytelling skills, with an ability to communicate complex situations clearly and simplyAbility to apply logic to solve ambiguous problems and deliver creative and well-structured solutionsA passion for innovative ideas, coupled with the ability to understand and assimilate different points of viewExperience in Cloud , Understanding of Cloud providers, Cloud Operating models Strong interpersonal skills with ability to collaborate and work effectively in an intense team environment, able to build direct working relationships across all levels of the IBM and client teamsFluency in both German and English (written & spoken)
Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise Certification one or more hyperscalers
About Business UnitIBM Consulting is IBM‚Äôs consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.Are you ready to be an IBMer?About IBMIBM‚Äôs greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we‚Äôre also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it‚Äôs time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.Location StatementIBM ist es wichtig, Ihnen ein Arbeitsumfeld zu bieten, in dem Sie Ihr ganzes Potenzial voll entfalten k√∂nnen und die M√∂glichkeit haben, Ihren Arbeitstag flexibel zu gestalten. About the job
            
 
C limate change , economic developments and population growth are putting pressure on water resources . The se require us to rethink and redesign how we manage water resources sustainably. We are looking for a Medior Consultant Water Strategy who can look at todays and tomorrow‚Äôs water challenges from an integral perspective and support our industrial and corporate clients to identify strategic pathways towards sustainable water resource management.Do you have experience in context-based target setting in water, water strategy development, corporate reporting on water, undertaking impact analys e s , and/or business case development ? Do you have a keen eye for physical, social, legal, and reputational drivers and barriers of our clients to act upon water? And can you make connections between our clients‚Äô objective s and those of other stakeholders in the catchments of their operations? Are you putting our clients first and feel at home in an international consultancy ? Then we invite you to express your interest in the vacancy for Medior Consultant Water Strategy ! A position in which you can make the difference in what we can achieve with each other and with our c lients . Enhancing Society Together!What You Do As a Medior Consultant Water StrategyYou will be part of our teams that advise and guide companies, especially multinationals, on their sustainability goals and targets on water and related themes like energy and biodiversity. You will be working on water stewardship and water footprint assessments , water circularity studies , water master planning, corporate reporting on water (including CSRD) and developing business cases to guide investment strategies on water. P ositivity, and true cost of water are familiar concepts to you, and you feel comfortable to apply and tailor these according to the client‚Äôs needs. Your role will, depending on your experience, involve supporting business development (including proposal writing), consultancy and project management (overseeing teams, planning and budget).You will contribute to projects ranging from answering to strategic objectives and challenges , but also risks and opportunities at an operational level . As R oyal H askoning DHV we have a wide base of experts in various parts of the business. You will actively seek opportunities for collaboration.Where you will workRoyal HaskoningDHV is a global engineering, project management and consultancy company, with 6,000 colleagues in more than 25 countries. Together we work on projects that have a positive impact on people, our living environment and the economy based on our motto ‚ÄúEnhancing Society Together‚Äù .As a Medior Consultant Water Strategy you will be working as part of our growing Team Water Strategy in our Advisory Group Water for Industry as part of the Business Line Water & Maritime . The advisory group consists of nearly 40 colleagues tasked with serving the water-related needs of our industrial clients . This team spearheads our corporate water strategy services for our industrial clients. We work closely with our Team Compliance and Team Water Technology and it is our preference that you understand and have knowledge of these fields as well . As a global company, y ou will be working with colleagues from other groups , business lines, and regional offices on guiding our industrial clients on their sustainability journey in relation to water .What You BringYou are driven by making the world a better place and feel at home in a customer-oriented consultancy organisation. You can connect your water expertise with topics such as circularity, biodiversity, energy (transition), etc. and raise this to a strategic level for our industrial and corporate clients. To be successful in the role of Medior Consultant Water Strategy, you have the following qualities: Relevant educational background (MSc), such as Environmental Resources Management, Environmental Economics, Environmental Studies or other comparable studies>4 years relevant work experience, preferably in an international setting, working with industrial (including multinational) companiesKnowledge and experience of business strategy and operations, with either a financial background and/or experience in the field of water strategy, impact measurement, and non-financial reportingPassion for helping clients improve their sustainability in relation to water and climate targets and a keen interest in helping clients better understand, measure, quantify, and formulate the (long-term) value they create in relation to water and climateAbility to learn and quickly understand new concepts outside your area of expertise, think strategically, and implement practical solutionsYou think in terms of solutions, you are pragmatic, enterprising, people and result-orientedGood interpersonal and preferably project management skills.Excellent written and verbal communication and reporting in English. Understanding of the Dutch language is a preferenceAbility to network effectively and build relationships with clientsAbility to contribute to proposal development and bringing in new opportunities from your own network and experienceAbility to work in The Netherlands
We are: innovative & realistic, perfectionist & decisive, surprising & reliable, everywhere & always! That's Royal HaskoningDHV!What We Offer You  A good salary package and pension via our own pension fund  An extensive range of training and development possibilities (external and internal)  Flexible working conditions/work-life balance (including laptop and mobile telephone so that you can work wherever and whenever you want)  28 vacation days if working full-time  Travel reimbursements and/or NS-business card  Personal budget which can be used for extra vacation days  Bonus based on our company profit 
Are you our new colleagueClick on the apply button and upload your resume and motivation letter. We will only proceed with applicants that submit a resume and motivation letter. Candidates are required to have a work and residence permit in The Netherlands.For more information, you can always contact Tessa in‚Äôt Veld , Recruiter Water & Maritime , at tessa.in . t . veld @rhdhv.comDue to GDPR, please submit your application via the apply button and not via email.Acquisition for this vacancy by agencies is not appreciated and offered candidates will not be taken into consideration.

About the job
            
 
Who you will join:Within our Central Functions Practice Area, the Organization Transformation team combines expertise in organizational design, transformation, strategic and cultural change management, and a deep understanding of various business domains. We assist clients within the Allianz Group in addressing strategic challenges such as reimagining their organizational structures to enhance responsiveness, driving large-scale transformations, and shaping future-ready company cultures. Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

About the job
            
 
Location: Huizen, NetherlandsAbout The TeamThe Management Team (MT) of the Secure Information and Communication Systems (SIX) business unit consists of 8 members: the Vice President (VP), the Director Marketing and Sales, the Director Bids & Projects, the Director Engineering, the Director Supply Chain, the Director Cyber Security, the Director Finance, and the Director Human Resources. Together, the MT is responsible for a diverse portfolio of business activities related to secure communications and information sharing, serving a long list of customer in the Netherlands, Europe and worldwide. Whereas each MT member has its own scope and responsibilities, the team as a whole is responsible for realizing our business objectives, defining and executing our long term business strategy, ensuring an efficient and effective operation and bringing in, retaining and developing talent. Our core values are: customer focus, ownership and empathy.About Your Future JobAs an Executive Business & Strategy Consultant you will work together closely with the VP and other MT members. You support the development and execution of the MT‚Äôs operational and strategic agenda. You are a vital element in connecting the MT and the rest of the organization. Our business environment in the international high-tech safety and security area is at the moment extremely dynamic with big opportunities but also considerable challenges and therefore we need an agile management environment where you will play a key role.Your main tasks are: Pick Up ad hoc operational business issues with support of relevant stakeholders.Facilitating strategic business reviews.Leading improvement initiatives.Preparing effective and qualitative decision making, together with the relevant team(s) involved.Participate in all MT meetings, and play a key role in preparation thereof.Depending on your ambitions and interests, you will get involved in various (strategic & operational) topics and projects.You may team up with different MT members, and operational teams.Given the broad scope of this job, you will be able to develop various competences (leadership skills) and to grow your in-depth knowledge on a variety of topics within a relatively short period.You will quickly get to know our organization and build your network. After two to three years, you will be ready for your next career steps, either within Thales Nederland or the Thales Group.
Why you'd be a good match You are an analytical thinker, able to quickly understand your context and the possible impact of issues, and not afraid to challenge the status quo. (think big).You set clear objectives and priorities and can be decisive when required (make it happen).You quickly build relationships with a variety of stakeholders, and are organizationally and culturally sensitive (together).You are an excellent communicator, also in writing, and are able to serve as ‚Äúsparring partner‚Äù at different levels in the organization (strategic, tactical, operational). To that end, excellent command of Dutch and English is a must; French is definitely a benefit.You have a political antenna, are representative and discreet, and act in the interest of the company. Whatever the situation. Being flexible and cooperative on the one hand, and able to cope with stress on the other, are key to success in this job.You have a broad interest and keep up to date when it comes to national and international developments that are related to our business. You are ambitious and have great development potential, making this job the kick-start of a career within Thales.You have a relevant Master Degree and a maximum of three years of relevant professional experience, preferably in an international context.You are profoundly interested in safety and security, business management and improvement, and high tech.
What's In It For You A challenging job in a great team within our high-tech, innovative work environment. Includes the freedom for initiative and good ideas.Room for personal and professional growth within our organization, for example in regards to technical, commercial or international skills.Valuable international collaboration with coworkers from 68 different countries around the globe.A comfortable work space in a modern environment, with a focus on flexibility and the right work life balance.You can usually work where and whenever you want. Within Thales, we aim for a 60/40 balance, where you work from home at least two days a week, when your role allows this.A good salary, fitting travel allowance, and the ability to personalize your employment conditions: for instance, you can trade PTO for internet costs, our bicycle plan, company fitness and relocation costs.40 days off per year (PTO). Yes, really.
Interested? Apply now! Click on the button below to upload your profile and show your interest.To ensure that we are a good match, we can ask you to participate in an assessment.Diversity StatementWe actively support a working pattern that suits your lifestyle and helps you reach your ambitions. That means that equal opportunities, inclusion and an informal culture are integral to our success. It also means that your well-being and happiness matter to us! That‚Äôs why we offer you the flexibility to do what‚Äôs important to you; whether that‚Äôs part time hours, job sharing, remote working, or the ability to flex your start and finish times.Security RequirementsIn line with Thales' Baseline Security requirements, candidates will be asked to provide evidence of identity, eligibility to work in The Netherlands and employment and/or education history. Some vacancies may require a security clearance which can require further evidence to be provided. For further details of the evidence required to apply for security clearance please refer to the General Intelligence and Security Service.

About the job

NetReveal, our flagship product is constantly gaining market dominance in the detection and prevention of financial crime and fraud. It has also been shown to be applicable in credit risk as well as counter-terrorism, anti-money laundering and other investigative functions.Inside the team you will be linkage between Client and Product / Technical consultants, using your experience to derive requirements on route to fine-tuned solution delivery.Job Description What you will be doing   Build viable business cases, capture and document client requirements  Demonstrate software and present detected fraud cases to clients  Participate in the preparation for and delivery of workshops with clients' fraud, risk and compliance teams, investigators and data teams  Develop fraud models and watch list verification methods  Deploy enterprise solutions within clients  Adhere to and enhance software development approaches and methodologies  Deliver high quality work to meet client expectations and project deadlines  Go beyond routine questioning to find the underlying causes of problems or discrepancies to identify problems and develop sound solutions  Use your organizational and planning skills to maintain performance and manage your time effectively  Transfer know-how to end clients' fraud analysts, investigators and technical staff 
Essential Skills  Excellence in spoken and written English  Understanding of SQL and experience of databases such as Oracle, DB2, SQL Server  Around 2 years of experience in a business or technical role working within business or technology consulting  An enthusiasm for working with clients across EMEA region, potentially including temporary placements abroad  Academic background with a BSc or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, Economics, Banking or another discipline related to the financial markets  Confident presenting complex ideas to non-technical and technical audiences  Excellent analytical skills and problem solving attitude  Excellent communication skills and team - working spirit  A flair for acquiring new technical skills or understanding customer's business  An open minded approach to solving client problems and a commitment to high quality deliverables.

About the job
            
 
Senior Business Consultant - ESi - ADP ESI is seeking to recruit a Senior Business Consultant based in EMEA to support the expansion of MNC solutions through pre-sales activities. In this pre-sales position, you'll be a trusted advisor to our clients, using your ADP service expertise and consulting skills to solve their most critical business challenges particularly related to Payroll/HR management and absence management and integration of the time solutions to the other multinational ADP offerings.In this position you will support the Multi country sales through the sales process, and support customers through the proof of concept and transition to the implementation and service teams. The successful candidate will also develop effective sales strategies with Multi country sales force, discusses time management product requirements with customers and analyze competitors' actions in the market.The candidate must have effective communication skills and be service focused, results oriented and be able to multi-task and meet deadlines. She/he will work with others in a demanding, fast-paced environment with a commitment to quality and a thorough approach to the work.Key Responsibilities  Client facing activities: Perform Strategic selling in large MN companies environment Increase sales performance by presenting Payroll & HR strategies and business solutions to prospects and clients Understand client business requirements and configure the solution to demonstrate ADP's ability to solve client issues. Understand and align customer needs with ADP MNC's portfolio with specific but not exclusive focus on time management Communicate with different audiences, appropriately adjust functional and technical content to meet different audience knowledge and interest, and can juggle meetings with multiple audience levels Understand and support HR transformation discussion with prospects Creatively and quickly respond to challenging questions with sound business acumen. Liaise with internal partners for effective solution outcomes for the client Utilise compelling presentation skills including the ability to take complex subjects and distil into a simplistic message to ensure that our clients/prospects understand the value and benefit of our services and multinational solutions Support RFP response process and scripted demonstrations within domain area of expertise Demonstrate strategic and ethical use of competitive knowledge and intelligence Support the negotiation process on all the contractual business appendixes Participate in marketing events Operational Support: Work with other members of the ESI Business consulting team, but also with the Business consulting teams in GES Have the ability to work and perform under pressure in a multicultural sales environment Have the ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training Coordinate the answers to customer requests Prepare and delivers sales presentations Show and demonstrate offering's value Participate in sales calls and meetings Work closely with the sales team Work closely with the Relationship Management, Implementation, Product and Client Service teams Keep up to date with product developments Work with the domain specialists to get information and updates on the offering Travel to meetings with potential clients
Qualifications Required  Master or Bachelor's degree with 2-4 years of sales or HR consulting experience with large, complex clients
Preferred Expertise/Skills Preference will be given to candidates who have the following: Experience working with time management technology products and processesCollaborative, team player with strong self-starter attitudeKnowledge of Business Process Outsourcing is desired Communication (multi-lingual can be an advantage) Assists in the facilitation of team and client meetings. Delivers informative, well-organized presentations Understands how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully Team player with good written and oral communication skills- Confident negotiator and ability to help 'close the deal' Client management skills Ability to quickly learn new procedures, skills, and techniques Ability to work under pressure Ability to identify and ensure the timely delivery of critical information to internal analysis teams, sponsors, customers, and other interested parties Ability to work and communicate effectively within a global team environment Ability to effectively prioritize work Ability to develop and explain technical decisions Ability to recognize and deal appropriately with sensitive and confidential information Ability to interact effectively with technical and non-technical audiences via both verbal and written communications (e.g., technical writing, procedural development, requirements analysis) Ability to meet inflexible deadlines Domestic and international travel as necessaryStrong presentation skillsAbility to travel 40%-60%

About the job
            
 
As a wholly owned subsidiary of Sopra Steria Group with almost 50,000 employees in over 20 countries, CIMPA is an innovative service provider for digital transformation and product lifecycle management (PLM), offering one of the most comprehensive portfolios of high-quality PLM consulting and services on the market in the aerospace, automotive, transport, defense, and energy sectors. CIMPA develops customized PLM solutions along the entire value chain of these industries: from strategy to process and methodology design, from conceptualization and tool implementation to user training and support. Our goal is to increase operational efficiency by improving processes and methods. Job Description Are you familiar with the topics of digitalization, automation, AR, VR, and cultural change? Are you creative, do you love change, and do you have optimization ideas in store? Our team leads the changes of our customers with change management methods and create the conditions for a sustainable transformation with customer-specific solutions. Your tasks will include: - Successful implementation of change and transformation projects in line with the global (corporate) strategy.- Analysis, planning, implementation, and evaluation of the change strategy and promote a collaborative approach.- Plan and create change management concepts, stakeholder analyses, change impact analyses, and roadmaps- Assess the scope and extent of the transformation, analyze the current and future state to determine a goal-oriented change approach.- Regularly validate the readiness for change of all key stakeholders and report the status based on milestones, results, dependencies, risks, and opportunities.- Identify and assess different perspectives and complex social situations and actively encourage participation in change processes.- Create detailed change plans and anticipate the evolution of change and transformation.- Design and facilitate workshops, conduct interviews, and have very strong communication skills at all levels. Requirements- Degree in Aerospace Engineering, IT, or background in economics, business, or psychology - ideally with a focus on change management.- Experience in working in a technical and complex business environment, management of change or transformation projects, and with the implementation of customer projects with complex technical issues.- Experience in designing and leading workshops, both on-site and digitally - Further education and additional qualifications are an advantage (e.g., MBA Change Management, Agile Change Manager, PROSCI qualification).- Professional handling of MS-Office and Google products.- Strong communication skills, a confident manner, and service orientation.- High level of English (C1) - French would be a big plus. Benefits we offer you  Competitive salary, depending on the profile.Permanent contract in a stable project.Possibility of hybrid work and flexible hours.Social benefits, such as restaurant ticket, variables for performance and objectives, health insurance and life insurance, among others.An exceptional working environment. CIMPA Spain has been recognized as one of the best companies to work for with the #GreatPlaceToWork certification.
At CIMPA PLM Services, we value diversity and inclusion, and promote a work environment where all people are welcome and respected. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or disability. All resumes will be considered.

About the job
            
 
ENGIE Consulting  is ENGIE's in-house management consulting dienstverlener. Met meer dan 10 jaar ervaring en referenties is ENGIE Consulting een belangrijke hefboom voor de groei, de transformatie en de performance van ENGIE door een breed spectrum van projecten te leveren aan zowel operationele entiteiten als corporate functies binnen de Groep.Meer dan 80 professionals met multidisciplinaire vaardigheden die meer dan 170 opdrachten per jaar uitvoeren in 4 domeinen:  duurzame groei (nieuwe aanbiedingen/marktonderzoeken/externe groei, ...)  operationele prestaties (lean/OPEX-reductie/ ...) en team binding (change managment, team dynamiek,...)  vernieuwingsprojecten (innovatie/digital/organisatie, ...)  de overgang naar koolstofneutraliteit 
 Uw rol als Business Management Consultant Je valt onder de verantwoordelijkheid van de Consulting Director, komt terecht in het team van interne consultants en voert advies verlenende missies uit in de 4 bovengenoemde domeinen en in verschillende omgevingen (operationele entiteiten, Corporate directies van de Groep, vakgebieden). Uw taken als Business management Consultant   u voert projecten uit voor onze interne klanten  u draagt bij aan het in kaart brengen van de behoeften van de klant en het ontwikkelen van aangepasten voorstellen  u draagt bij tot de supervisie van de uitvoering van elk project op de projectlocaties  tijdens de missies bent u verantwoordelijk voor √©√©n of meerdere deliverables, voor √©√©n of meerdere projecten onder toezicht van een projectleider  u helpt met het uitwerken van conclusies en aanbevelingen en u bent in staat om tijdens de opdracht voorstellen te doen  u zorgt voor de co√∂rdinatie tussen de stakeholders en voor de operationele relatie met de aanspreekpunten van de klanten  u geeft de nodige informatie en waarschuwingen door aan de leiding van de opdrachten  u neemt deel aan de ontwikkeling van Internal Consulting afdeling binnen ENGIE  u neemt deel aan het formuleren van standpunten en nieuwe aanbiedingen van diensten  u ontwikkelt relevante kennis/methodologie√´n en bouwt een stevige knowhow op  u draagt bij aan de interne dynamiek binnen ENGIE Consulting 
 Uw profiel als  Business Management Consultant   u hebt hoger onderwijs gevolgd (ingenieursschool, handelsschool of gelijkwaardig op universitair niveau)  u hebt minimum 2 √† 5 jaar ervaring in consultancy  u bent toegewijd, u hebt een gevoel voor klantengerichtheid, het vermogen om te analyseren en uw bevindingen samen te vatten  u bent een echte teamspeler; daarnaast heb je een analytisch en synthetisch denkvermogen, goede sociale vaardigheden, kan je je aanpassen aan verschillende beroepscontexten en kan je zowel mondeling als schriftelijk vlot communiceren  je bent succesvol in deze functie dankzij jouw klantgerichtheid, jouw leervermogen en jouw vermogen om in samenwerking met het team, het management en onze interne klanten vooruitgang te boeken  je bent tweetalig NL/FR of FR/NL met een goede beheersing van het Engels (mondeling en schriftelijk) en van de MS Office tools
