job_title: Senior Consultant, Cyber Strategy & Transformation, Italy
job_description:
About the job
            
 
#DiscoveringDeloitteAt Deloitte, the spirit of the excellence is part of our DNA. We strive to hire the brightest minds from all around the globe, allowing us to excel in both long-term strategic thinking and business improvement implementation as the undisputed global leader in professional services. We are committed to delivering impacting results for diverse private and public organization clients, linking our peerless talent in cyber risk with unrivalled opportunities for impact ‚Äì committing ourselves to sustainable growth and investment in our employees‚Äô development and inclusion along the way.Our culture is rooted in profound shared values. Our values guide us as we live our purpose to serve our clients with quality and distinction, inspire our people to work collaboratively to deliver value, actively contribute to society, and lead the profession by challenging ourselves to do what matters most. Deloitte‚Äôs values are what unite us across cultures and geographies, and ultimately help us earn the trust and respect of our people, clients, and society.We believe that our differences enable us to #makeanimpactthatmatters.#JobTitleConsultant/Senior Consultant, Cyber Strategy and Transformation, Italy#ChooseDeloitteif You want to be involved in the definition of new and cutting-edge solutions to address cybersecurity challenges for international private companies, governments, and world-class decision makersYou want to work with the most relevant, prestigious and challenging clients at international levelYou want to work with inspiring, ambitious, and supportive people with diverse geographical and academic backgrounds and extensive skillsYou are a technology enthusiast and visionary and you think that it will shape our futureYou get excitement in managing clients shifting priorities and accomplish tasks in a challenging, fast-paced environmentYou like to nurture people and share your knowledge with others
Technology continues to fuel rapid digital transformation and global hyper connectivity among businesses and governments, presenting unique opportunities and challenges for growth as well as cybersecurity risks to manage. To effectively navigate this increasingly complex ecosystem, we help our clients optimizing their cybersecurity strategies, design cutting-edge solutions and govern enterprise security programs that increase resilience and better manage cyber risks and, at government level, we are actively involved in shaping the regulation of countries, defining national strategies, and driving the direction of policy making.As a Consultant/Senior Consultant in Strategy & Transformation Team, you will share your knowledge and experiences working in a team of diverse and talented professionals that enjoy designing innovative cybersecurity architectures, for market leading customers across Europe in diverse industries (Financial Services, Energy, Telecommunications Media & Technology, Life Sciences & Healthcare) as well as governments and public sector clients globally.You will thrive in an international environment, developing and managing innovative strategic initiatives for international customers and collaborating with colleagues belonging to different geographies and backgrounds.#YourRole Manage cybersecurity activities within wider projects, identifying, evaluating, and designing best in class cybersecurity solutions, demonstrating operational excellence, vision and strategic thinkingExecute complex project activities, coordinate part of the team while supporting your more senior colleagues in managing client relations and expectationsFace and solve customer challenges in innovative and effective wayLeverage on technology to provide innovation, operational excellence and new business models to customersEngage with internal and external stakeholders to strengthen business relations and create business opportunities
#WinningRequirements 2-6 years of experience, preferably in a Strategic Consulting company Solid expertise in Cyber Security Strategies, Cyber Security Assessment and BenchmarksFluent knowledge of English languagePassion and curiosity for the cybersecurity industry and technology trends, innovations and frameworks, as well as current IT security technologiesBe an independent and collaborative person who cooperates in one or more project teams to deliver high quality resultsPossess interpersonal skills and the ability to develop effective and lasting relationships with clients and colleaguesAbility to conduct complex analyses and communicate them clearly and concisely to target audiences of different cultures, technical backgrounds and levels of seniority
#ChooseDeloitteWe are committed to reduce our impacts and encourage people to behave in a sustainability way. To protect the environment and limit climate change, we developed the WorldClimate strategy, through which we set a goal of becoming a Net Zero.Join our #iAct movement! Here‚Äôs a quiz to know your carbon footprint and learn how to improve your green habits.Build your legacy with us. Aim higher: join Deloitte now!Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment processPrimary LocationMilanoOther LocationsTurin, Bologna, Roma, ItalyOrganizationCYBER RISK

About the job

Darum bist du die beste Wahl: Berater*in & Vision√§r*in Du verf√ºgst √ºber ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Diplom- oder Masterstudium.Du hast mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Beratung oder im Bereich Marketing.Du bringst die F√§higkeit zur analytischen und konzeptionellen Denkweise mit, sch√§tzt die Zusammenarbeit im Team und bist in der Lage, komplexe Zusammenh√§nge schnell zu erfassen.Dein Sprachgef√ºhl und deine zwischenmenschlichen F√§higkeiten sind ausgepr√§gt, und du besitzt fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von PowerPoint und Excel.Du beherrschst Deutsch und Englisch flie√üend, sowohl m√ºndlich als auch schriftlich.Selbstverst√§ndlich ‚Äì aber zur Sicherheit erw√§hnt ‚Äì erwarten wir von einem Senior Consultant ein hohes Ma√ü an Verantwortungsbewusstsein, Belastbarkeit, Serviceorientierung, Teamplayer-Mentalit√§t und einen professionellen Umgang mit Kunden und Partnern.
Darum sind wir die beste Wahl: Entwicklung & SelbstverwirklichungBei bynd [b…™Ààj…índ] m√∂chten wir, dass du gemeinsam mit uns w√§chst. Deinen M√∂glichkeiten sind bei uns keine Grenzen gesetzt ‚Äì sowohl fachlich als auch pers√∂nlich.Da wir mit Unternehmen aller Gr√∂√üe und aus unterschiedlichsten Branchen zusammenarbeiten, bieten wir dir eine breite Auswahl an abwechslungsreichen und anspruchsvollen Aufgaben. Bei uns kannst du kontinuierlich neue Erfahrungen sammeln und dich in spannenden Projekten entfalten. Deinen pers√∂nlichen Entwicklungspfad gestaltest du dabei in deiner eigenen Geschwindigkeit.Was wir dir daf√ºr bieten: Die M√∂glichkeit, die strategische Entwicklung von bynd proaktiv mitzugestalten.Kurze Entscheidungswege und eine offene Unternehmenskultur, denn wir arbeiten √ºber alle Positionen hinweg stets auf Augenh√∂he.Gelebte Zusammenarbeit durch au√üergew√∂hnliche Events, ein gro√üartiges Team und eine ‚ÄûOffene T√ºr‚Äú Atmosph√§re.Mobile-Office M√∂glichkeit, bei der du bis zu 80% mobil arbeiten kannst.32 Tage Urlaub und flexibler √úberstundenausgleich.

job_title: Strategy and Transaction Services Junior Consultant
job_description:
About the job
            
 
At EY we support you in achieving your unique potential both personally and professionally. You enjoy the flexibility to devote time to what matters to you, in your business and personal lives. At EY you can be who you are and express your point of view, energy and enthusiasm, wherever you are in the world. It's how you make a difference.As a member of staff within the Strategy and Transaction Services team, you will participate in due diligence and other engagements related to transactions involving private equity investor groups and strategic corporate buyers. You‚Äôll prepare analyses of historical and pro forma financial information to assess trends and fluctuations that may impact cash flow requirements and deal valuation. You‚Äôll make technical contributions to valuation client engagements and internal projects. You‚Äôll gain a thorough understanding of the target business and its market, and of clients‚Äô issues, performing research of the target‚Äôs industry and of quoted companies operating in that sector. Your duties will also include, keeping the senior, manager and senior manager and partner abreast of progress and of any significant issues. You‚Äôll be involved in drafting written file notes, letters, reports and contributing to the presentations of our work and findings to the client. Within your role, you‚Äôll obtain regular feedback on a timely basis and be alert to learning and development opportunities. You‚Äôll work effectively as a team member by demonstrating your commitment to quality, sharing responsibility, providing support, maintaining communication and updating senior team members on progress.Responsibilities: Perform industry and company research utilizing online tools and publicly available informationParticipate in different engagements - valuation, business modeling, M&A, due diligenceAssist in preparing reports and schedules that will be delivered to clients and other partiesDevelop and maintain productive working relationships with client personnel Contribute to people initiativesMaintain an educational program to develop personal skills on an ongoing basisUnderstand and follow workplace policies and procedures Build strong internal relationships with members of the Strategy and Transaction Team and other EY services 
Requierements: Strong academic record ‚Äì bachelor or master degree in Finance, Business management, Economics, etc 1-2 years previous relevant experience Excellent analytical and interpersonal abilitiesAbility to work well within a teamEffective written and verbal communication in both Bulgarian and English language Strong work initiative and the ability to adapt to new challenges and ideas
What we offer: Work with a bright, friendly and energetic team in multicultural environmentExcellent opportunities for career growth, developing personal and business skills by working with some of the most well-known companiesLearning and development programs and on-the-job trainingAdditional social benefits subject of personal choice and prioritization. You can choose them among list of available ones.
Why choose us? Because of the team ‚Äì EY people are bright, friendly and energeticBecause of the company ‚Äì EY is a very well recognized and proven international and local brand in the field of professional servicesBecause of YOU ‚Äì You will develop your personal and business skills by working on challenging projects with some of the most well-known companies, as well as through our extensive learning and development programs.
Ernst & Young is an equal opportunities employer. All applications are treated as confid ential. Please note, that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

About the job
            
 
Mache mit uns den Unterschied. Bei Accenture Strategy entwickelst und verfolgst du brillante Ideen. Du arbeitest mit Experten Hand in Hand, um Unternehmen neue Wege aufzuzeigen, sie von allen Seiten zu beleuchten und modernste Technologien in die Gesch√§ftsstrategie einzubinden. Mit deinem Know-how verschaffst du unseren Kunden den entscheidenden Wettbewerbsvorsprung und f√ºhrst Unternehmen erfolgreich in die Zukunft. Das erwartet dich Du bist innovativ, findest schneller als andere die Antworten auf ungel√∂ste Fragen und leistest analytisch wie konzeptionell Au√üergew√∂hnliches? Dann wirst du bei Accenture Strategy ein Umfeld vorfinden, das dich inspiriert und dazu motiviert, Gro√ües zu leisten. About the job

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise Certification one or more hyperscalers

The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.Are you ready to be an IBMer?About IBMIBM‚Äôs greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we‚Äôre also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. About the job
            
 
Description   Efficio's Managers/Senior Managers lead our engagements with clients. They have overall responsibility for ensuring that the objectives of the engagement are achieved, and client expectations are met.These Managers/Senior Managers set the strategic direction for the engagement and work with Consultants and other team members to ensure each project workstream is strategically aligned. While they must maintain a ‚Äòbig picture‚Äô view, they must also have a good understanding of the detail within each individual workstream.This candidate will have both an external and an internal focus. Externally, they must build deep relationships with senior client stakeholders to ensure they are fully engaged with the project and the proposed solutions. They are also responsible for identifying additional business development opportunities, both within the engagement and beyond.Internally, our Managers/Senior Managers are responsible for leading, challenging and motivating their team to continually deliver the best possible outcomes for clients. They act as a sounding board for team members, challenging ideas and guiding the development of strategic solutions. They are responsible for building a positive, collaborative, and high-performing culture within their project teams. They also have a key role in developing more junior team members, providing coaching, and mentoring to help develop their consulting skills and capabilities.Efficio Managers/Senior Managers enjoy a great deal of autonomy and responsibility for the success of client engagements. It‚Äôs a demanding role where the ability to work effectively under pressure, and the willingness to take responsibility and challenge yourself is paramount. Highly developed interpersonal, leadership, strategic and analytical skills are also essential.This role is challenging - but it‚Äôs also highly rewarding. Efficio offers a collaborative, merit-based environment where performance is recognised and rewarded. Above all, the role offers the enormous satisfaction of leading large and significant assignments across a range of industries and sectors, for some of the world‚Äôs leading companies. About the job
            
 
Are you a highly motivated individual that likes to propose and pitch solutions to customers? Are you able to maximize the customer value realization during implementations? And can you organize and communicate easily as a trusted advisor? Then we are looking for you as our next ServiceNow colleague for our DACH region!What will you do?We are looking for a Business Consultant to join our team of PaaS-specialists. Our company is 100% dedicated to delivering world-class digital business capabilities powered by ServiceNow. We are a global strategic partner for our customers ensuring they get the most value from the platform. Our broad services portfolio is exclusively built around ServiceNow, making us the one-stop-shop for all ServiceNow related advisory services, implementations, custom app developments and application maintenance & support. So, join us in our mission to be THE strategic ServiceNow advisory and implementation partner and make people‚Äôs work flow!As a Business Consultant, you will join our team to help us improve the customer experience across the organization. You will play a significant part to the realization of the customer organization‚Äôs goals and needs by implementing a more business-focused approach aligned with their strategy.Scope of work: You will be primary point of contact for a customer and make recommendations for effective and cost-efficient workflows. As Trusted Advisor you create and maintain effective customer relationships to ensure customer satisfaction.You will be assisting our colleagues with pre-sales and RFP‚Äôs.You will be responsible for capturing the customer needs and translating these into a workable solution.You will be guiding and conducting workshops in explaining the solution in ServiceNow to the customer.You will be giving presentations and demonstrations of ServiceNow and discuss and analyze GAPS between ServiceNow and the customer‚Äôs processes.Tailor the Plat4mation value proposition to client requirements based on in-depth research of specific business conditions and driversYou monitor the progress and report on milestones and budget to the customer and/or the manager at Plat4mation pro-actively.
 We ask Bachelor or equivalent in experience. Master is preferred.Fluent in English and German.Minimum of 3 years of experience working in a big consultancy organization dealing with complex IT-projects and finding solutions within Enterprise Software.ITIL certification is required. Strong preference for candidates with a ServiceNow ITSM certificate.Experience with giving presentations and pitching solutions to the customer.Actively contribute to the company‚Äôs solution portfolio, by providing knowledge to methodologies based on experience gained from customer projects.Authorized to work in Poland.You are located in Poland.As Trusted Advisor you create and maintain effective customer relationships to ensure customer satisfaction.
What‚Äôs in it for you Competitive salaryBonus based on company performance (if 100% target achieved)Pension schemeLaptop, internet, transportation and phone allowanceA modern, flexible and multicultural workplace at an innovative and global companyAmbitious and kind colleagues from all over the worldA challenging position with lots of room to grow with ongoing training courses and coaching
Our cultureWorking at Plat4mation evolves around working from your internal drive to make a difference for people in combination with having fun. We always go the extra mile to deliver on what we promise! Joy is what connects us and what drives us to get the best out of ourselves. That‚Äôs why we host several Fun4U activities each year, like a global hackathon, drinks and inspiring lunch sessions (check out our Instagram page!). Your development is our number one priority. This means you get room to grow. We strongly believe that personal development and ambitions are key to our company‚Äôs success. Because when you keep learning, you continuously improve yourself. That‚Äôs why we coach you on the job, but also help you to explore and develop your interpersonal skills.About Plat4mationBased in The Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, USA, India and Switzerland, we are an Elite ServiceNow Partner dedicated to delivering world-class products and services for the ServiceNow platform. We are driven to realize maximum value in the IT, employee, and customer workflow experiences for each one of our customers. We do this by providing a flawless customer experience utilizing our extensive expertise.Since our inception in 2013, we have grown to more than 250 employees globally, and we are still growing strong! With a team of specialized consultants, we aim for the highest possible results while creating jaw dropping experiences for our customers. Interested?Do you accept the challenge? Do you think you fit the profile described above and have we made you enthusiastic? Please send your CV and motivation letter to careers.ch@plat4mation.com or apply directly by filling out the form below.

About the job
            
 
About The Job Participate and take responsibility for small projects or critical modules providing support to BNP Paribas Corporate & Institutional Banking Management, both locally and at Group level.
Your Main Activities Are Take full ownership on assigned modules, perform complex modelling and analysis understanding their potential impact for clientsFrame, design and lead autonomously the delivery of one or more projects ensuring quality and respect of deadlinesPrepare and lead workshops and meetings using relevant techniques and providing insightful resultsEstablish collaborative relationships with internal clients while maintaining independence and the capacity to challenge themDevelop their network and relationships with clients on a regular basis (middle and senior management)Enhance team involvement on transversal topics related to CIB Consulting development.Promote CIBC in front of CIB management to enhance the brand equitySeek proactively to participate and help the team beyond the assigned dutiesFacilitate the knowledge sharing within the team and coach team members providing constructive feedbacks and respective improvement actions
Profile And Skills To Success Masters Degree in Management, Economics, Finance, Engineering or related areasBetween 3 and 5 years of experience in Project Management and ConsultingEnglish fluentProficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerpointProficient in Project Management FramingProficient in Consulting and StrategyAnalytical abilityActive listenerCreative and problem solver
Why joining BNP Paribas?  Leading banking institution
BNP Paribas is a leader in the Eurozone, and a prominent international banking institution with strong roots in Europe's banking history. It has a presence in 65 countries, with around 190 000 Employees ‚Äì including more than 145 000 in Europe.  Our presence in Portugal
Since 1985, BNP Paribas was one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, the Group has around 7.100 employees across several entities operating directly in the territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.  International reach
Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;Investment & Protection Servicesthat include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;Corporate & Institutional Bankingdivision that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients. Diversity and Inclusion commitment
BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.  Commitment towards work/life balance
At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.  Remote Working Conditions
At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal  Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered. In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

About the job
            
 
We help the world run betterOur company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.Apply now!Business Transformation Services (BTS) is the business consulting unit within SAP that assists customers in maximizing the benefits from technology and digitalization in their business. We are committed to ideate business innovations, develop solutions and to turn novel ideas into business results. If you are interested in a creative and diverse culture, then BTS is definitely the place to be.What You Will Be DoingAt BTS, we act as trusted advisors and support our customers with their transformation projects both from a business perspective as well as the corresponding IT capabilities. Together we help customers in the private and public sector realize their most pressing digitization topics. BTS allows you to work with a variety of experts in a multi-disciplinary environment of highly motivated and experienced colleagues. You increase the customer‚Äôs value by: Developing and putting into practice business processes and IT-strategies towards a digital transformation Preparing investment decisions based on value assessments and business case examinations (WHY)Developing best-fit SAP cloud platform and application architecture (WHAT) followed by transformation roadmaps in close collaboration with process and solution experts (HOW)Supporting large customer transformation processes as a transformation manager
For our Polish branch with a focus on the local market we are looking for an experienced SAP generalist to act as the key contact person for Business Transformation Services as part of a regional team.What You Will Bring AlongWe are looking for advisory minded colleagues with comprehensive industry, process and SAP product and architecture experience from a multi-national environment to guide decision makers and work as transformation advisors. As a BTS consultant, you advise customers on how to develop and implement business processes and IT strategies towards digital transformation.Fluency in both Polish and English is required.In Addition To Your Rather Broad Than Deep SAP Product And Architecture Knowledge, You Should Have a Good Understanding Of Industry And IT Trends As Well As Business And Processes. You Should Also Have SAP implementation experience is vitalExperience with self-managed project work at customer, with high focus on customer orientationThe ability to think conceptually while focusing on quality and deliverablesFlexibility and the ability to quickly adapt in a new environment, where you can grow quicklyExcellent communication and presentation skills and the ability to design and deliver high-impact presentationsProven leadership skills in motivating teams and leading panels and discussions Can-do attitude
If the words ‚Äúinnovation‚Äù, ‚Äúagility‚Äù, and ‚Äúpersonal responsibility‚Äù in a multi-disciplinary and international environment appeal to you, then BTS is the right place for you!What We OfferWe ensure a supportive and well-structured onboarding including a buddy system and mentoring. A high level of autonomy in how we work with our customers is the basis of our success. Our diverse team is spread around the region and we highly value an open, inclusive and collaborative team spirit.We build breakthroughs togetherSAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.We win with inclusionSAP‚Äôs culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone ‚Äì regardless of background ‚Äì feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.comFor SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.EOE AA M/F/Vet/DisabilityQualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.Requisition ID: 368537 | Work Area: Consulting and Professional Services | Expected Travel: 0 - 50% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: .

About the job

 If you feel this might be the role for you, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply ‚Äì we‚Äôre looking forward to speaking to you!

job_title: Senior Consultant, Cyber Strategy & Transformation, Italy
job_description:
About the job
            
 
#DiscoveringDeloitteAt Deloitte, the spirit of the excellence is part of our DNA. We strive to hire the brightest minds from all around the globe, allowing us to excel in both long-term strategic thinking and business improvement implementation as the undisputed global leader in professional services. We are committed to delivering impacting results for diverse private and public organization clients, linking our peerless talent in cyber risk with unrivalled opportunities for impact ‚Äì committing ourselves to sustainable growth and investment in our employees‚Äô development and inclusion along the way.Our culture is rooted in profound shared values. Our values guide us as we live our purpose to serve our clients with quality and distinction, inspire our people to work collaboratively to deliver value, actively contribute to society, and lead the profession by challenging ourselves to do what matters most. Deloitte‚Äôs values are what unite us across cultures and geographies, and ultimately help us earn the trust and respect of our people, clients, and society.We believe that our differences enable us to #makeanimpactthatmatters.#JobTitleConsultant/Senior Consultant, Cyber Strategy and Transformation, Italy#ChooseDeloitteif You want to be involved in the definition of new and cutting-edge solutions to address cybersecurity challenges for international private companies, governments, and world-class decision makersYou want to work with the most relevant, prestigious and challenging clients at international levelYou want to work with inspiring, ambitious, and supportive people with diverse geographical and academic backgrounds and extensive skillsYou are a technology enthusiast and visionary and you think that it will shape our futureYou get excitement in managing clients shifting priorities and accomplish tasks in a challenging, fast-paced environmentYou like to nurture people and share your knowledge with others
Technology continues to fuel rapid digital transformation and global hyper connectivity among businesses and governments, presenting unique opportunities and challenges for growth as well as cybersecurity risks to manage. To effectively navigate this increasingly complex ecosystem, we help our clients optimizing their cybersecurity strategies, design cutting-edge solutions and govern enterprise security programs that increase resilience and better manage cyber risks and, at government level, we are actively involved in shaping the regulation of countries, defining national strategies, and driving the direction of policy making.As a Consultant/Senior Consultant in Strategy & Transformation Team, you will share your knowledge and experiences working in a team of diverse and talented professionals that enjoy designing innovative cybersecurity architectures, for market leading customers across Europe in diverse industries (Financial Services, Energy, Telecommunications Media & Technology, Life Sciences & Healthcare) as well as governments and public sector clients globally.You will thrive in an international environment, developing and managing innovative strategic initiatives for international customers and collaborating with colleagues belonging to different geographies and backgrounds.#YourRole Manage cybersecurity activities within wider projects, identifying, evaluating, and designing best in class cybersecurity solutions, demonstrating operational excellence, vision and strategic thinkingExecute complex project activities, coordinate part of the team while supporting your more senior colleagues in managing client relations and expectationsFace and solve customer challenges in innovative and effective wayLeverage on technology to provide innovation, operational excellence and new business models to customersEngage with internal and external stakeholders to strengthen business relations and create business opportunities
#WinningRequirements 2-6 years of experience, preferably in a Strategic Consulting company Solid expertise in Cyber Security Strategies, Cyber Security Assessment and BenchmarksFluent knowledge of English languagePassion and curiosity for the cybersecurity industry and technology trends, innovations and frameworks, as well as current IT security technologiesBe an independent and collaborative person who cooperates in one or more project teams to deliver high quality resultsPossess interpersonal skills and the ability to develop effective and lasting relationships with clients and colleaguesAbility to conduct complex analyses and communicate them clearly and concisely to target audiences of different cultures, technical backgrounds and levels of seniority
#ChooseDeloitteWe are committed to reduce our impacts and encourage people to behave in a sustainability way. To protect the environment and limit climate change, we developed the WorldClimate strategy, through which we set a goal of becoming a Net Zero.Join our #iAct movement! Here‚Äôs a quiz to know your carbon footprint and learn how to improve your green habits.Build your legacy with us. Aim higher: join Deloitte now!Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment processPrimary LocationMilanoOther LocationsTurin, Bologna, Roma, ItalyOrganizationCYBER RISK

About the job
            
 
As an Access Management Consultant, you will advise the management of various business units on Access Management at Bosch.You will provide support and advice to IT Application Owners in documenting and conceptualizing the authorization management processes for IT applications.You are responsible for the regular control of risky IT applications and authorizations in direct dialog with management.You will be responsible for creating, preparing, and analyzing information security-related reports and documenting core elements that must be retained.You train organizational positions in Access Management and cooperate internationally with Access Management and ISP organizations.You will evaluate site- or business unit-specific requirements and take over the monitoring of access risks in the support areas for which you are responsible.
Qualifications Education: Completed studies in the field of information technology, business informatics or comparable field of study.Personality: Strong communicator and team playerWork style: Independent, reliable, and able to present complex content in a focused and transparent manner.Experience: Initial work experience in IT environment, data protection consulting or risk management.Know-how: Professional handling of MS Office applications and reporting tools.Enthusiasm: IT affinity as well as fun in consulting.Languages: Very good knowledge of English, German language skills advantageous.
Additional Information Benefits:Your work-life balance is valuable to us, so we offer you: 25 Days of annual leave, because work-life balance is essential to us; Flexible working hours, but if you want to work from somewhere else, feel free, ourHome Officeprogram helps you do that;
Yourhealthandwell-beingis important to us, so we have you covered: Medical subscriptionAccident insuranceSport activities and well-being initiatives
We believe in aLife-Long Learningapproach, so you can take advantage of: Technical and soft skills trainings;Access to e-learning platformsLocal and Global career development programsOpportunity to attend conferencesBookster subscription
On top of these, we are offering: A monthly budget which can be used for several different services on an online benefit platformAnnual bonus
Ready to work?We live by our values, have an open feedback culture and there is plenty of room for innovative ideas. All because a team is only as valuable as its members.Application Process After you followed all the required steps on our platform, you will receive an e-mail for GDPR compliance. Only those applicants who give their agreement will receive a feedback from us.Any other questions? Feel free to e-mail me on Codruta.Pop@ro.bosch.com and I will come with an answer shortly.

company_name: Lux Consulting | Koplopers in de Energietransitie
job_description:
About the job
            
 
Welkom bij Lux Lux Consulting is een energiek consulting bedrijf (√©n Great Place to Work!) dat zich inzet voor bedrijven en organisaties die actief bijdragen aan de energietransitie van Nederland. Dit zijn bedrijven die koploper zijn in de energietransitie, net als Lux. Ons bedrijf draait op business consultants, allemaal gedreven om op hun eigen manier bij te dragen aan een betere wereld van morgen. Met raad en daad staan we bedrijven en organisaties bij om concrete stappen te zetten in de richting van een klimaatneutraal energiestelsel in 2050.  Ons team van consultants bestaat uit een club mensen met een hands-on mentaliteit. Wij leveren niet enkel een rapportage en een adviesrapport, maar wij dragen effectief bij aan het oplossen van de uitdaging van onze opdrachtgever. Wij zijn procesverbeteraars, agilisten, veranderaars en organisatoren. Wij zijn de mensen die zorgen dat het verschil wordt gemaakt.  Functieomschrijving Als Business Consultant bij Lux Consulting, ga je aan de slag bij toonaangevende opdrachtgevers zoals netbeheerders, energiebedrijven, traders, gemeenten en semioverheidsbedrijven. Je bent de link tussen strategie, business en operatie en continu op zoek naar verbeteringen bij de opdrachtgever. Daarnaast voel je je verantwoordelijk voor het projectresultaat, de begeleiding van de organisatie en bouw je relaties op met opdrachtgevers.‚ÄØJe analyseert, zoekt samen met onze klanten naar oplossingen en implementeert deze. Jij krijgt dingen voor elkaar en draagt daarmee bij aan de energietransitie!  Dit ben jij:  Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in de energiesector of in de energietransitie Het vermogen om snel de processen en systemen van klanten te doorgronden Ondernemend, gedreven en resultaatgericht met een sterke focus op kwaliteit Een proactieve houding, sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en analytisch vermogen Kennis en/of certificeringen op het gebied van Agile, Scrum of Lean Six Sigma Green/ Black belt zijn een pr√© 
 Werken bij Lux Werken bij Lux is meer dan alleen een baan. Wij hechten veel waarde aan ons team, waarbij sfeer, persoonlijke ontwikkeling en transparante communicatie centraal staan. Om deze reden organiseren we regelmatig Lux dagen, kennis sessies, tripjes, (in-company) trainingen en zijn we een gecertificeerde Great Place to Work (ja, dit is de tweede keer dat we dit zeggen in deze vacature maar we zijn er dan ook erg trots op!). Er zijn volop kansen om jezelf te ontwikkelen met je persoonlijke budget √©n om actief bij te dragen aan de groei van ons bedrijf. Als Business Consultant verwachten wij dat je actief bijdraagt aan de ontwikkeling van je collega‚Äôs, de manier waarop je dat doet is aan jou. Tot slot word je, door te werken bij Lux, ook een koploper in de energietransitie!  Dit bieden wij jou:  Een leuk team met een informele √©n professionele cultuur Teamuitjes (beurzen Parijs, Milaan, Wintersport etc.) Ondernemerschap belichten ‚Äì Meebouwen aan het bedrijf! Een passend salaris vanaf ‚Ç¨3.500,- Laptop en telefoon van zaak (telefoon ook priv√©) Auto van de zaak (vrij door Europa) 25 vakantiedagen (+1 dag per 2 dienstjaren) Premievrij pensioen 
Solliciteer bij Lux Lijkt je dit wat en wil jij ook een Lux‚Äôer worden? Stuur je motivatie en CV naar welkom.bij@luxconsulting.nl. Voor meer informatie, een kop koffie of bijpraten over de mogelijkheden kan je ook een berichtje sturen naar sanne.dieperink@luxconsulting.nl of bellen met 06-15698058. Wie weet tot snel!

About the job
            
 
En O2O tenemos un equipo especializado en ofrecer servicios de consultor√≠a en Digital Business y Digital Transformation, alineando las necesidades que negocio e IT tienen en √°reas como la innovaci√≥n, movilidad, ecommerce o digalizaci√≥n de procesos. Participamos en proyectos digitales multi-sectoriales, especialmente aquellos que son transaccionales, con operativa de negocio y de fidelizaci√≥n. Trabajamos con clientes en sectores como Travel, Banca/Seguros, Puntos de Venta y Deportes/Ocio. Para ello, contamos con diferentes soluciones propias para analiza las ventas, la generaci√≥n de tr√°fico y la evoluci√≥n de las campa√±as del canal digital en tiempo real. Deseamos poder incorporar a un Consultor de estrategia digital / Product Owner De ti esperamos:  Conocimiento y experiencia en la implementaci√≥n de proyectos de fidelizaci√≥n, CRM, estrategia de Loyalty y reglas de negocio e incentivo. Experiencia en proyectos y soluciones Martech que involucren data, trazabilidad, CDP, journeys y marketing automation. Experiencia co-creando con el cliente, aplicando metodolog√≠a Design Thinking y conceptualizando la estrategia de proyectos digitales. Colaboraci√≥n con el cliente en la definici√≥n y concreci√≥n de los objetivos del proyecto para tener una visi√≥n clara y definida de las entregas pactadas. Liderar los recursos necesarios para la definici√≥n exitosa del producto, donde aportar√° un contexto de negocio para el equipo de desarrollo de software priorizando funcionalidades bajo un enfoque √°gil. En colaboraci√≥n y coordinaci√≥n continua con las necesidades del cliente y el proyecto, proporcionar visi√≥n al equipo de desarrollo y a las partes interesadas durante todo el proyecto definiendo los requerimientos del Producto Definici√≥n y seguimiento del Product Backlog. Responsable de priorizar y ordenar el Product Backlog priorizando la entrega en base a valor de negocio. Elaborar dashboard y reportes acerca del progreso del producto y el impacto en el negocio. 
COMPETENCIAS NO T√âCNICAS: Habilidades de comunicaci√≥n verbal y escrita.Habilidades en la resoluci√≥n de conflictos. Motivaci√≥n. Capacidad de impacto e influencia. Comprensi√≥n interpersonal. Orientaci√≥n al logro.Pensamiento anal√≠tico. Flexibilidad.Preocupaci√≥n por la calidad y atenci√≥n al detalle. Autocontrol.Capacidad de multitarea.  FORMACI√ìN: Ingeniero Superior en inform√°tica, Administraci√≥n y Direcci√≥n de Empresas, Marketing, Publicidad, ... Formaci√≥n en E-business y negocio digital. Alto nivel de ingl√©s. Experiencia con Google Analytics. Conocimiento de metodolog√≠as √°giles. Deseable certificado Product Owner y Kanban. 
 Ofrecemos:   üèñ 25 d√≠as de vacaciones (los 23 que aparecen en nuestro convenio + 24 y 31 de diciembre). üì° Trabajo en remoto. About the job
            
 
In SimCorp, we assist some of the biggest financial institutions in the world to be fruitful by simplifying their investments, accounting, and operations.Our flagship product, SimCorp Dimension¬Æ, is a fully integrated front-to-back investment management solution, used by more than 200 clients located all over the world. It includes front office, middle office, back office data, and reporting solutions.SimCorp continuously enhances the portfolio of offerings to remain at the forefront of industry technology and trends. On top of this, over the last few years, we have been honing our service delivery and support model to implement SimCorp solutions to our clients and take ownership of running installations in the best possible way.This is why our Advanced Delivery Center (ADC) has been forged. First established in 2016 in Warsaw, Poland and extended to Manila, Philippines in 2021. Business Consultants in the ADC work, in close collaboration with our market units, on business functionality and solution workflows to tailor and deploy configuration of SimCorp Dimension to our customers.Why this role is important to us We are now looking for a Business Consultant to work in our IBOR team located in the ADC in Warsaw. As a Business Consultant, you will develop and carry out implementation plans in a client's environment. You will take part in delivery of SimCorp Dimension Operations Modules, including configuration, testing, documentation and giving trainings. You will act as a consultant for your clients and effectively handle, coordinate, and escalate issues as needed.What You Will Be Responsible For  Participate in all aspects of SimCorp Dimension implementations, including configuration, testing, documentation and training Document client‚Äôs requirements and map to SimCorp Dimension functions and processes, identifying process improvements and efficiencies where possible Design and deliver an overall solution set to meet client requirements, modelling operational workflows around SimCorp Dimension Delivering and customizing standard configuration solutions as well as designing and delivering new configurations Assist the client in development of overall test strategy and test plans and support the client in the execution of test cases, troubleshooting and resolving issues as they arise Provide configuration and end-user training, allowing the client to maintain SimCorp Dimension and optimize its usage Constantly expanding your knowledge of SimCorp Dimension and the clients' business in order to ensure that clients get the optimal configuration and workflow 
What We Value Your high-quality communication, coordination and interpersonal skills will enable you to direct all activities to success. As our preferred candidate, you will have: Degree/master's within Finance, Economics, Physics, Math, Science or Engineering Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience in the Financial Sector Knowledge of financial instruments and products, capital market and investments topics Understanding of middle-/back office day-to-day processing workflows Detailed understanding of at least one topic: transaction processing, reconciliation, settlement, SWIFT General Business Analysis exposure would be an asset High level understanding of requirements gathering sessions High level understanding of projects lifecycle as a team member You are result driven, creative, and analytical with a global perspective You are a focused, motivated individual working under minimum supervision You have high-quality communication skills especially in virtual collaboration You are fluent in English, any other languages (German, French, Spanish, Italian, Nordics) would be an asset Minimal knowledge of accounting topics (schemes, accounts, fund administration) would be an asset Technical IT knowledge and or experience (e.g., SQL, XML, XSLT, programming) would be an asset 
Benefits  Flexible working hours Private medical care (Medicover) Sharing the costs of sports activities (Multisport Card) Life insurance Possibility to develop your career in an international environment Professional training and courses (starting from a 3-week SimCorp Dimension¬Æ Academy) German and English language classes Integration events and charity projects 
In addition, we provide a good work & life balance and opportunities for professional development in an international environment: there is never just only one route - we offer an individual approach to professional development to support the direction you want to take. Visit our career pages to learn more about working at SimCorp: ‚ÄØ www.simcorp.com/career Next steps Please click below to apply. Get in touch with Hanna Brz√≥zka on hanna.brzozka@simcorp.com to learn more about the vacancy and what SimCorp has to offer regarding salary, benefits, and perks. Applications are continuously assessed. If you are interested in being a part of SimCorp but are not sure this role is the right fit, submit your CV anyway. SimCorp is on an exciting growth journey, and our Talent Acquisition Team is ready to assist you to discover the right role for you. The approximate time to consider your CV is three weeks.  We are eager to continually improve our talent acquisition process and make everyone‚Äôs experience positive and valuable. Therefore, during the process we will ask you to provide your feedback, which is highly appreciated. Who We Are For over 50 years, we have worked closely with investment and asset managers to become the world‚Äôs leading provider of integrated investment management solutions. We are 2,300+ colleagues with a broad range of nationalities, educations, professional experiences, ages, and backgrounds in general.  SimCorp is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a culture where diverse perspectives and expertise are integrated in our everyday work. We believe in the continual growth and development of our employees so that we can provide best-in-class solutions to our clients. While seeking to deliver client value, we believe it is vital to consider our people and our planet in every business decision we make. Acting responsibly is not optional. It is essential.

About the job
            
 
Reconomy Group is a fast-growing recycling and waste management, environmental compliance, and online returns business. Technology is key to Reconomy's business and the driving force behind our services.You will provide support and administration of applications in the field of return logistics, and will work closely with the Engineering Team and internal customers to manage and resolve any technical issues. The BC Consultant will be responsible for the management of RLG core business systems, as well as providing daily support, internal consultancy, and project related tasks. This position will also require strong communication skills to manage external partners and maintain documentation.Workplace Type : HybridKey Responsibilities:  Manage and support the ERP applications across the organization, ensuring that it meets business requirements and is configured to optimize performance. Act as a key point of contact for business users and stakeholders, providing advice and support on ERP related issues. Collaborate with business teams and stakeholders to identify and prioritize business requirements, and translate these into technical specifications for the development team. Manage and coordinate software releases, ensuring that they are delivered on time, to specification and to a high level of quality. Identify and resolve issues related to the business systems application, including troubleshooting, bug fixing and system maintenance. Develop and maintain technical documentation, including user guides, system manuals, ERP system architecture and technical specifications.External partner communication and control for focus companies and applications.
Required Skills: A recognized qualification in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or a related field, or able to show a comprehensive track record of managing business applications.A very good understanding of cross-departmental organizational and ideally business processes Experience in managing and supporting Navision & BC 365. Knowledge of T-SQL and experience in dealing with relational database systems. A high affinity for data & numbers as well as their analysis and processing. A pragmatic, goal and customer- oriented approach that achieves excellent results due to your quick comprehension and your good analytical skills. Familiarity with project management methodologies and software development processesStrong documentation and organizational skills.
Benefits The chance to bring your contribution to our goal of making the world a better place.Hybrid work model ‚Äì 2 days from our office from Grozavesti (we guarantee you will love to work with us), 3 days from home.21 days off for vacation leave + 2 days off for volunteering as we care about the society we live in.Meal tickets.Private health insurance at Regina Maria.A brand-new office in which we moved at the beginning of November.Fruit, tea and great coffee at the office.Great learning opportunities: internal & external training to keep you in touch with the latest technologies and the opportunities to apply your learning.A fun, informal and international environment where team spirit and teamwork is encouraged.

About the job
            
 
Change Consultant (medior) Dynamische en mensgerichte opdrachten binnen ons team Change.Functie/omschrijvingTijd voor verandering, Change Consultant. Bij Conclusion Consulting krijg je een baan met inhoud. Werk dat ertoe doet, zoals het: Uitvoeren, co√∂rdineren en borgen van de resultaten bij onderdelen van complexe verandertrajecten;Pragmatisch toepassen van verschillende soorten methodes en technieken bij deze verandertrajecten;Opbouwen en onderhouden van je relatienetwerk;Samenwerken en sparren met het management van onze klant;Delen van kennis met jouw collega‚Äôs;Bijdragen aan onze inhoudelijke ontwikkeling en profilering in de markt. Door bijvoorbeeld het organiseren van events en het innoveren en ontwikkelen van onze dienstverlening.
Hoe dit er concreet uitziet? Jij bent in staat het krachtenveld binnen een organisatie snel te begrijpen. En krijgt zo boven tafel welke verandering wordt gevraagd en welke roadmap daarvoor nodig is. Je hebt kennis van de ins en outs van het vak verandermanagement en met deze kennis ben jij d√© gesprekspartner bij opdrachtgevers. Van het vormgeven tot implementeren van strategische veranderingen zoals het veranderaspect bij implementatie van een nieuw ERP systeem of het herontwerp en implementatie van een nieuw organisatiemodel. Je hebt een goede visie op zowel de zachte als de harde kant van de verandering. Je laat zien hoe het anders kan. Laat jij een onvergetelijke indruk achter?Jou missen we nogJij bent te herkennen aan je inhoudelijke expertise, je enthousiasme voor de nieuwste ontwikkelingen binnen jouw markt en je kritische kijk op zaken. Je bent in staat om veranderstrategie√´n uit te voeren om de klant te ondersteunen in het behalen van de doelstellingen.Voor deze functie ben je vooral goed in het praktisch implementeren van (technologische) veranderingen binnen een organisatie, met een sterke focus op de menselijke maat. Anderen zijn er al genoeg, dus blijf vooral lekker jezelf. Dat is alles wat we vragen. Alhoewel, als Change Consultant heb je natuurlijk verstand van zaken, waaronder: Aantoonbare kennis en ervaring op het gebied van verandertrajecten en transformaties;Het vertalen van de inhoud in een concrete veranderroute en een interventieplan;Ervaring binnen consultancy;Ervaring in advisering en implementatie van verandertrajecten.
Voor deze functie heb je: Een afgeronde relevante hbo- wo-studie, bijvoorbeeld in (Technische) Bedrijfskunde, of Organisatiewetenschappen.Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift;Minimaal 4 jaar relevante ervaring, o.a. als consultant.
ArbeidsvoorwaardenOmdat wij erop vertrouwen dat jij uitblinkt als Change Consultant bieden we jou een contract voor onbepaalde tijd met daarbovenop: Een marktconform salaris dat past bij jouw ervaring en groeipotentie, inclusief een bonusregeling;Flexibele werktijden en het werken vanuit huis. Wij geloven in het effici√´nt indelen van je tijd en de juiste balans tussen werk en priv√©;Een leaseauto (of mobiliteitsregeling), zodat je voor elke opdrachtgever aan de slag kunt;De kans om te werken aan jouw persoonlijke kwaliteiten, groeipotentie en vakkennis bij onze eigen Academy;De mogelijkheid om door te groeien binnen Conclusion Consulting en ons ecosysteem;Een laptop en telefoon, inclusief thuiswerk- en internetvergoeding;De optie om gebruik te maken van onze collectieve pensioenregeling en ziektekostenverzekering;Wekelijks een borrel en maandelijks een uitgebreide borrel met band of dj op het hoofdkantoor in Utrecht;Mogelijkheden om te sporten en met collega‚Äôs deel te nemen aan sportevents zoals de Dam tot Damloop.
Bij Conclusion Consulting nemen we onze verantwoordelijkheid voor milieu en maatschappij. Met concrete initiatieven dragen wij bij aan ‚ÄòOngelijkheid verminderen‚Äô (SDG 10) en ‚ÄòKlimaatactie‚Äô (SDG 13).Trek je conclusie en solliciteerBenieuwd naar andere projecten die nu lopen? Ik, recruiter Iris Pitar, kan je er alles over vertellen. Je bereikt me via 06 - 22 88 39 58 en ipitar@conclusion.nl.Wij zijn altijd op zoek naar goede kandidaten, vandaar dat de vacature open blijft staan.Als Conclusion geloven wij in verschillen: in mensen, karakters, expertises. Juist die combinatie van verschillen verbindt ons en zorgt voor oplossingen die impact maken. Wij geloven in je. Gewoon, in wie jij bent. Want van anderen zijn er al genoeg. Het maakt ons daarom niet uit waar je geboren bent, waar je in gelooft of van wie je houdt. We zijn nieuwsgierig naar jouw talent en hoe jij het verschil maakt voor onze organisatie.Solliciteer je direct en heb je het juiste profiel, dan maken we snel een afspraak op een moment dat het jou uitkomt.

About the job
            
 
652099BRIntroductionAt IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.Your Role and ResponsibilitiesAdvises on the concepts of Analytics into a business, leading Clients through the Analytical Process. Influences Clients to take action, establish success measures, implement recommendations, and monitor results. Demonstrates strong quantitative skills, as well as strong business acumen and communications. Proficient in IT terminology and advancements, while simultaneously knowing the business language and dynamics to address challenges, establish methodologies, lead Clients through the process, prescribe a solution to solve the problem, communicate results, integrate them into the operations, and create results. Must be able to demonstrate and communicate results in a compelling way to realize the value.Required Technical and Professional Expertise OpenText Intelligent CapturePlanet IDAParadatec PROSAR-AIDAGerman Public Health InsuranceLanguages required: German, English
Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise Paradatec PROKEYAOK Systems oscare
About Business UnitIBM Consulting is IBM‚Äôs consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients‚Äô businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.Your Life @ IBMIn a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.Being an IBMer means you‚Äôll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you‚Äôll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.Are you ready to be an IBMer?About IBMIBM‚Äôs greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we‚Äôre also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it‚Äôs time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.Location StatementIBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

About the job
            
 
In a nutshellDo you want to be the missing link between business and IT? Do you like process modelling?As a Business Consultant, you the glue between the client and our technical team. You investigate business requirements and turn problems into opportunities. A good fit with the company is the most important for us. If there‚Äôs a match, we will shape your role in line with your talents and experience, within our project or product division or a combination of both.Tasks and responsibilities Communicate in-depth with the client in order to understand the business processes & needsEvaluate the customer‚Äôs business processes against the defined solution (as-is and to-be)Configure the defined solution to meet the customer‚Äôs needsGuide the client in changing his business processes, according to standard processesGuide a team of developers and/or partnersTake the lead in specific functional domains in accordance to best practicesCreate and execute functional test scenario‚Äôs & scripts, support the client during testingTrain colleagues, partners & (end)clients
 ProfileA good fit with the company is the most important for us. If there‚Äôs a match, we will shape your role in line with your talents and experience, within our project or product division or a combination of both. You have a master degree (e.g. in economics, business engineering: management information systems, etc.) or will graduate soonYou are a dynamic team player with excellent social, presentation & communication skillsYou are fluent in Dutch (native) and English; knowledge of other languages is a plusYou are flexible and like to travel within Belgium & the Netherlands. If you like to travel abroad, we can offer you international projects to work on.

job_title: Senior Business Consultant ‚Äì Investments and Front Office
job_description:
About the job
            
 
Who We AreFor over 50 years, we have worked closely with investment and asset managers to become the world‚Äôs leading provider of integrated investment management solutions. We are 2,300+ colleagues with a broad range of nationalities, education, professional experience, ages, and backgrounds in general. SimCorp is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering a culture where diverse perspectives and expertise are integrated in our everyday work. We believe in the continual growth and development of our employees, so that we can provide best-in-class solutions to our clients.‚ÄØWhile striving to deliver client value, we believe it is vital to consider our people and our planet in every business decision we make. Acting responsibly is not just optional, it is essential.Why this role is important to usIn SimCorp, we assist some of the biggest financial institutions in the world to be efficient by simplifying their investments, accounting, and operations. We do this through IT systems, processes, and financial knowledge. Implementing our software solutions by way of high-quality projects is at the core of what we do. To introduce our software to our clients and help enable them to reach their desired outcomes, business consultants are essential to us.As a Senior Business Consultant, you will be part of our team in EMEA Professional Services. The main purpose of the role is to contribute to the successful implementation of our software platform SimCorp Dimension¬Æ. You will own tasks throughout the implementation phases and be a trusted advisor to the client. You will mainly work remotely for projects in Germany, Switzerland, Austria or other EMEA locations. In addition, you will work with at least two process domains in the Investment and Front Office Service Line, including trading and order management, compliance, regulatory and internal restrictions, portfolio management, performance measurement and attribution, risk management (market and liquidity), regulatory topics such as Solvency II (incl. ORSA), as well as instrument valuation and analytics (theoretical pricing).During the three-week SimCorp Dimension¬Æ Academy, ‚Äòhands-on‚Äô experience with our software system will be a part of your onboarding. You are or will become a specialist within several areas in SimCorp Dimension.What You Will Be Responsible For Contributing to all aspects of SimCorp Dimension implementation projects Leading workstreams covering all required tasks, dependencies, and time/resource estimation Mapping to SimCorp Dimension functions and processes, as well as designing and configuring a customised solution Assisting the client in developing an overall test strategy, test plans, and in carrying out test cases Facilitating workshops to gather requirements for new and existing clients Mentoring, coaching, and helping colleagues to secure the project deliveries 
What we valueMost importantly, you can see yourself contributing and thriving in the position described above. How you gained the skills needed for doing that is less important. We expect you to excel at several of the following skills and be able to - and interested in - learning the rest. Effective consulting skills Experience with working in projects, e.g., software implementation projects Knowledge of financial instruments or the asset management business and processes Know-how in at least two of the following areas: trading and order management, compliance, regulatory and internal restrictions, portfolio management (equity, fixed income and derivatives), performance measurement and attribution, risk management (market and liquidity), regulatory topics such as Solvency II (incl. ORSA), instrument valuation and analytics (theoretical pricing) Enthusiasm to learn and use new software Good German and English skills 
BenefitsCompetitive salary, bonus scheme, and pension are essential for any work agreement. However, in SimCorp, we believe we can offer more. Therefore, in addition to the traditional benefit scheme, we provide an excellent work life balance and opportunities for professional development: there is never just one route - we offer an individual approach to professional development to support the direction you want to take. Visit our career pages to learn more about working at SimCorp:‚ÄØ www.simcorp.com/careerNext stepsPlease click below to apply or contact Rita Jeziorowski on rita.jeziorowski@simcorp.com to learn more about the vacancy and what SimCorp offers regarding salary, benefits and perks.Please note only applications sent through our system will be processed. Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your CV in English as soon as possible. If you are interested in being a part of SimCorp but are not sure this role is the right fit, submit your CV anyway. SimCorp is on an exciting growth journey, and our Talent Acquisition Team is ready to help you discover the right role for you. The approximate time to consider your CV is three weeks.We are eager to continually improve our talent acquisition process and make everyone‚Äôs experience positive and valuable. Therefore, during the process we will ask you to provide your feedback, which is highly appreciated

job_description:
About the job
            
 
We‚Äôre open to new ideas, and we welcome people who contribute and think for themselves. The more perspectives we draw on, the more innovative our work can be.We need people who think strategically and act pragmatically, who want to help shape the future, who identify with our values and outlook, and who are committed to our goals.People are our priority! job_title: Principal Consultant (m/f/d) - Allianz Consulting - Organization Transformation
job_description:
About the job
            
 
Who you will join:Allianz Consulting is the internal consulting division of the Allianz Group. Based in Munich, Paris, Milan, Trivandrum, Pune, Singapore, and New York, our dedicated global teams of over 500 consultants share a joint vision: to be the consulting partner of choice for Allianz Group core segments, transforming the future of Allianz from within. We bring deep industrial and functional expertise to fulfill our clients' needs, ranging from strategy, market management, sales and distribution, IT, organization, claims and operations to central functions and Agile methodologies.Within our Central Functions Practice Area, the Organization Transformation team combines expertise in organizational design, transformation, strategic and cultural change management, and a deep understanding of various business domains. We assist clients within the Allianz Group in addressing strategic challenges such as reimagining their organizational structures to enhance responsiveness, driving large-scale transformations, and shaping future-ready company cultures. Our work spans international contexts and involves collaborating with cross-functional teams on both short-term and long-term projects. We pride ourselves on our diversity, comprising individuals from various nationalities and backgrounds.Responsibilities: Design forward-looking, scalable, and innovative organizational models and solutions, whether in the context of digital transformation, strategic realignments, or M&A initiativesCreate project deliverables, including organizational assessments, recommendations for optimal organizational structures, project strategies, cost estimates, and moreContinuously enhance specialized content and consulting tools for our Organization Design servicesDepending on your level of seniority, oversee projects, project workstreams, or contribute to project tasks related to: Organization DesignOrganizational DevelopmentCultural Assessment and Cultural ChangeOrganizational Change Management, Project Training, and Project CommunicationPeople and Culture Strategy and HR Transformation

Required Skills and Qualifications: A master's degree in a relevant fieldMinimum 5 years of experience in operational business or management consultingProfessional experience that includes responsibility for project management and delivery within a leading consulting firm or in a role related to organizational design, organizational development, change management, or HRExperience in conceptualizing solutions, planning implementation, and supporting changes in the domains of organization transformation, digitalization, and process improvementExceptional project management abilitiesStrong analytical thinking skills and proficiency with data toolsFluency in English, with proficiency in German considered a plus

Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.
